description: The Taxi and Limousine Commission yesterday nullified a plan announced Wednesday by the Metropolitan Taxicab Board of Trade to provide group taxi service beginning Tuesday for Westchester County commuters stranded by the closing of Grand Central Terminal from 1:30 5:30 A.M.

title: GOSHEN TROT IS WON BY COLONIAL CHARM
description: GOSHEN, N. Y., July 5 (AP)  Colonial Charm, a 3yearold trotter, set a stakes and track record at Historic Track today during the fourth day of Grand Circuit harness racing.

title: Kleindienst and Dean Part In DeCarlo Case Queried
description: WASHINGTON, July 5Senator Henry M. Jackson charged today that Richard G. Kleindienst and John W. Dean 3d had bypassed normal procedures and safeguards in arranging executive clemency for a highranking organizedcrime figure, Angelo DeCarlo, after he served 19 months of a 12year sentence.

title: The Recruits Are Different And So Is Police Academy
description: It could have been a discussion group at any New York college. The 35 students smoked and drank coffee as they talked about the ethics of whether a nurse should accept a $10 tip from the family of a critically ill patient.

title: NIXON FUND LAWYERS PROMISE DISCLOSURE
description: WASHINGTON, July 5 (AP) Lawyers for President Nixon's campaign finance committee promised today to provide a full disclosure of the campaign's financing that took place before April 7, 1972.

title: U.S. Court Upholds Columbia Reactor Approved by A.E.C.
description: The United States Court of Appeals yesterday refused to review the Atomic Energy Commission's decision to grant Columbia University a license to operate a small nuclear reactor on Its Morningside Heights campus.

title: NIXON PROPOSING NEW SEC. HEAD
description: WASHINGTON, July 5 President Nixon is planning ,to name Ray D. Garrett, Chicago lawyer and securities regulation specialist, to be chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission. The appointment is expected to be announced from San Clemente, Calif., Saturday.

title: 400 SUPPORT SITIN AT FLATBUSH SCHOOL
description: Four hundred people thronged the auditorium of Public School 208 in East Flatbush, Brooklyn, last night to support the ninedayold sitin there by parents who are fighting to retain the current principal.

title: Television
Conyers Asks to Testify
description: WASHINGTON, July 5 (Reuters)  Representative John Conyers Jr., Democrat of Michigan, has asked the Senate Watergate committee to let him testify, sources close to the committee said today. Mr. Conyers was on the White House's socalled enemies list.

title: Holdouts Reach Accord In Strike of Writers Guild
description: LOS ANGELES, July 5 (AP) Representatives of the last striking members of the Writers Guild of America reached agreement on a new contract Thursday with the Association of Motion Picture and Television Producers.

title: Pennsy Seeks RealEstate Aide
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 5 (AP) The bankrupt Penn Central railroad wants to hire a Los Angeles businessman to handle more than $1billion in nonrail real estate assets.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: July 6, 1973

title: Football Transactions
description: CLEVELANDSigned Pole Adams, Southern California tackle, secondround draft choirs, to multiyear contract,

title: METS COME ALIVE, BEAT EXPOS, 73
description: MONTREAL, July 5For a change, the Mets got an outstanding performance from one of their, relief pitchers tonight and it was the difference as they salvaged the final game of the Montreal series with a 73 victory over the Expos.

title: 15 Hurt as Bus Overturns
description: COVINA, Calif., July 5 (UPI) A bus carrying 25 persons from the Pacific Coast Baptist Bible College ran through a road barrier yesterday and down a 100foot embankment, then overturned. Fifteen persons were injured, four seriously.

title: BIG BOARD SUSPENDS SECURITIES ANALYST
description: Paul It Standel, a former salesman and securities analyst for Oppenheimer & Co., has been barred for 18 months from employment by any member or member firm, the New York Stock Exchange said yesterday.

title: Major League Box Scores
I.R.S. Studies Profit Rises At Jersey Gas Stations
description: NEWARK, July 5The Internal Revenue Service has ordered its field investigators to look into charges by New Jersey motorists that gasoline stations are widening their profits despite the Federal price freeze.

title: Wine and Almonds in a Quick Fish Dish
description: In the menus below, the dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: JOSEPH L. MYLER, 68; U.P.I. SCIENCE WRITER
description: WASHINGTON, July 5 (UPI) Joseph L. Myler, longtime Washington science writer for United Press International until his retirement last December, and a pioneer reporter on atomic energy, died here today of cancer. He was 68 years old.

title: Compulsion of Public Testimony Is Upheld by Jersey High Court
description: TRENTON, July 6The State Supreme Court today upheld the right of the State Commission of Investigation to force witnesses to testify at public hearings.

title: British Jew Loses Court Suit Over Oxford Dictionary Entry
RISE IS APPROVED IN INTEREST RATES PAID ON SAVINGS
Right to Force Testimony In Public Hearing Upheld
description: TRENTON, July 5The State Supreme Court today upheld the right of the State Commission of Investigation to force witnesses to testify at public hearings. The court, in a 7to0 ruling that overturned a lower court decision, said the commission had been created to discover and to publicize the state of affairs in a criminal area, to the end that helpful legislation may be proposed and receive needed public support.

title: 5 Reported Held in Helsinki
description: HELSINKI, Finland, July 5 (UPI) The police today arrested four Americans and a Canadian of Estonian and Latvian descent for handing out antiSoviet leaflets in front of a hotel, a Latvian source said.

title: South Vietnam Says Jailed Labor Aides Helped Communists
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 5 (AP)The Government today accused four labor leaden including one who died prison, of being Communis agents and said those alive Would stand trial in a few days

title: Business Briefs
description: The Edison Electric Institute reported yesterday that the nation's electric utilities should have a 20.4 per cent margin of generating capability over demand this summer, compared with the 19.6 per cent margin last summer. The trade association predicted that the 1974 summer margin would rise to 22.3 per cent and then to 24.5 per cent in 1975.

title: A Couple of Fillies From Good Barn Win First Starts
description: Lou Rondinello, who trains the horses owned by the Darby Dan interests of John Galbreath, and of Galbreath's son, Dan, sent two fillies into the competition .at Aqueduct yesterday.

title: Two Brokers End Talks
description: Shearson, Hammill & Co., Inc., and Harris, Upham & Co., Inc., hava ended talks on a joint venture aimed at combining back  office operations of the two firms, it was disclosed yesterday.

title: Harness. Rock n Racing a Hit in Debut
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y. July 5They call it Rock & Racing, a bizarre but perhaps necessary wedding of rock music and harness racing.

title: Paris Opera Ballet Sort of Reconstructs La Sylphide
description: PARIS, July 5For years the Paris Opra Ballet has been the discreet and pained despair of the dance world. Now, recently, with the Paris Opra itself under the newly vigorous direction of the former Hamburg director, Rolf Liebermann, and the ballet under some kind of duumvirate consisting of Raymond Franchetti and Gerard Mulys, there has come some help.

title: Is It a Park?
description: In response to this growing interest and understanding, and in fact almost in reply to public pressures, New York City's Landmarks Law is in the process of being revised and broadened. Amendments under study now include, for the first time, the right to designate interiors and scenic landmarksfor example the Great Hall of the Metropolitan Museum, only recently sanitized, and all or parts of Central and Prospect Parks.

title: Controls Ordered on Exports Of 41 More Farm Commodities
description: WASHINGTON, July 5In move to protect domestic supplies, the Government imposed export controls today on a list of 41 additional agricultural commodities in the categories of livestock feed, edible oils and animal fats.

title: State Asks Right to Collect Damages From Polluters
description: TOMS RIVER, July 5 New Jersey today sought to establish its right to collect compensatory damages for environmental harm in a novel suit against the Jersey Central Power and Light Company.

title: New Forms of Therapy
description: A characteristic of medical progress lies in the everexpanding number of techniques that become available to advance the healing task of physicians and hospitals. Within a generation's span the sulfa drugs, then penicillin and other antibiotics, and still later the Salk and Sabin antipolio vaccines have been introduced. Today these and similar medications are standard; but the flow of new therapeutic techniques and media continues.

title: News Summary and Index FRIDAY, JULY 6, 1973
description: International Secretary of State William P. Rogers addressed the Conference on Security and Cooperation in Europe and took issue with the Sovietbloc view that the 35 member nations should concern themselves primarily with political issues. Mr. Rogers, in a lowkey speech, which supported the view of British Foreign Secretary Sir Alec DouglasHome, said the conference must not confirm barriers that still divide Europe, and hamper people and information from circulating between East and West. [Page 1. Column 1.]

title: Mrs. Chisholm Plans to Retire From Politics, Definitely by 76
description: WASHINGTON, July 5 Representative Shirley Chisholm, the first black woman in Congress, said today that she planned to retire from elective politics definitely by 1976, but I expect to get out before then.

title: Israeli Doctors Back From 29Day Strike
description: TE TELAVIV, July 5 (Reuters) Israel's 6,000 healthservice doctors returned to work today after a 29day strike for higher pay and improved working conditions.

title: ST. CLAIRBROMFIELD
description: St. Clair Bromfield, formen manager of the New York of f ice of the Burroughs Corpora tion, a manufacturer of office equipment, and head of its in ternational division, died Wed nesday in Elmhurst Genera Hospital, Queens. He was 85 years old and lived at 3315 80th Street, Jackson Heights Queens.

title: CERRO PLANS TALKS ON SALE OF UNIT
description: The Cerro Corporation said here yesterday that it expects to begin negotiations soon with the Peruvian Government over 1972 proposals to sell the Cerro de Pasco Corporation to the South American nation.

title: Explosion in a Butane Tank Car Kills 3 and Hurts 75 in Arizona
description: KINGMAN, Ariz., July 5 (UPI) A railroad tank car caught fire on a siding here today, setting off an explosion in a butane plant that the police said killed at least three perso?? and burned 75 others.

title: Colorado Replaces Trainer
description: BOULDER, Colo., July 5 (UN)  Richard Newton, 28 years old, will become head trainer for the University of Colorado Aug. 1, succeeding Monte Smith, who resigned.

title: Storm Here Snarls Traffic and Disrupts Subways
New Jersey Sports
description: NEWARK, July 5Althea Gibson feels that history can repeat. She learned to play tennis on the streets of Harlem, starting with a wooden paddle and working up to a more conventional recquet. She also worked her way up through the tennis rankings and won the Wimbledon and United States women's singles titles in 1957 and 1958.

title: American League
description: Friday, July 6, 1973

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
Bridge:
description: On many deals, the declarer must choose between two quite different plans: establishing dummy's suit, or ruffing losers. Sometimes the course of the defense may impose a change of plan, as on the diagramed deal, which proved decisive in the Westchester Double Knockout Team Championship, concluded recently.

title: CIVILIANS REMOVED IN TUNNEL DISPUTE
description: Civilians assigned to replace uniformed policemen in the Hudson River tunnels were removed last night following a truce in the dispute between the Perth Authority of New York and New Jersey and two unions that protested reassignment of the policemen.

title: LINDSAY CAMPAIGN IS STILL IN DEBT
CHARLES HOWELL, EX CONGRESSMAN
description: TRENTON, July 5Charles Robert Howell, United States Representative of Mercer and Burlington Counties from 1949 to 1955 and New Jersey Commissioner of Banking and Insurance from 1955 to 1969, died today in Mercer Hospital after a long illness. He was 69 years old and lived in Pennington.

title: U.S. LAWYERS HERE PROTEST A JUDGE
description: A series of decisions by Federal Judge Mark A. Costantino of the Eastern District of New York has prompted Government lawyers to complain to the Justice Department about the judge's performance, Federal sources said yesterday.

title: G.O.P. Bars Transit Fare As a Special Session Issue
description: The Republican leaders of the Legislature yesterday rejected proposals that the city's transitfare problem be taken up at this month's special legislative session, They said the issue should wait at least until after the new Mayor has been elected.

title: LINDSAY CAMPAIGN IS STILL IN DEBT
description: The LindsayforPresident campaigndead for more than a year now  still owes thousands of dollars in Wisconsin for rental cars, duplicating machines, hotel rooms and for a sheaf of parking tickets in Oshkosh.

title: Lachman Rebuts Criticism of the Board
GRAPHIC SCANNING DISPUTES CHARGES
description: Barry Yampol, president of the Graphic Scanning Corporation, said yesterday that his company would vigorously contest any complaint against it that might be filed with the Federal Communications Commission by the Western Union Corporation.

title: SinoAmerican Minuet
description: Relations between the Governments of the United States and the Chinese People's Republic are now routinely marked by such outstanding examples of reciprocal courtesy that observers must feel they are watching a stately and graceful minuet rather than the normal give and take of contemporary diplomatic relations.

title: Metreveli Beats Mayer In 4 Sets
Mrs. Chisholm Plans to Retire From Politics, Definitely by 76
description: WASHINGTON, July 5  Representative Shirley Chisholm, the first black woman in Congress, said today that she planned to retire from elective politics definitely by 1976, but I expect to get out before then.

title: SECURITY NATIONAL REPORTS DECLINE
description: The Security National Bank, Hempstead, L. I., announced yesterday a sharp drop in earnings for the second quarter and the first half of 1973. Patrick J. Clifford, chairman of the $2.1billion bank, attributed the decline in profitability to Governmental controls to hold down loan rates, at the same time that the bank's cost of money had been rising steeply.

title: Federal Reserve Statement
CREDIT MARKETS: PATTERN IS MIXED
description: Interest rates traced a mixed pattern yesterday in fairly light post holiday activity; the strong upward pressures prevailing in recent weeks seemed well contained. The Federal Reserve took an active role in prevent. ing some money rates from reaching new heights as it pur. chased Treasury bills for its own account and for a customer and twice injected tern. porary credit into the banking system through repurchase agreements.

title: Hockey Transactions
description: VANCOUVERSloned Don Tannehill, left wing; Bruce Bullock, goalle; Paul Sheard, right wing, and Paul O'Neil, renter.

title: Red Smith
description: The winter was almost snowless on Montana's western slopes and, with hardly any spring runoff to keep them green, the hills are already beige, except where mantled by the dark, dark green of ponderosa pine. In this premature summer, Skipper Lofting said, the salmon fly hatch had already come and gone. The Clearwater was finished for the year and the Blackfoot was lower than he had seen it at this season in 40 summers. Nevertheless the Lofting Expeditionary Force had assembled two men strong and. orders had been issued for a piscicidal offensive against the rainbow, brown and cutthroat trout inhabiting the lovely waters east of Missoula. With only a few days available, there could be no turning back.

title: New Bond Issues
Cambodians Regain Town, Only to Find Rebels Burned It
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, July 5 (AP)Attacking behind strafing runs by United States planes, Cambodian infantrymen fought today to dislodge the insurgents who cut Phnom Penh's road to the sea yesterday.

title: NASSAU COPTERS STOP 40 DRIVERS Crafts Radio Highway Patrol in a Coordinated Effort to Curtail Accidents
description: MINEOLA, L.I., July 5  A blue and orange helicopter containing a Nassau County Police Department pilot and an observer from the department's traffic division hovered over the Long Island Expressway yesterday afternoon near Plainview and was startled to see a van towing a boat overtaking heavy traffic in the speed lane.

title: RISE IS APPROVED IN INTEREST RATES PAID ON SAVINGS
description: WASHINGTON, July 5Commercial banks, savings banks and savings and loan associations will be allowed to pay higher interest rates to savers under decisions announced today by the three Federal financial regulatory agencies.

title: Women's Golf Is Postponed
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., July 5  The Women's Westchester and Fairfield Golf Association Robbins Memorial trophy tournament was postponed today I for the second week in a row. The match play versus par event at The Country Club of New Canaan was put off by this morning's rain an'd will be rescheduled later this month.

title: DUPONT ANDWALSTON SET COMBINATION
description: DuPont Glore Forgan, Inc., and Walston & Co., Inc., announced yesterday they had completed a combination of their business operations.

title: Legrand at Stylish Peak
description: The middle of the road was well trodden Wednesday night at the Newport Jazz Festival concerts in Carnegie Hall, with Michel Legrand, Sarah Vaughan and Stan Getz delighting a late show audience.

title: Syria Starts Dam Built With Soviet Aid
description: MEDINAT AL THAWRA, Syria, July 5The flow of the Euphrates River was halted today by a dam for the first time in its history.

title: Hijacked Argentine Airliner Lands Safely in Havana
description: HAVANA, July 5 (Reuters) A captured Argentine airliner with 28 people aboard landed here today, ending a hijacking drama that began yesterday morning.

title: BHUTTO PLANNING BID FOR AMERICAN ARMS
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, July 5President Zulfikar All Bhutto indicated tonight that he would ask President Nixon to resume the sale of military supplies to Pakistan.

title: Call for Bearded Lady Is Only HalfAnswered
description: A casting call yesterday for bearded ladies by Tom O'Horgan, the whirlwind force behind Lenny and Jesus Christ Superstar, did not require police action to contain the crowd. One bearded lady, very roughly speaking, showed up.

title: National League
description: Friday, July 6, 1973 YESTERDAY'S GAMES New York 7, Montreal 3 (n.). Atlanta 7, Houston 4 (n.). Philadelphia 7, Chicago 4. Pittsburgh 3, St. Louis 2 (twi.). San Diego 3, Los Angeles 0 (n.). Cincinnati 4, San Francisco 3 (n.). WEDNESDAY NIGHT Montreal 7, New York 5. Houston 11, Atlanta 4 (1st.). Houston 12, Atlanta 8 (2d.). San Diego 4, Los Angeles 2.

title: SOYBEAN PRODUCTS AND GRAINS FALL
description: A longexpected Protein War erupted yesterday on two fronts. On one front, Washington sought to conserve the nation's dwindling protein supplies by ordering export licensing for 41 agricultural products.

title: Housing Authority Warns Elevator Crews of Penalties
description: The city's Housing Authority amounced yesterday it would take disciplinary action against eleVator mechanics and helpers who refused to work overtime despite the health emergency declared by the authority.

title: Swan Lake Of Tradition Is Still Best
description: If you are as fed up with eccentrically conceived versions of Swan Lake as am, you will enjoy the American Ballet Theater's traditional version. It doesn't illuminate Freudian imbroglios or rely on trick plot twists, but it renders the romantic tragedy straightforwardly in lustrous fullness. It was presented for the first time this season at the State Theater on Wednesday evening.

title: StockLoan Alert Issued To Exchange Members
description: The New York Stock Exchange has alerted its member firms to take steps aimed at preventing abuses in connecion with stockloan activities.

title: As the World Sees It
description: If the President is liable to such lapses, into what traps may he have been led by Mr. Brezhnev? The question comes, not from one of the suspect laureates on the Presidential enemy list, but from the unexcitable and conservative Daily Telegraph of London.

title: Cranko beath Ruled Accident, Contradicting Suicide Report
description: DUBLIN, July 5 (AP)  John Cranko, ballet impresario; died accidentally last month and not from a suicidal overdose of drugs as some German newspapers said, Coroner Patrick Bofin ruled at an inquest yesterday.

title: TRADING IS SLOW IN AMEX SHARES
description: In continued slow trading, prices on the American Stock Exchange closed unchanged yesterday. Volume reached than the 1,980,000 shares on Tuesday. Both figures are only slightly higher than Monday's volume of 1,566,170 shares, the lowest in two years and 10 months.

title: Debbie Campbell in Final
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., July 5Debbie Campbell of Old Greenwich, Conn., and Sheila McInerney of Rome, N. Y., reached the 18years final of the Eastern junior tennis championships at the Port Washington Tennis Academy today. Miss Campbell defeated Barbara Goldman of Fort Lee, N. J., 75, 62, and Miss McInerney beat Ruta Gerulaitis of Howard Beach, Queens, 63, 63.

title: DRUG AIDE CHARY ON CURBING RAIDS
description: WASHINGTON, July 5The retiring head of the Government's drug abuse law enforcement office said today that he could not guarantee that drug raids on innocent people would be stopped.

title: F.B.I. Agent Briefs Wallace On Shooting Investigation
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., July (UPI)An F.B.I. agent briefed Gov. George C. Wallace today on the latest details of an investigation into the May 15, 1972, shooting of Mr. Wallace in Maryland.

title: BUSINESS LEADERS ASK CONTROLS END
description: WASHINGTON, July 5More than 30 business leaders told Nixon Administration policymakers today that it would be better to end wageprice controls than to go ahead with the Administration's plan for a Phase 4 that would be tougher than Phase 3.

title: State Reopens 22 Parole Cases Vetoed by Accused Psychiatrist
description: TRENTON, July 5 (AP)An investigation by the State. Parole Board has determined that 22 men who were denied parole primarily on the basis of opposition to their release by an indicted Trenton State Prison psychiatrist should have their cases reviewed.

title: ExNixon Aides May Face Indictments in Coast Plot
description: LOS ANGELES, July 5District Attorney Joseph P. Busch said today that he would seek indictments against former White House aides for conspiracy to break into the office of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg's former psychiatrist.

title: Company Reports
COUSINS'S WORLD WILL BE EXPANDED
description: World magazine has acquired the name and the circulation lists of the defunct Saturday Review magazines, and will start publishing as Saturday Review/World, a fortnightly, in September, Norman Cousins said yesterday.

title: Jazz Events
description: Following is a schedule of today's events in the Newport Jazz FestivalNew York:

title: The Dutch Are So Well Off They Are Discontented
description: AMSTERDAM, the NetherlandsMore than two decades of economic wellbeing and a highly developed socialwelfare system; an unrivaled degree of individual freedom within a stable political framework and a remarkable absence of tension with any other nation have made the Netherlands a country of discontent and unrest.

title: N.B.C. SETS SERIES OF NEWS SPECIALS
description: The National Broadcasting Company plans to televise 30 onehour news and documentary specials next season, including probable reports on the Black September Arab terrorist movement, on the frustrated whitecollar worker and on the problems of the new Navy.

title: Goalby Scores 2 Eagles En Route to 65 and Lead
description: MILWAUKEE, July 5 (AP) Bob Goalby scored two eagles on his way to a sevenunderpar 65 and the firstround lead in the 130,000 Greater Milwaukee open golf tournament today.

title: Military Coup in Rwanda Follows Tribal Dissension
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, July 5 (AP) The Government of the small central African country of Rwanda was overthrown today in a military coup d'etat after months of tribal unrest between the governing Hutu majority and the Tutsi minority.

title: Vatican Reasserts Dogma Of the Pope's Infallibility
description: ROME, July 5The Vatican Cutioned Roman Catholics sternly today against theologians who question the dogma of papal infallibility.

title: FRANCIS P. MURPHY
description: HYANNIS, Mass., July 5 Francis P. Murphy, former managing editor of The Worcester Telegram, died here yesterday while on vacation. He was 77 years old.

title: Firemen Defended by Chief
description: MISSION, Tex., July 5 (UPI) Mission's Fire chief, Ben Jackson, said today that his department had taken every precaution and it was just a faulty cracker that had fallen into a crowd at a fireworks display last night. The accident. killed two persons and injured 13 others.

title: Explosion in a Butane Tank Car Kills 4 and Hurts 75 in Arizona
description: KINGMAN, Ariz., July 5 (UPI) A railroad tank ar caught fire on a siding here today, setting off an explosion in a butane plant that the police said killed to least four persons and burned 75 others. Flames from the butane plant destroyed the Doxol bulk plant, a nearby tire sales company and a service station in this northwestern Arizona town.

title: WALTER SCHMIDT
description: MODESTO, Calif., July (AP)  Walter Joseph Schmidt, a catcher for the Pittsburgh Pirates from 1916 to 1924 and for the St. Louis Cardinals in 1925, died Wednesday night in a hospital here. He was 86 years old.

title: Turnpike Toll Violations Dip
description: HARTFORD, July 5 (AP) State Transportation Commissioner A. Earl Wood said today that there had been 13 toll violations on the Connecticut Turnpike since the elimination of automobile toll gates last June 26. Before the switch, Mr. Wood said, there had been an average of 1,100 violations daily.

title: N.A.A.C.P. PONDERS NIXON OUSTER BID
description: INDIANAPOLIS, July 5Delegates to the 64th convention of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People here have been asked to adopt a resolution calling for the impeachment of President Nixon, the resignation of Vice President Agnew and new Presidential elections.

title: Weekend Fishing and Boating Outlook
description: From Southern New Jersey to Rhode Island, marine fishing remained relatively stable the past week, with perhaps the most interesting news coming from Long Island where the first swordfish of the season were brought into Shinnecock and Montauk on rod and reel. The Montauk fish weighed 250 pounds, the other 236 pounds. The first white marlin of the year was also landed at Shinnecock, a 55pounder.

title: White House Denies President Thought Seriously of Resigning
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., July 5The White House maintained today its position that President Nixon was not considering resigning because of the Watergate disclosures. Gerald L. Warren, deputy White House press secretary, was asked today about a statement made by the President's daughter, Mrs. David Eisenbower, that early in May Mr. Nixon, playing devil's advo cate, asked his family if he should resign and we said no.

title: People in Sports: Oilers Finally Sign Matuszak
description: John Matuszak, the 6foot7inch, 280pound defensive tackle from Tampa University who was the No. 1 selection in last January's pro football draft, signed a multiyear, sixfigure contract with the Houston Oilers yesterday.

title: Amin's Watergate Note Draws an Icy U.S. Reply
description: WASHINGTON, July 5The United States has decided against sending a new ambassador to Uganda following Fourth of July message to President Nixon by President Idi Amin in which the African leader wished Mr. Nixon a speedy recovery from the Watergate affair.

title: 18Million Gas Contract Let
description: WASHINGTON, July 5 (AP) The Department of the Interior announced today the award of an $18.1million contract to the Institute of Gas Technology in Chicago to develop a process for making hydrogen gas from coal waste.

title: A ThreeRoom Tree House That Was Felled by a Building Code
description: BEDFORD, N. Y. Three years to build and three days to raze tells, in brief, the tale of Randal B. Chinnock's doit  yourself triangular tree house.

title: TEAMSTER CHIEF DENIES CHARGES
description: WASHINGTON, July 5  Frank E. Fitzsimmons, the president of the teamster's union, angrily assailed as a pack of damn lies today published reports that his union had helped funnel secret campaign funds from Las Vegas gambling interests to President Nixon s reelection campaign.

title: AID TO CRIMINAL LAID TO DETECTIVE
description: A police detective has been indicted on charges that he lied to a Federal grand jury by denying that he had supplied guns to a wanted criminal.

title: Minor Leagues
NEW CHIEF JURIST TO WIDEN BENCH
description: TRENTON, July 5 (AP)Pierre P. Garven, Governor Cahill's former counsel, who takes over Sept. 1 as Chief Justice of the New Jersey Supreme Court, today announced the addition of a new threeman appellate panel to handle the grovving backlog of appeals.

title: News Summary and Index
Tito, on Battlefield, Pays Tribute to Dead in Crucial 43 Conflict
description: TJENTISTE, Yugoslavia, July 4The Sutjeska River, a small, clear mountain stream, rippled fast over rocks and along a deep valley of rugged beauty. Hawks circled silently over forested slopes. Owls hooted in the earlymorning mist.

title: N.E.A. Votes Merger. Talks With Union
description: PORTLAND, Ore., July 5 The National Education Association voted today to open discussions on merger with the rival American Federation Of Teachers.

title: Dollar Continues to Slide; France Lifts Interest Rate
description: BONN, July 5  France announced today a series of antiinflation measures, including an increase in the nation's principal lending rate to 8.5 per cent from 7.5 per cent as the dollar continued to tumble to new lows in the currency markets.

title: 4 in Family and a Visitor Dead Of Stabbings in Newark Home
description: Four members of a family and a visitor from Philadelphia were found dead of stab wounds in a Newark home yesterday afternoon. The police reported no immediate suspects in what was apparently a rampage of killing by a single person.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: Winning numbers drawn on July 5 were:

title: SINGAPORE LIFTING SOME IMPORT DUTIES
description: SINGAPORE, July 5 (UPI) The Singapore Government to day announced that effective tomorrow import duties on long list of products from jam to electric kettles would be lifted.

title: H.E.W. HEAD CURBS STERILIZATION AID
description: WASHINGTON, July 5Caspar W. Weinberger, Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, has directed that no Federal funds can be used for involuntary sterilizations until detailed guidelines for such involuntary operations can be developed.

title: Texas U. Undercover Agent Held as Deserter Suspect
description: AUSTIN, Tex., July 5 (UPI) Ronald D. Nicholson was hired by the University of Texas police and planted in a dormitory to act as an undercover agent to find drug users and pushers. Now Mr. Nicholson has been arrested and charged as a deserter from the Navy.

title: Ted &
description: Three cheers for Edward Kennedyif his appearance on behalf of George Wallace really does lead toward Democratic party capable of attracting Wallace voters into a progressive national coalition. Boos and hisses for Edward Kennedyif, instead, his gesture is prelude to another historic national surrender to racism, cynicism and myopia.

title: Cousin of Nixon Dies
description: STATE COLLEGE, Pa., July 5 (AP)Leland Nixon, a cousin of President Nixon, died Tuesday at a hospital here. He was 46 years old, the son of Ernest Nixon, the President's uncle, and a past president of the Potato Growers Association of Pennsylvania.

title: PRIME LOAN RATE HEADS FOR 8%
description: The cost of business borrowing, which has skyrocketed recently, began to move even higher yesterday, amid serious concern in the financial community that a new credit crunch may be in the offing.

title: People and Business
description: John R. Ruppel has been named president of Fashion Fabrics, Inc., a fabric retailer with 126 stores in the United States and Canada. He succeeds John W. Boud, who continues as chairman and chief executive officer.

title: Compromise Near to Free Truce Aides
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, July 6Agreement is near on a compromise formula to free two Canadian officers missing for a week in a Vietcongcontrolled rubber plantation east of Saigon, officials of the International Commision of Control and Supervision said yesterday.

title: Allende Picks 7 New Ministers In a Major Reshuffle of Cabinet
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, July 5 (Reuters)  Chile's Marxist President, Dr. Salvador Allende Gossens, tonight named seven new Ministers in one of the biggest cabinet reshuffles since he took office in 1970.

title: June Sales Gained at Retail Chains
description: Consumers taking advantage of the 60day price freeze and satisfying demand for summer goods last month gave a dozen of the country's largest retailers substantial sales gains over June, 1972.

title: New PoliceFire Quarters Dedicated in Brooklyn
description: Mayor Lindsay took part in the dedication yesterday of a new police and fire building in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn. Dozens of residents of the community also attended the dedication ceremony for the brightly lighted, tilewalled quarters, which house in separate sections the 81st Precinct headquarters and Engine Company 222 and Battalion 37 of the Fire Department. The twostory, $2million building is at 3032 Ralph Avenue, between Quincy and Gates Avenues.

title: School Race Study Planned
description: WASHINGTON, July 5 (UPI) The United States Commission on Civil Rights said today it had awarded a $120,000 contract to the Rand Corporation to find out the effects of mixing races in schools.

title: Controls Ordered on Exports Of 41 More Farm Commodities
description: WASHINGTON, July 5In a move to protect domestic supplies, the Government imposed export controls today on a list of 41 additional agricultural commodities in the categories of livestock feed, edible oils and animal fats.

title: U.S. LAWYERS HERE PROTEST A JUDGE
description: A series of decisions by Federal Judge Mark A. Costantino of the Eastern District of New York has prompted Government lawyers to complain to the Justice Department about the judge's performance, Federal sources* aid yesterday.

title: ExRep. Whalley Indicted for Alleged Kickbacks
description: WASHINGTON, July 5 (AP) Former Representative J. Irving Whalley, Republican of Pennsylvania, was indicted by a Federal grand jury today on one count of mail fraud and two counts of obstruction of justice.

title: Books of The Times
description: SPEAK TO ME, DANCE WITH ME. By Agnes de Mille. 404 pages. AtlanticLittle, Brown. $8.95.

title: Sonic Beacon to Aid Ocean Study
description: ABOARD THE S.S. CANBERRA, At Sea, July 5The sonic counterpart of a lighthouse has been installed among the canyons of the midAtlantic where submersibles of France and the United States are to explore the volcanic activity that is creating new sea floors.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Sandy Lowe opened Threadbare Unlimited last fall because, she said, I thought I could make a congenial living out of it. Her shop in Greenwich Village specializes in weaving, a craft Mrs. Lowe mastered six years ago.

title: NEWAUTO SALES SHATTER RECORDS
description: DETROIT, July 5Americans bought a record of 6.1 million new cars in the first six months of 1973 and made June the fourth consecutive month in which buying has topped the 1 million mark.

title: RAIN FAILS TO STOP MET TOSCA IN PARK
description: Just as Enrico di Giuseppe was ready to begin singing E lucevan le stelle at the Sheep Meadow in Central Park on Tuesday night, a roof of umbrellas went up over the audience assembled for the Metropolitan Opera's concert performance of Puccini's Tosca. This aria about stars shining) brightly is in Act III, and by this time the devoted listeners had spent much of the evening with umbrellas raised. A bit more rain was not about to dampen their enthusiasm for hearing the work to the end.

title: S.E.C. Head Slated
description: President Nixon is planning to name a Chicago lawyer, Ray D. Garrett, as chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission. Details appear on Page 29.

title: Rise in Medicare Deduction To Be Rolled Back in Freeze
description: BALTIMORE, July 5 (AP)The Social Security Administration plans to roll back an increase in its Medicare deduction from monthly benefits because of President Nixon's 60day price freeze.

title: LISETER GOLD COIN TAKES PONY TITLE
description: COTUIT, Mass., July 5 Liseter Gold Coin, the defending national high point chainpion, barely won the small pony title from his stablemate, Chantilly, today at the Cape Cod Horse Show.

title: Storm Disrupts Subways, Highways and Rail Traffic
description: A severe earlymorning thunderstorm and cloudburst flooded roads and subway tracks yesterday, delaying tens of thousands of commuters on their way to work.

title: JOHN H. RYDER
description: John H. Ryder, former president of Norm Advertising, Inc., and of Local Trademarks, Inc., died in the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center on Tuesday. He was 82 years old and lived at 274 College Road in the Riverdale section of the Bronx.

title: A Jazz Night of Song That Did It by the Book
description: Just when it needed it most the Newport Jazz RsIlyal hit on a hugely successful formula in the concert that filled Philharmonic Hall on Tuesday night, and if credit is given where it is due the editors of the Oxford University Press would have to come out and take a bow. They published the book on which the concert was based.

title: Harmonica Turns Concert Into Party
description: The audience had been waiting restlessly for more than 30 minutes. The memory of Roberta Flack's earlier performance and the excitement generated were fading as a couple of disk jockeys banally promised the quick appearance of the soulrock group called War. Technicians on stage tinkered with equipment. It was late, nearly 11 P.M., on Wednesday at Shea Stadium, and by this time the Newport Jazz Festival concert was three hours old.

title: HONEYWELL IN TALKS FOR 2 SOVIET DEALS
description: MOSCOW, July 5 (UPI)  Honeywell, Inc., is discussing two multimilliondollar agreements with the Soviet Union and expects to get permission to open an office in Moscow, James Binger, chairman, said today.

title: ExNixon Aides May Face Indictments in Coast Plot
description: LOS ANGELES, July 5District Attorney Joseph P. Busch said today that he would seek indictments against former White House aides for conspiracy to break into the office of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg's former psychiatrist.

title: California Bar Asks Data on Ehrlichman and 4 Others
Washington Varsity Eight Gains Henley Semifinals
description: HENLEYONTHAMES, England, July (AP)The University of Washington's varsity eight gained the semifinals today of the Grand Challenge Cup, the premier event at the Henley Royal Regatta,, and 12 other American entries survived elimination on the River Thames course.

title: Advertising: Forecast is Good
description: One week into the second half of the year, the people who run the nation's largest ad agencies can look back and say the first half wasn't all that bad.

title: Harry Oliver, Oscar Winner For Art Direction, Is Dead
description: WOODLAND HILLS, Calif., July 5 (UPI)  Harry Oliver, who won two Oscars for movie art direction but then gave up Hollywood to become a desert hermit, died yesterday at the Motion Picture Country House and Hospital. He was 85 years old.

title: ROGERS STRESSES HUMAN OBJECTIVE OF HELSINKI TALKS
description: HELSINKI, Finland, July 5 Secretary of State William P. Rogers said today that the Conference on Security and Cooperation in Europe must not confirm barriers that still divide Europe.

title: TV: Burns and Schreiber Visit on Saturday Nights
Vatican Reasserts Dogma Of the Pope's Infallibility
description: ROME, July 5The Vatican cautioned Roman Catholics sternly today against theologians who question the dogma of papal infallibility.

title: MEDIATOR NAMED IN LAWYER STRIKE No Progress Is Reported Legal Aid Dispute
description: Francis Ellis Rivers, a retired Civil Court judge, was named yesterday as a special mediator to seek a settlement of the strike here of more than 400 Legal Aid Society lawyers.

title: U.S. Treasurer's Plant Faces N.L.R.B. Test
description: GARDENA, Calif., July 5A food products company owned by the family of United States Treasurer Romana A. Banuelos was disclosed today to be facing Government court action, for alleged reprisals against employes who joined a 10month, strike by the teamsters union.

title: I.R.S. FILES OPENED IN EXEMPTION PLEA
description: WASHINGTON, July 5  A Federal judge ordered the Internal Revenue Service today to permit an organization that has been denied taxexempt status to examine I.R.S.' own files in the case.

title: ROGERS STRESSES HUMAN OBJECTIVE OF HELSINKI TALKS
description: HELSINKI, Finland, July 5Secretary of State. William P. Rogers said today that the Conference on Security and Cooperation in Europe must not confirm barriers that still divide Europe.

title: Amin's Watergate Note Draws an Icy U.S. Reply
description: WASHINGTON, July 5The United States has decided against sending a new ambassador to Uganda following Fourth of July message to President Nixon by President Idi Amin in which the African leader wished Mr. Nixon a speedy recovery from the Watergate affair.

title: DRUG AIDE CHARY ON CURBING RAIDS
description: WASHINGTON, July 5The retiring head of the Government's drug abuse law enforcement office said today that he could not guarantee that drug raids on innocent people would be stopped.

title: Mail Deliveries Bedeviling New Suburbs
description: RIDGE, L. I., July 5  About eight months ago Grace and Dominic Ferlito moved into their twobedroom duplex condominium in this small rural community in the Town of Brookhaven.

title: ERIC HATCH DIES; NOVELIST WAS 71
description: LITCHFIELD, Conn., July 5  Eric Hatch, novelist, died last evening in Charlotte Hungerford Hospital in Torrington. He was 71 years old and lived here.

title: Mixon Trio's Zesty Pace Begins a Sparkling Bill
description: The Danny Mixon Trio opened five hours of firstfate music Tuesday night at Alice Tully Hall with a splendid display of talent and maturity. And the Ted Daniel Sextet wound up the third night of concerts at Tully by relatively unknown musicians with an equally impressive display of mature jazz musicians who bring all aspects of modern and past music to their contemporary sounds.

title: LEONID STEIN DEAD
description: MOSCOW, July 5Leonid Stein three times Soviet chess champion, died here yesterday at the age of 39.

title: Hickel Faults Nixon on Watergate
description: ANCHORAGE, July 5In the opinion of Walter J. Hickel, President Nixon is responsible for the Watergate scandals whether or not he knew about the acts in advance.

title: Capital Begins to Save EnergyBy Reducing Lights and Cooling
description: WASHINGTON, July 5 The lights are going out and the temperatures are going up in Government buildings in response to President Nixon's call to save energy.

title: ANACONDA CO. PLANS A NEW COPPER MINE
description: The Anaconda Company announced yesterday that it planned to begin development of anew openpit copper mine about 80 miles northeast of Ely in northeastern Nevada. The new mine, designated the Victoria mine, is located in the Antelope mountain range west of the Utah border.

title: 4 in Family and a Visitor Dead Of Stabbings in Newark Home
description: Four members of a Newark family, ranging in age from woman in her late 50's to a 6yearold greatgrandson, were found dead of multiple stab wounds yesterday afternoon. A fifth victim, a young woman believed to be a visitor from Philadelphia, was also found stabbed to death in the house.

title: Screen: Shinjuku Burglar Arrives
Aqueduct Race Charts
description: Today's Entries at Aqueduct

title: Debbie Campbell in Final
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., July 5Debbie Campbell of Old Grenwich, Conn., and Sheila McInerney of Rome, N. Y., reached the 18years final of the Eastern junior tennis championships at the Port Washington Tennis Academy today. Miss Campbell defeated Barbara Goldman of Fort Lee, N. J., 75, 62, and Miss McInerney beat Ruta Gerulaitis of Howard Beach, Queens, 63, 63.

title: Dow Climbs Slightly in Slow Trading
description: The stock market drifted sideways yesterday in slow trading and closed with minor price changes.

title: Table for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New York
Funeral for Betty Grable Attended by 600 on Coast
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif., July 5 (AP)About 600 people attended a funeral service today for Betty Grable, the girl with the golden legs.

title: Kosygin Says Plight of 80 Jews In Vienna Is No Fault of Soviet
description: VIENNA, July 5 (Reuters) The Soviet Premier, Aleksei N. Kosygin, said today that he was aware of the problems faced by Jews wanting to return to Russia after spending some years in Israel.

title: G.O.P. Bars Transit Fare As a Special Session Issue
description: The Republican leaders of the Legislature yesterday rejected proposals that the city's transitfare problem be taken up at this month's special legislative session. They said the issue should wait at least until after the new Mayor has been elected.

title: The Recruits Are Different And So Is Police Academy
description: It could have been a discussion group at any New York college. The 35 students smoked and drank coffee as they talked about the ethics of whether a nurse should accept a $10 tip from the family of, a critically ill patient.

title: Couple Adrift on Raft 117 Days Rescued Off Guatemalan Coast
description: SEOUL, South Korea, July 5 (UPI)A British couple who spent 117 days adrift on a life raft in the Pacific have been rescued by a South Korean fishing boat, the ship's captain reported yesterday.

title: Chavez Hints Aid to G.O.P. Is Linked to Alien Problem
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., July 5 (UPI) Cesar Chavez said today that he had asked the Justice Department to investigate a possible correlation between big donations to the Republican party and the Immigration and Naturalization Service's alleged lack of enforcement against illegal Mexican farm workers.

title: REFORM SCHOOLS LIMITED BY COURT TO DELINQUENTS
description: In a major victory for critics of the juvenilejustice system here, the state Court of Appeals has struck down the practice of placing children who are accused of no crime in reform schools with children who have been convicted of such crimes as murder and robbery.

title: Town With 3Acre Zoning Minimum Ordered to Allow Garden Apartments
description: HARDING TOWNSHIP, July 5Well kept roads wind through litterfree woodland and orchards, past estates and luxurious suburban dwellings with long intimidating driveways marked private road or no trespassing, and past rural mailboxes bearing such names as Deer Ridge.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor. East Germany has applied for membership in the United Nations, and unless we have completely abandoned our moral principles, we will oppose it.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: JOUST FOLKS There's a medieval wingding scheduled for tomorrow and Sunday in Staten Island and you are invited, provided you'll dress for it. You must wear garb reminiscent of any culture up to the year 1650, which covers a multitude of raiment. From 11 to 6 tomorrow, the Medieval Tournament features jousting, 30 to horseless knights in combat, with the finals from 10 to 3 on Sunday. The outdoor activity is free. An appropriate costume could include a long blouse and shorts for men and a long dress with sleeves for the women.

title: G.O.P. IS ACCUSED IN FETE TO AGNEW
description: WASHINGTON, July 5President Nixon's main reelection finance committee and officials of a Republican finance committee in Maryland were accused today of five apparent violations of the Federal campaign spending law.

title: Fort Worth Five Lose Plea For Writ to Get Out of Jail
description: FORT WORTH, July 5 (Reuters)The Fort Worth Five were refused today a writ of habeas corpus to free them from jail for refusing to testify before a grand jury investigating gunrunning to Northern Ireland.

title: LISETER GOLD COIN TAKES PONY TITLE
description: COTUIT, Mass., July 5 Liseter Gold Coin, the defending national high point champion, barely won the small pony title from his stablemate, Chantilly, today at the Cape Cod Horse Show.

title: Conspirator in Plot Against National Monuments Is Among 5 Held Here on WeaponsSupply Charge
description: Four men and a woman allegedly involved in an underground weaponssupply ring were arrested yesterday in the Fast Village after one of them allegedly sold 11 hand grenades to an undercover detective on the sidewalk in front of 390 East 10th Street.

title: McIntyre's Aide Quits to Run For Cotton's Seat in Senate
description: CONCORD, N. H., July 5 Larry K. Smith, administrative assistant to Senator Thomas J. McIntyre, resigned today and announced that he would seek the Democratic nomination for United States Senator from New Hampshire.

title: Mrs. Dana C. Backus, 66 , Dead; A Leader in World Peace Drive
description: Mrs. Louise Laidlaw Backus, an author and a leader for many . years in efforts to promote international organization and peace, died yesterday of cancer in Memorial Hospital. She was 66 years old and lived at Sands Point, L.I.

title: E.P.A. ACTS TO CURB WATER POLLUTANTS
description: WASHINGTON, July 5 (AP) The Environmental Protection Agency announced today a proposted list of toxic pollutants that would be the basis for limiting discharges of these substances into United States waters,

title: Weekend Fishing and Boating Outlook
The Shaky Dollar: Its Troubles Are Also Political
description: WASHINGTONThe troubles of the dollar are only one expression of fundamental economic and political dislocation within the postwar PanAtlantic international system. This dislocation, or crisis, has been gathering force since the early nineteensixties. The monetary crisis has its own technical economic causes and explanations. But as the monetary system itself is only part of an overall international order, political as well as economic, so the monetary system's present problems are deeply political as well as economic.

title: For the Attorney General
description: For over three years I have tried to shut out any involvement in the at tempts to achieve some sort of justice regarding the killing of my son, Jeff, and the three other studentsand the wounding of the othersat Kent State on May 4, 1970. My reason for hiding out was a combination of cowardice and disillusionment.

title: Roundup: Aaron Sits, 3 Braves Homer
description: Henry Aaron is not the only homerun hitter on the Atlanta Braves, it just seems that way because he is rapidly closing in on Babe Ruth's record 714.

title: BROKERS BILKED BY GAMBLING RING
description: District Attorney Mario Merola of the Bronx announced yesterday the indictment of eight men charged with being part of a multimilliondollar gambling, loansharking and extortion ring that preyed on Wall Street stockbrokers and executives.

title: Basketball Transactions
description: CAPITALSigned Mark Jellison, Northeastern toward, eighth round draft choice, KANSAS CITY OMAHASigned Mike D'Antony, Marshall guard, second round draft choice, to four year contract.

title: Foster of Cedar Point Y.C. Wins Law Trophy on Sound
Radio
description: 8:05.10 A,M., WNCN. Scherzo in B minor, Mendelssohn; Fanfare live le Roi, Des Pres; Etude in G flat, Chopin; Slavic March, Nelhybel; Symphony No, 99, Haydn; Love in Bath, HandelBeecham.

title: Newport Jazz
description: New Orleans, Ragtime and Stride was the catchall title of the Newport Jazz festival's concert Wednesday evening at Philharmonic Hall but the honors and the joys all went to New Orleans. The city was represented by the music of a native son, Jelly Roll Morton, and by performances by Percy Humphrey's Preservation Hall Band, most of whose members are also natives of New Orleans.

title: JUDGE DRAWS IRE OF U.S. LAWYERS
description: damaged the case of the Government.

title: Dance: Younger Bolshoi Star Shines
description: If a shrewd impressario wished to attract young people to ballet he would send them to see Alexander Godunov, one of the Bolshoi Ballet's younger stars, in the Don Quixote grand pas de deux.

title: 12Weekend Sentence Vacated;
description: A sentence of 12 weekends in jail, meted out on May 15 to a man convicted of possessing stolen property, was vacated yesterday after the defendant had tried and failed three times to start serving his time in jail.

title: S.E.C. Head Slated
description: President Nixon is planning to name a Chicago lawyer, Ray D. Garrett, as chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission. Details appear on Page 29.

title: SIHANOUK SPURNS KISSINGER TALKS
description: PEKING, July 5 (AP)Prince Norodom Sihanouk, chief of the Cambodian government in exile, said here today that he had no intention of meeting with Henry A. Kissinger when he comes to Peking.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Atlanta Braves, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 8 P.M.

title: Mets Say Berra's Job Is Safe Unless Fans Say Othewise
description: The mauled Mets return to New York today after a week of nightmares and will face Henry Aaron, the Atlanta Braves and new questions about Yogi Berra's jobwhich the management insisted yesterday was safe for the time being.

title: Mediator Presses Effort To End Cemetery Strike
description: Vincent D. McDonnell, chairman of the State Mediation Board, continued by telephone last night efforts to arrange an agreement to end the cemetery workers' strike before noon today, possibly averting a 30day jail sentence for Sam Cimaglia, president of the Cemetery and Green Attendants' Union.

title: McIntyre's Aide Quits to Run For Cotton's Seat in Senate
description: CONCORD, N. H., July 5 Larry K. Smith, administrative assistant to Senator Thomas J. McIntyre, resigned today and announced that he would seek the Democratic nomination for United States Senator from New Hampshire.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: OSLO, Norway, July 5 (UPI)Filbert Bayi of Tanzania won the 1,500meter run in an international track and field meet tonight, finishing in 3 minutes 37.5 seconds. Dave Wottle, the Olympic 800me ter champion, was fourth in 3:40.4 and Rick Albright eighth in 3:44.8. They were the only Americans to compete. Steve Prefontaine was entered for the 3,000 meters, but did not start, saying he was injured.

title: PRISON MUTINIES SWEEP ARGENTINA Revolts Tied to Peronists' Victory in Election
description: BUENOS AIRES, July 5  More than 2,000 prisoners here entered the fifth day of a hunger strike today to support their demands for release or a reduction in their sentences.

title: Cyprus Synod Set to Try 3 Accusers of Makarios
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, July 5 (AP) With Byzantine pomp and ceremony a major synod of the Eastern Greek Orthodox Church opened here today to try three dissident bishops of the Cypriote Church.

title: CHICK HAFEY, 69, DIES, LONG A BALL STAR
description: NAPA, Calif., July 5 (UPI) Charles (Chick) Hafey, former star outfielder for the St. Louis Cardinals who was elected to baseball's Hall of Fame in 1971, died Monday. He was 69 years old.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The Passaic County Prosecutor. John D. J. Gourley, said his office would try another approach to stop the showing of Xrated movies at the Montauk Theater in Passaic.

title: What's a Landmark?
description: Pity the poor Landmarks Preservation Commission. designates landmarks, and if the owner doesn't like it, he goes to court. And if the court doesn't like it, as in the case of the Morgan House on Madison Avenue, where the Appellate Division of the New York Supreme Court has voided the landmark designation, the commission can prepare to fight a host of other battles, or stop designating.

title: Events Today
description: METROPOLITAN OPERA, Strauss's Dle Fledermaus. Louis Armstrong Memorial Stadium (formerly Singer Bowl), Flushing Meadows, 8:30.

title: WILLIAM B. TIPPY
description: ROCHESTER, July 6  (AP) William B. Tippy, a retired consultant and utilitycompany executive, died of a heart attack yesterday near his home in suburban Greece. He was 64 years old.

title: Police Tow Trucks Blitz Three Areas
description: The Police Department's blitz force against parking violators deployed up to 50 tow trucks yesterday, sweeping midtown and the Foley Squarearea with telling effect but faltering in freewheeling Greenwich Village.

title: 6 Golf Carts and House Trailer Are Bought for San Clemente
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 6 (UPI)The General Services Administration said today that six expensive golf carts and a house trailer, for changing clothes at the beach, had been purchased at the order of the Secret Service for use at the Western White House at San Clemente.

title: ExP.O.W. Says He Made Antiwar Statements Freely
description: PORTLAND, Ore., July 6 (UPI)A former prisoner of war who was charged by a fellow prisoner with conspiracy admitted today that he voluntarily made antiwar broadcasts in captivity and said that he would do it again.

title: 5,000Gallon Oil Spill WashesOnto Shore of Smithtown Bay
description: A 5,000gallon oil spill bepan washing ashore yesterday in the Smithtown Bay area on the North Shore of Long Island, alOng a 13mile stretch between gatons Neck Point and Crane Neck Point, the Coast Guard reported.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Beginning today, utility companies will be barred from manhole and streetopening work during the busy daytime hours in the city's central business districts, Acting Transportation Administrator Manuel Carballo announced. He said new regulations specified that such work, with the exception of emergencies, or for roundtheclock work, would have to be done between 7 P.M. and 7 A.M. on weekdays. There are no restrictions for Saturday or Sunday operations, he said.

title: Jehovah's Witnesses Convening in Yankee Stadium
description: A brightorange dais covered second base at Yankee Stadium last night and the pitcher's mound was transformed into a multicolored floral centerpiece as 60,000 Jehovah's Witnesses opened their five  day Divine Victory assembly.

title: A Family Where Idle Hands Don't Have a Chance
description: Everything in this house was made by somebody except the chair you're sitting on, said Lee Robbins, 21, waving an arm around to take in the four rooms on the first floor and the children's bedrooms on the second.

title: Bridge: The Obscure Delayed Double Can Be Helpfulto Declarer
description: An obscure bid for many players is the delayed double, made by a player who at his first turn passed an opening bid made on his right. Whether such doubles are for penalties or for takeout depends on the opener's rebid.

title: Tough Antidrug Law Signed By Governor in Delaware
description: DOVER, Del., July 6 (UPI) Gov. Sherman Tribbett has signed into law one of the toughest measures in the nation against unaddicted heroin and cocaine pushers, but the statute may be difficult to enforce.

title: H. VON BARAVALLE
description: Hermann von Baravalle, chairman of the Ade1phi College mathematics department from 1943 to 1954 and a founding teacher of the Rudolf Steiner schools, died yesterday in Freiburg, Germany. His age was 75.

title: NORTHEASTERN U. IN HENLEY FINAL
description: HENLEYONTHAMES, England, July 6 (AP)Northeastern University's varsity eight defeated its rival from the University of Wisconsin today and reached the final of the Henley Regatta's coveted Grand Challenge Cup for the second straight year.

title: COLSON DESCRIBES WHITE HOUSE LISTS
description: CHICAGO, July 6 (AP)A former White House aide, Charles W. Colson, said today that a list of 200 political opponents of the Nixon Administration had ben kept in his office.

title: POLICE REBUFFED IN PROTEST ON PAY
HTest Cloud on Coast
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (AP) Portions of the highaltitude cloud from China's Hbomb test June 26 began crossing the Northern California Coast late yesterday, the Atomic Energy Commission said today.

title: Stage: Houdini in Lenox
description: LENOX, Mass., July 6 Among the cultural and entertainment purveyors in the Berkshires, the Lenox Art Center is an infant just now beginning its third season. But what a lusty infant! Last year it offered among other things the premiere of Dr. Selavy's Magic Theater and a splendid production of The Mother of Us All. This year it has moved into lavish new quarters and will present four new musictheater works and a series of chamber music concerts.

title: U. S. Urging Phnom Penh To Show It Can Survive
description: Special to Me New York Times

title: Japan Asks North Vietnam To Open Talks on Relations
description: TOKYO, July 6 (Reuters) Japan has asked North Vietnam to open negotiations on establishing diplomatic relations between the two countries, a Government spokesman said today.

title: 2d Phase of European Talks Due Sept. 18
description: HELSINKI, Finland, July 6 The Conference on Security and Cooperation in Europe today finished its week of policy statements by the foreign ministers of the 35 participants and informally agreed at the closed sessions to begin its seccond phase in Geneva on Sept.I 18, according to participants1 A communique remains to be agreed upon, and another session is scheduled for tomorrow.

title: Phantom Security
description: The sharply reduced foreign military aid bill as passed recently by the Senate represents a timely attempt to exercise some restraint over a new Administration drive to boost sales of sophisticated military equipment to nations in the Middle East, Latin America and perhaps elsewhere.

title: Bethpage Triumphs in Polo Over Myopia on Guest Goal
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., July 6  Fred Guest's goal after three minutes of a suddendeath overtime today gave Bethpage a 43 victory over the defending champion, Myopia of Boston, in the semifinals of the United States Polo Association's Northeastern Circuit tournament at Bethpage State Park.

title: Antiques: Busy Needles
Gravediggers Reach Accord, Ending Their 27Day Walkout
description: The 27day strike of cemetery workers in the metropolitan area was ended yesterday with a settlement reached only a matter of hours before the leader of the 1,700man striking union was to be jailed for continuing the walkout.

title: Talks Begun in Strike By LegalAid Lawyers
description: Representatives of the Legal. Aid Society and the Association of Legal Aid Attorneys met late yesterday afternoon for their first negotiating session since a strike by the society's 400 lawyers began last Monday.

title: Table for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New York
Wholesale Prices Up 2.3%; Jobless Rate Falls to 4.8%
description: WASHINGTON, July 6Unemployment declined in June but wholesale prices continued to rise rapidly, the Labor Department reported today.

title: A Speed Trap Backfires
description: LONDON (AP)  A former police chief, Harry Sanders, who helped introduce radar traps in Britain before retiring, was caught in a radar trap and fined $25 for speeding.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
Tap Reportedly Put On Kopechne Phone After the Drowning
description: WASHINGTON, July 6Soon after Mary Jo Kopechne drowned in Senator Edward M. Kennedy's car on Chappaquiddick Island on July 18, 1969, an illegal wiretap was placed on the phone in the Georgetown house where she had lived with three other girls, according to a source close to the Senate Watergate investigating committee.

title: Dance: A Treasure of Ballet Theater
description: American Ballet Theater rightly numbers among its select treasures the ballets of Antony Tudor, and among them Lilac Garden, with its desperately muted passion, has a special place of favor. Thursday evening at State Theater it was performed in a way that gave clear overall reading to the choreography,

title: Wally Westrnore, MakeUp Man In Hollywood 45 Years, Is Dead
description: HOLLYWOOD, July 6 (UPI) Walter J Westmore, one of six brothers who dominated the moviemaking cosmetics industry for decades, died Tuesday, after suffering a stroke. His age was 67.

title: Helsinki Parley: Beginning, Not End
description: HELSINKI, Finland, July 6 Despite the lofty rhetoric and some of the selfcongratulations, the conference on Security and Cooperation in Europe here this week has not been a 20thcentury counterpart to the Congress of Vienna, to which many observers have compared it. The Danish Foreign Minister, K. B. Andersen, speaking for the West Europeans, put the sense of the gathPring precisely when he said it was a beginning not an end. That was true for basic reasons, but the differences from the glittering meeting of 1815 were in the atmosphere too.

title: Tap Reportedly Put On Kopechne Phone After the Drowning
Bobick Stops Another
description: BRISTOL, Tenn. July 6 (AP) Duane Bobick of Bowlus Minn., scored a firstrounc knockout over a hometowner Sylvester Murphy, in a heavy weight bout tonight. Bobick has won his six pro fights by knockouts,

title: Foreign Fishing May Lead U.S. To Quit an Atlantic Commission
description: WASHINGTON, July 6The United States may withdraw from a 24yearold international fishing commission as a symbolic protest over the growing encroachment by foreign fishermen off the American coast, a high official in the Commerce Department said last week.

title: Ballet: Bolshoi, 70's Style
description: For their final oneact novelty of the season, the Bolshoi dancers at the Metropolitan Opera House presented the second act of Swan Lake on Thursday night with Marina Leonova and Maris Liepa.

title: Watergate TV to Resume
description: The three major television networks will resume rotational coverage of the Senate Watergate hearings next week, the Associated Press reports. The American Broadcasting Company said that it would open the rotation Tuesday, with former Attorney General John N. Mitchell scheduled to begin testimony. The National Broadcasting Company takes over the live coverage on Wednesday and the Columbia Broadcasting System on Thursday.

title: Mrs. Syms in Golf Final
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, July 6 (AP)Mrs. Nancy Roth Syms and Cindy Hill, both of Colorado Springs, gained the final round of the Broadmoor women's invitation golf tournament with 1up victories today. Mrs. Syms had to go 19 holes for her victory over Tish Pruess, another Colorado Springs golfer, while Miss Hill defeated Liana Zambresky of Pebble Beach, Calif.

title: Mr. Black Thumb
Hockey Transactions
description: BUFFALOStoned Jim Lorentz, forward multiyear contract.

title: Thursday's Fights
description: By The Associated Press

title: A King In Never Never Land
description: ROMEThe political and personal situation of King Constantine II of the Hellenes is considerably more complicated than is usual even in the rather commonplace twentiethcentury occurrence of exiled monarchs. He doesn't know who his foreign friends are and the Athens dictatorship has locked up many, of his principal Greek friends.

title: ExOfficial Reprimanded Over Unethical ConductBiederman, an ExDeputy State Attorney General, Had Linked Cahill Group to CoverUp for Sherwin
description: TRENTON, July 6 (AP)David A. Biederman, a former deputy state attorney general, was reprimanded today by the State Supreme Court for unethical conduct.

title: S.E.C. Extends Suspension In Trading of Securities
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission said yesterday that the suspension of trading in securities of the Equity Funding Corporation of America and the Giant Stores Corporation had been extended through July 15.

title: Abourezk and Aspin Urge Oil BreakUp
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 (Reuters)The breaking up of all big oil companies in the United States is advocated by two Congressmen.

title: Wetlands and Guidelines
description: New York State's environmental picture has brightened considerably as a result of four recent actions in Albany. Most important were Governor Rockefeller's successful sponsorship of landuse planning in the Adirondacks and his renunciation of the Proposed bridge across Long Island Sound, on both of which we have already commented in these columns. The other two equally favorable actions include his approval of a bill to preserve the state's invaluable tidal wetlands and Commissioner Environmental Conservation Henry L. Diamond's impressive environmental plan for the future development New York State.

title: Traveling Company Plays Moliere Romp in Spanish
description: The combination of charm, gusto and discipline is a becoming approach to an old knockabout farce like Moliere's The Doctor in Spite of Himself, which is being performed in Spanish in a sixthfloor loft at 124 West 18th Street by the Puerto Rican Traveling Theater. The performances are previews before the troupe's outdoor, citywide performances start next month.

title: Savings Rates Up To as Much as 7% HomeMortgage Levels Rise as Big Banks Increase Prime
description: Interest rates on certain, longterm savings accounts moved as high as 7 per cent yesterday as banks and thrift institutions across the nation moved quickly to take advantage of the new higher rate ceilings for these deposits announced on Thursday by the Government.

title: Judge Here Defers Decision On Constitutionality of Raids
description: A Federal District Court judge in Brooklyn reserved decision yesterday on a motion by Representative Elizabeth Holtzman and others to declare the United States bombing of Cambodia Unconstitutional.

title: Institute to Help Minorities Influence Public Decisions
description: WASHINGTON, July 6  James Farmer, founder and former director of the Congress of Racial Equality, announced today the formation of a training institute for the study of public policy and its relationship to minority problems.

title: Mrs. Syms Golf Final
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, July 6 (AP)Mrs. Nancy Roth Symsand Cindy Hill, both of Colorado Springs, gained the final round of the Broadmoor women's invitation golf tournament with 1up victories today Mrs. Syms had to go 19 holes for her victory over Tish Pruess, another Coloredo Springs golfer, while Miss Hil defeated Liana Zambresky of Pebble Beach, Calif.

title: Beame Picks Up Endorsement Of O'Dwyer in Mayoral Drive
description: Paul O'Dwyer, the Democratic nominee for City Council President, announced yesterday his support of Controller Abraham D. Beame, the party's mayoral nominee, and urged all who backed him in the primary to vote for the Controller.

title: RailTon Mileage Up in Week
description: WASHINGTON, July 6The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week totaled an estimated 15.8 billion tonmiles, up 9.5 per cent from the yearearlier level. Carloadings in the same week totaled 515,160, up 7.5 per cent from a year ago. The American Trucking Association, Inc. reported that intercity truck tonnage was 10 per cent above the yearago level.

title: Soviet Foilsmen Take Title, Beating West Germans, 9.7
description: GOTEBORG, Sweden, July 6 (UPI)The Soviet Union won the men's team foils competition in the world fencing championships tonight by beating West German team that had a 65 lead, but bowed, 97.

title: American League
description: Saturday, July 7, 1973

title: MONEY EXCHANGES IN UPROAR ABROAD AS DOLLAR SLIDES
description: BONN, July 6  Turmoil broke out on the foreignexchange markets today as the dollar fell to new lows for the ninth consecutive day.

title: ALLSTAR VOTING DRAWING TO CLOSE
I.R.S. AGENTS TAKE TO THE HIGHWAYS
description: Several hundred Internal Revenue agents will be on the road in the metropolitan area this weekend to investigate consumer complaints that many service stations raise their gasoline prices on Saturdays and Sundays.

title: AMEX PRICES SLIP; VOLUME EDGES UP
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange dropped slightly yesterday, while those in the overthecounter market showed a slight rise.

title: High Rise Skyline Causes Disenchantment Among Many San Franciscans
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 6 It is not the same here. The city has changed. On most warm afternoons now a thin line of ugly smog hangs over the bay. Downtown, jackhammers chop the last holes for a subway system soon to come. And up in North Beach where topless entertainment was first introduced to the nation, a serious move is under way to end the shows inwhich entertainers work in the nude.

title: Hoffa to Seek Union Office If His Appeal Is Successful
description: DETROIT, July 6 (UPI) James R. Hoffa, the former teamster union president, said today that he would seek the presidency of his old Detroit local if he won an appeal before the Supreme Court on 1964 jury tampering conviction.

title: National League
description: Saturday, July 7, 1973

title: Yankee Records PITCHING
Dow Off Again as Fears For the Dollar Increase
description: Turmoil in the European currency markets and indications of intensified inflation in the United States caused the stock market to sag again yesterday in sluggish trading.

title: Roundups: Boccabella and Bat Sound Off for the Expos
description: Claude Mouton, the public address announcer at Montreal's Jerry Park, has always taken special delight in pronouncing the name of one of the Expo's catchers, John Boccabella.

title: MRS. WARD TAKES JUMPOFF AT CAPE
Court Ruling Fails to Stir Reformatory Boys
description: WARWICK, July 6  If the Warwick School for Boys were an adult prison, the news would have traveled in minutes; but there are only children in the state institution here, housed in redbrick cottages rather than on cell blocks, and the inmate grapevine is slow.

title: Slow Contract Talks May Delay School Openings This September
News Summary and Index
U.S. FREES NEWSMAN OVER WOUNDED KNEE
description: WASHINGTON, July 6The Justice Department has dropped all charges against Thomas NOliphant, The Boston Globe reporter who was a passenger on one of three singleengine planes that dropped supplies to Indians last April at Wounded Knee, S. D.

title: ALLSTAR VOTING DRAWING TO CLOSE
description: The starting outfield for the National League in the AllStar game is sure to include Pete Rose of the Cincinnati Reds, but there's a wild race in the balloting for the other two spots.

title: Rubber Contract Reached
description: AKRON, Ohio, July 6 (UPI) Negotiators for the General Tire and Rubber Company and the United Rubber Workers tentatively agreed on a new three. year contract late last night, it was announced today. A strike had been set for midnight. The new contract will result in higher wages and increased fringe benefits for some 3,000 workers here and in Waco, Tex., the spokesman said. The specifics were not disclosed.

title: U.N., Hurt by Drop in Dollar, May Shift to Other Currency
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., July 6The United Nations, badly hurt by deterioration in the value of the dollar, is considering changing its budgetary base to some other currency, possibly the Swiss franc.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Exactly 20 years after the subway token system was introduced in New York City, the Transit Authority, in an effort to speed service, has embarked on an experiment that could lead to the reinstatement of turnstiles that accept coins.

title: Gunman Firing From Car Kills a Catholic in Belfast
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Saturday, July 7 (UPI)A gunman firing from a car killed one man and wounded a second early today in the Roman Catholic Falls Road area of Belfast, the police said.

title: TEXTBOOK POLICY AROUSES ARIZONA
description: PHOENIX, July 6  Controversy over the direction of Arizona's public education has flared again, with the State Board of Education announcing a tentative policy that would force publishers to delete sections of textbooks intended for use in the state.

title: Long Branch Man Indicted In Alleged Bank Robbery.
description: NEWARK, July 6 (UPI)A Federal grand jury today indicted a 24yearold Long Branch man for allegedly robbing a Deal bank. The man, Robert W. Huffert, was charged with the robbery of the Deal Branch of the New Jersey National Bank on June 27. He allegedly took $2,656 from the bank and assaulted a bank employe.

title: Rwanda Coup Traced to Area Rivalry and Poverty
description: KIGALI, Rwanda, July 6 Addressing his countrymen in a soccer stadium Sunday on the 11th anniversary of Rwanda's independence, President Gr6goire Kayibanda said: I know that some of you are plotting a coup d'tat. Well, here I am if you want to do it.

title: Bureaucratic Bad Trip
description: The Administration's decision to trim funding for drug treatment programs and to increase funding for drug law enforcement represents a return to the backward thinking that for too long stressed drug addiction as crime and not a disease. This new distortion of priorities comes at a time when there is a painfully clear need expand treatment and prevention programs not only the area of heroin and hard drugs but also in that of soft drugs and alcohol. The excessive use of ups and downs, amphetamines and barbiturates, as well as alcohol, may well be today's most urgent drug problem.

title: AIRLINE DISCLOSES ILLEGAL DONATION TO 72 NIXON DRIVE
description: WASHINGTON, July 6  American Airlines admitted today that it illegally contributed $55,000 in company funds to President Nixon's reelection campaign early last year. The airline thus became the first corporation voluntarily to acknowledge an illegal political contribution in the Watergate investigation.

title: Two More Die in Gas Blast, Raising Arizona Toll to Five
description: KINGMAN, Ariz., July 6 (UPI) Two gas plant employes died today of burns suffered when a propane railroad tanker exploded yesterday, bringing thetoll in the blast to five men.

title: KingEvert Tennis Final Rained Out
description: WIMBLEDON, England, July 6Daylong rain washed out the allAmerican Wimbledon women's tennis final betreenj Mrs. Billie Jean King and Chris Evert today, thus setting up a men's and women's doubleheader final tomorrow that will be seen on television in the United States.
