He had earned the right to say it. Few servants of the church in our age have been given more grievous cause for discouragement about the good possibilities in working from within than Beauduin. But he lived to be 86, worked from within and stayed within, and accomplished greatly for the church he loved and which had so much trouble simply accepting his service.

title: Jerseyans Off First in Race
description: WILDWOOD When the annual Powder Puff Derby gets under way at Palomar Airport in Carlsbad, Calif., next Friday, a team of two New Jersey women will be the first to take to the air in the crosscountry event.

title: Pilic Returns to Court
description: BAASTAD, Sweden, July 7 (AP)Nikki Pilic of Yugoslavia returns to action here tomorrow, after his onemonth suspension by the International Lawn Tennis Federation, in the $75,000 Swedish international tennis tournament. His suspension and subsequent banning from Wimbledon resulted from his refusal to play in the Davis Cup for his country, and led to the boycott of Wimbledon by more than 70 players.

title: PIETRO SECCHIA DIES; IT ALIAN SENATOR, 80
description: ROME, July 7 (UPI)Senator Pietro Secchia, a World War II resistance fighter and a founder of the Italian Communist party, died today in a clinic here. He was 70 years old.

title: Feels like summer, looks like fall
Jets Pitch Camp Tuesday With 50 Players on Hand
description: The Jets open their training camp on Tuesday at Hofstra University in Hempstead, L.I., with 50 players, 27 of them rookies, on hand. The occasion is a bit more than the mere start of another pro football season, because this one will be the last for Weeb Ewbank as the team's head coach.

title: Photography News of the Camera World: Products and Courses
HARTFORD WEIGHS A RESIDENCY RULE
description: HARTFORD, July 3The city of Hartford is proposing to stop the flow of its own employes to the suburbs by showing preference in hiring and promotion to people who live in the city.

title: OIL SPILL CLOSES SUFFOLK BEACHES
description: More than 10 miles of public beaches on the North Shore of Suffolk County were closed to swimmers yesterday as hundreds of workmen skimmed the waters of Smithtown Bay and scraped the shoreline to clean up gloppy patches of oil spilled from a tanker.

title: Arthur Lawrence 3d Is Fiance Of Francesca F. W. Schager
description: OYSTER BAY, L. I., July 7 The engagement of Miss Francesba Florence Waring Schager to Arthur Brewster Lawrence 3d has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Franz Schager of Oyster Bay and Key Biscayne, Fla., parents of the future bride. Her fianc is the son of Mrs. L. Hadden Merriman of Bailey's Bay, Bermuda, and A. Brewster Lawrence Jr. of New York and St. James, L. I. A fall wedding is planned.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: Medical student, father of five, former intelligence agent, automobileparts manufacturer  that's Beurt R. SerVaas.

title: Series Is Planned On Marine Science
description: MONTAUK, L. I.The New York Ocean Science Laboratory here will begin a weekly series on marine science Thursday night on matters of Interest to Long Island.

title: MAYOR PROTESTS DRUGFUND CUTS
FASHION TALK The Beaded Dress Still Has Its Place
description: We really didn't want to do this dress, Bob Mackie said. Whenever .we do beads, someone is sure to say, They're into their Hollywood number again. We just did it to fill out the evening sequence, but it's turned, into one of our best numbers.

title: Rego Park to Get Its Own Library
description: After making their feelings known to Queens Borough Hall, the residents of Rego Park are getting a 7,500squarefoot library to replace a much smaller branch that was destroyed in a fire a year ago last February.

title: WARNICK J. KERNAN, HEADED STATE BAR
description: UTICA, N. Y., July 7 (AP) Warnick J. Kernan, a former president of the New York State Bar Association and a prominent Democrat here, died today at the age of 92.

title: Child's Body Found in River
description: The partly decomposed body of a child about 2 or 3 years old and clad only in a diaper was found yesterday in the Hudson River near the 79th Street marina. The police of the 20th Precinct said it was not possible to determine immediately the child's sex. The body was taken to the Medical Examiner's office for an autopsy.

title: They Use Zoos to Help Children Learn About Their Environment
description: We need three on Reptiles, two on Endangered Species and four on Adaptations. The green  caped guides at the Bronx Zoo were in a morning huddle in the Heads and Horns building that now houses the education department.

title: Watergate
description: WASHINGTONThe long silence of Richard M. Nixon, maintained despite a persistent drumbeat of accusations that he had been guilty of crimes in trying to cover up the Watergate scandal, has now been brokenwith Presidential pronouncement that is virtually certain to create a dramatic confrontation between the White House and the Senate.

title: Marion Platt Has Nuptials
description: RIVERSIDE, Conn., July 7 In St. Catherine of Siena Roman Catholic Church here this afternoon, Miss Marian Colette Platt, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert H. Platt, was married to Scott F. Russotto, son of Mr. and Mrs. Francis A. Russotto of East Greenwich, R. L

title: A NEW COALITION FORMED IN ITALY
description: ROME, July 7Premietdesignate Mariano. Rumor announced tonight that he had formed a centerleft coalition of Christian Democrats, Social Democrats, Republicans and SocialistsItaly's 35th Government since the fall of Fascism 30 years ago.

title: Bridal in Suburbs For Julie Goldsmith
description: WESTPORT, Conn., July 7 Miss Julie Goldsmith was married here this noon to John Weisman, an associate editor of TV Guide. Justice of the Peace Lawrence O. Aasen performed the ceremony at the home of Mrs. Jacob Fox, the bride's grandmother, who is a sister of the late Edna Ferber, the novelist.

title: Future Events
description: From Tutti to Tutus July 12  When Cynthia Gregory takes all the feminine roles in a new version of Offenbach's Tales of Hoffmann that is to have its premiere at the New York State Theater, she'll have to be on her toes. What's so different about that? Well, the new offering is a fulllength ballet produced by the American Ballet Theater, choreographed and staged by Peter Darrell, so the Nuremberg poet's love trials naturally will be delineated by means of kinetics in lieu of vocalism. It will be fascinating to see how Antonia can sing herself to death sur pointes, but Olympia should be a ballerina tour de force. The tradition smasher will be the first half of a doublebarreled benefit for Ballet Theater's production fund. After it's curtains for Hoffmann's love live (except for his mental marriage with his muse) 400 balletomanes will take themselves to a supper dance at the TavernontheGreen, which will be transformed into a Venetian setting. The supper will be an array of Italian goodies. Mayor and Mrs. Lindsay are among the buyers of tickets, which are $100 and $50 for both ballet and supper, $25 and $15 for the theater alone. Mrs. William Zeckendorf Jr. is chairman

title: Solutions to last week's puzzles
DONOHUE TAKES PART OF A RACE
description: FLOWERY BRANCH, Ga., July 7  Mark Donohue sped away this afternoon with the first half of the Carling CanAm, raising the question of what is left over for tomorrow's portion.

title: Hiss The fund Ike's heart attack Caracas Khrushchev J. F. K.
description: No wonder Barry Goldwater was upset. He never did like incremental escalation. Yet President Nixon's May 22 Watergate white paper just inched carefully up the scale of accusation and counterattack, giving and taking partial blame, hinting at leaks that ameliorate but don't excuse, attacking and retreating simultaneously. It was a finely calibrated combination of preemptive admission and protective apologyit was warfare as an art of wooing; incremental escalation. The very form of the statement's release revealed its purpose. Nixon did not take his case emotionally to the people on TV, but sent two lawyers out to defend his defense.

title: Crime in Newark Down 10.2%, Gibson Says in Annual Message
description: NEWARK, July 7  Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson, in his third annual report since his election in 1970, declared that the city's crime rate was continuing to decrease.

title: Landmark St. Louis Rail Station Reported Sold to Florida Group
description: ST. LOUIS, July 7Union Station, long regarded as this city's premier landmark, which has been surpassed only recently by the Gateway Arch, is reported to have been sold to a Miami development concern.

title: Inmates To Testify On Reform For Parole
description: TRENTONA State Senate committee will go inside the walls of a state prison tomorrow to take inmates testimony on a controversial parolereform bill.

title: John Cranko 19271973
description: JOHN CRANKO was everyone's best friend. He had a genius for friendship. He gave totally of himself because he liked people, and because his always endearing shyness required the continuing affirmation of acceptance. He also had a genius for ballet. He created a new world in danceand he died, tragically, of a heart attack, almost a week ago, in an airplane that was taking him and his Stuttgart Ballet, his very special family, home to Germany.

title: L.I. Choristers Seeking Prize
description: MASSAPEQUA, L. I. Nineteen students from Massapequa High School hope tomorrow to be able to wire we have won from the International Choral Competition in Spittal, Austria.

title: Eisenhower Library Use
description: ABILENE, Kan., July 7 (UPI) One effect of the fuel shortage is declining attendance at the Dwight D. Eisenhower library and museum, the library director, Dr. John Wickman,, said: this week. The publicity given the gas shortage has resuited in more buses and fewer cars coming to the museum, butt the number of buses hasn't offset the loss from passenger cars, he said.

title: Yonkers Entries
Queens Chapter of Common Cause Stresses Local Action
description: Dr. Roger G. Mazlen likes to write letters. But, while he probably does his best to keep in touch by mail with aunts, uncles, cousins and friends, his most prolific correspondence is directed at elected public officials.

title: L.I. Bridge Decision Upsets Land Values
Uganda Payment in Killings Is Discussed With Tanzania
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, July 7 Negotiations between Tanzania and Uganda have begun here at the ministerial level on the amount of compensation to be paid by Uganda to the families of 24 Tanzanians murdered in Uganda in the last two years.

title: Leftists in Key Argentine City Chafe at Peronist Conservatives
description: CORDOBA, Argentina, July 6When Argentines talk about political upheavals, they almost always cast a wary eye toward this university and industrial city 430 miles northwest of Buenos Aires.

title: Steam and Electric Boats Vie In Environmental Race Upstate
description: LAKE GEORGE, N. Y., July 7  Curious spectators milled around the public docks at midmorning today to get a look at some oldtime steamboats and two electric launches that had been brought here for the first environmental boat race to be held at Lake George.

title: JERRY P. MILLER
description: SUMMITVILLE, N. Y., July 8 Jerry P. Miller, a mailer for The New York Times, died Friday in an auto accident near Wurtsboro. He was 39 years old and lived here.

title: Table for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New York
Vietnamese Plane Crashes
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 8 (AP)  A twinengine South Vietnamese transport plane with 36 Vietnamese aboard crashed shortly after takeoff from Phu Quoc Island and plunged into the Gulf of Siam last night, the military command reported. Fourteen persons were missing.

title: Guest Overtime Goal Gives Bethpage 54 Victory in Polo
Sara Taylor Married To Mark D. Ginsberg
description: Miss Sara Jane Taylor, daughter of Mrs. Estelle Taylor of Forest Hills, Queens, was married last evening to Mark Dana Ginsberg, son of Mr. and Mrs. Sidney H. Ginsberg of Forest Hills, in the Forest Hills Jewish Center. Rabbi Raphael Ostrovsky performed the ceremony.

title: 1 Dead, 1 Hurt in Avalanche
description: VAIL, Colo., July 8 (UPI)Two mountain climbers, attempting to scale 14,003foot Mount of the Holy Cross, fell about 500 feet today onto a snowy ledge. One was severely injured and the other died in an avalanche started by their fall.

title: Mrs. Crocker Golf Victor For First Time in 8 Years
description: BUFFALO, July 8 AP)Mrs. Mary Lou Crocker shot a closing fiveunderpar 68 to win the $35,000 Marc Equity women's golf tournament today by four shots. It was the first tournament she had won in eight years.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Legal Aid Society made a new offer to its 450 striking lawyers that their union president said could end their sevenday walkout. Karen Faraguna, the union head, called the offer a substantial victory. The lawyers were to meet today to vote on it.

title: A spin Assails Litton Ship Costs; Suggests Navy Cancel Contract
description: Representative Les Aspin produced new evidence yesterday that, he said, heralded further cost overruns and possible delays in the Navy's muchcriticized $1billion program to obtain five LHA amphibiousassault ships.

title: Duke Ellington Is Awarded France's Legion of Honor
description: Duke Ellington's eyes glistened as he sat down to play the piano yesterday. He turned to the dapper man who stood next to him and said: Mr. Ambassador, what's your wife's name?

title: Mitchell Expected to Tell Of Planning for Bugging
description: WASHINGTON, July 8The Senate's Watergate hearing are not likely to produce dramatic support for the charge by John W. Dean 3d that President Nixon was deeply involved in the Watergate coverup, officials close to the Senate investigation said today.

title: Weekly List of Mutual Funds
description: The following is a supplementary weekly list of mutual funds prepared by the National Association of Securities Dealers. The range shown reflects prices at which securities could have been sold (bid) or bought (asked) last Friday.

title: Leaders Address 70,000 Witnesses
description: More than 70,000 Jehovah's Witnesses squeezed into Yankee Stadium yesterday to hear their leaders enunciate the sect's belief that only divine intervention could solve the problems facing modern man.

title: Hanoi Premier in, Peking On Way to Moscow Visit
description: HONG KONG, July 8 (Reuters)A toplevel North Vietnamese Government delegation arrived in Peking today on its way to Moscow, Hsinhua, the Chinese press agency, reported.

title: FASHION TALK
description: No matter what other styles he attacks, George Stavropoulos is fated to be known for his chiffon dresses. They're the kind of clothes that women who go in for charity balls and grand entrances can have no doubts about wearing.

title: Television
Pisani Scores 2 Victories In Philadelphia Regatta
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 8  Frank Pisani of the New York Athletic Club scored a double victory in the Philadelphia junior rowing championships on the Schuykill River today. Pisani won by two lengths in the singles event, in 5 minutes 24.9 seconds for the 1,500 meters. Pisani then teamed with James Landis, Bob Barden and Turk Kadiodlu of the New York A. C. to win in the quadruple sculls event.

title: Detectives Charge Department With Eroding Their Prestige
Metropolitan Briefs
description: A Queens fireman was critically injured while fighting a fire allegedly started by a Corona resident who had gone berserk during a party in his home at 3544 95th Street. The police said that Henry Altman, a 31yearold mechanic, and his wife were entertaining 30 guests when Mr. Altman suddenly grabbed a butcher knife, chased out the guests, smashed the furniture and threw the debris out the window. Policemen arriving at the scene smelled smoke and called the Fire Department. The blaze inside the apartment burst a window and knocked Fireman Kurt Hallman off a secondfloor fireescape onto the sidewalk. He was taken to Elmhurst City Hospital with multiple fractures.

title: Punishment and Crime
description: Chief Judge Irving R. Kaufman of the United States Court of Appeals has launched a significant effort to correct the wide and unreasonable disparities in sentences imposed on persons convicted of essentially the same crimes. This reform is long overdue to meet a problem which, in the judge's words, had been submerged for many years.

title: Red Smith;The Blackfoot Trout Strike Back
description: Soon after the start of the second day's offensive on the Blackfoot River, a rainbow trout counterattacked. This was in an area that Skipper Lofting, leader of the expedition, calls the Vatican because there used to be a cabin nearby occupied by a cheerful little fat man named John Pope and known, inevitably, as Pope John. Tumbling down the western slope of Montana's Continental Divide, the Blackfoot rushes through a chute at the foot of Cougar Cliff just above the Vatican, flattens out in a deep, swift run studded with rocks, then takes another dive among great boulders. Skipper had left his companion at the tail of this last stretch while he went up to work the chute. They would meet in neutral water in between. &&&&Sports of The Times.

title: The Two Brezhnevs: Back Home, the Ebullient One Vanishes
description: MOSCOW, July 8The gregarious, handshaking, backslapping political style that Leonid I. Brezhnev employed before American television audiences during his recent visit to the United States already seems a thing of the past.

title: Brooklyn Man Is Killed In Auto Crash in Edison
description: EDISON, July 8 (UPI)One man was killed and three others were slightly injured today when their auto failed to negotiate a curb leading to the New Jersey Turnpike here and flipped over, according to the police.

title: American Hurt at Pamplona
description: PAMPLONA, Spain, July 8 (Reuters)One man was gored and three others, including an American, were slightly injured today during the San Fermin Festival of the running of the bulls. Javier Ardaduna, 20 years old, was gored in the chest. The injured American was identified as James Glass, 24, of Chattanooga, Tenn.

title: The Dance: Two Impressive Debuts in Swan Lake
description: A debut in the ballet classics is always a special occasion. Saturday afternoon at the State Theater, Martine van Hamel and Jonas Kage made such an event even more memorable with outstanding performances in their first appearance here as the leads in American Ballet Theater's Swan Lake.

title: Denver's Deadly Cloud
description: Onefiftieth of a drop of the nerve gas known as GB is enough to kill an adult human being within minutes of contact with his skin. Yet some 463,000 gallons of the deadly chemical is stored in the form of cluster bombs at the Rocky Mountain Arsenal only ten miles from the heart of Denver. Although the Army promised three years ago to lift this threat to the city by removing or destroying the gas, it not only has yet to remove a single missile but it now blandly reveals that an undisclosed quantity of the same nerve gas in bulk tanks will be kept indefinitely at the arsenal as a defense deterrent.

title: Sunday's Yacht Racing Results
description: INVITATION REGATTA

title: Offer of Free Elks Expires
description: YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK, Wyo., July 8 (AP)An offer of free elks from Yellowstone National Park to private individuals is no longer in effect here, the National Park Service reports. An earlier Associated Press dispatch had indicated that such an offer was available.

title: Deaths
He Delights in Teaching a Child to Read
description: I'd always wanted to be a sixthgrade teacher, said Herbert Kohl, who is well known today as an education reformer. It was a straightforward enough ambition at the time, but when the wish was being expressed  and stifledsome 15 years ago, Herbert Kohl was a Bronx boy who had made it to Harvard. And 15 years ago, a bright Harvard graduate did not go out into the world to teach in a public school.

title: Waltke, Miss Meyer Take Junior HardCourt Crowns
description: BURLINGAME, Calif., July 8 (AP)Trey Waltke of Los Angeles won the national junior hardcourt tennis title today and Carrie Meyer of Indianapolis took the girls 18 crown.

title: Communists Cut Off 5 Outposts Around the Cambodian Capital
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, July 8 (UPI)  Communist troops cut off five Government outposts on Phonm Penh's defensive perimeter today, stepping up a campaign to isolate the capital despite heavy United States air strikes.

title: Victims of Ulster Mistreatment Said to Be Suffering Mental Ills
description: LONDON, July 8  Men subjected to hooding while being interrogated by the British forces in Northern Ireland are suffering from longterm mental injury as a result of their treatment, according to a professor of psychiatry.

title: Amin Heard Peace Corps and Ordered Plane Brought Back
description: KAMPALA Uganda, July 8 (UPI)President Idi Amin was at the Entebbe Airport yesterday morning when a chartered East African Airlines VC10 carrying 112 American Peace Corps volunteers took off after a refueling stop.

title: Hopes of Alaskan Village Hinge on Oil and Pipeline
description: BARROW, Alaska, July 7 The rusty, errant pipe that travels from house to house here, teetering on old oil barrels, or tunneling beneath the streets, is a symbol of the break with the harsh, cruel life of centuries past as well as a talisman of hope for the future.

title: Today's Entries at Aqueduct
Roundup: The Bull Stops Expos
PAY N PAK VICTOR
description: MADISON, Ind., July 8 (AP) Mickey Remund, driving Pay N Pak, won the 26th annual Madison Regatta for unlimited hydroplanes today.

title: Congress Seems Unlikely To Pass Trade Bill Soon
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 There has been significant slippage in Congressional consideration of President Nixon's sweeping new trade bill, according to informed Congressional sources.

title: Routing System Giving Ships Here Good Steer
description: Every cargo ship leaving or entering the port and operating for the Navy's Military Sea Lift Command carries a little black box on its bridge.

title: Officials and Students in Eight Major Cities Describe TeenAgers Search for Summer Jobs as Grim
description: WASHINGTON, July 8  More teenagers are employed, this summer than last summere the Department of Labor says, but leaders in eight cities around the country say the search for summer jobs is grim.

title: 5 Bikers in State Races Attacked in Central Park
description: Five bike riders competing in the amateur state championship bicycle races in Central Park were attacked in separate incidents yesterday morning by young thugs armed with chains, knives and clubs.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
BUSINESS IS EAGER FOR FREEZE'S END
Dollar Plan. Ready
description: Arrangements by which the United States could borrow funds with which to support the sagging dollar in foreign currency markets were reported ready by central bankers of the Western powers meeting in Basel yesterday. Details on Page 51.

title: BASEBALL TRANSACTION
description: NATIONAL LEAGUE MONTREALBrought up Larry Lintz, shortstop, from Peninsula of International League,

title: Personal Finance
description: Many holders of mutualfund shares are in a quandary even though they have a recent legal decision to cheer about.

title: WIDEVER MANSION IS COMING DOWN
description: The Landmarks Preservation Commission has approved the plans of the Frick Collection to demolish the former George D. Widener house at 5 East 70th Street.

title: Eisenhower to Be Honored
description: DENISON, Tex., July 8 (AP) Mrs. David Eisenhower will travel to this north Texas town tomorrow to dedicate a statue of her husband's grandfather, President Eisenhower, on the grounds of the home where the general was born.

title: HENRY GREENFIELD
description: Henry Greenfield, who retired in 1963 as general manager of radio station WEVD, died yesterday at his home, 4525 Henry Hudson Parkway West, Riverdale, the Bronx. He was 76 years old.

title: Memorex Exploring Deal With Singer
description: The Memorex Corporation announced yesterday that it was negotiating with the Singer Company for a $15million investment in its shares and the right to obtain a majority of the common. According to a spokesman for the computer manufacturing and leasing concern, the talks are contingent, among other things, upon makMerger ing certain arNews rangements with Memorex's creditors. He stressed that Singer's investment would not constitute any takeover or merger of Memorex.

title: They Shall Pass If They're Athletes
description: LOS ANGELES, July 8 (AP) The University of California, Los Angeles will investigate charges that athletes on scholarship received preferential treatment in grading even when failing to attend classes.

title: Johnson of F.C.C. Evaluates TV Stations
description: WASHINGTON, July 8  Nicholas Johnson, the reformer who is about to be replaced as a member of the Federal Communications Commission, made public today an evaluation of the job done by 144 major television stations, together with some hints on how to exert pressure for better performance on those who run the stations.

title: Canadian Premier Is Shifting Economic Goals
description: VANCOUVER, British ColumbiaWhether it is from confidence that springs from exercising high office or from a change of heart, Premier David Barrett is adjudged here a more relaxed radical than he appeared on taking over British Columbia's government 11 months ago.

title: 112 IN PEACE CORPS SEIZED BY UGANDA AT AMIN'S ORDER
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, July 8A group of 112 United States Peace Corps volunteers was being held prisoner tonight by Uganda's President, Gen. Idi Amin, who expressed a suspicion that they might be mercenaries.

title: Historian Calls Impeachment Only Recourse for Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 (UPI) A leading political historian suggested today that impeachment proceedings were the best and possibly the only way left for President Nixon to answer charges linking him to the Watergate scandal.

title: DUPRE TOPS DELANEY IN CLAY COURT FINAL
description: CHATTANOOGA, July 8 (AP) Patrick DuPre of the University of California defeated a collegiate rival, Jim Delaney of Stanford, for the men's title in the National amateur clay court tournament today.

title: Tavern Operator Is Found Fatally Stabbed in Newark
description: NEWARK, July 8 (UPI)A 39yearold Newark man, part owner of a tavern, was found stabbed to death in the neck today, he police said.

title: 112 IN PEACE CORPS SEIZED BY UGANDA AT AMIN'S ORDER
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, July 8A group of 112 United States Peace Corps volunteers was being held prisoner tonight by Uganda's President, Gen. Idi Amin, who expressed a suspicion that they might be mercenaries.

title: At Vietcong News Parley, Orange Soda washes Down Rhetoric
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 8For those who like their rhetoric mixed with orange soda, the Vietcong's weekly news conference has become something of an institution here.

title: New Corporate Bonds
Garrett Nomination to S.E.C. Is Hailed
description: The President's nomination of Ray D. Garrett to the chairmanship of the Securities and Exchange Commission and that of A. A. Sommer Jr., to ill a vacancy on the fiveman board, was greated with relief by leaders of the securities industry yesterday.

title: Diary of a Mugger Lists 30 Victims, Loot, Weapon
description: Alexander B. Jackson, a 19 yearold high school dropout, kept a detailed official holdup record crediting himself with 30 muggings in five months. In neat columns, he carefully listed the date, time and place of each robbery, the sex, race and age group of the victim, the cash and other booty seized and the weapon used.

title: Follmer's Auto Captures TwoDay Georgia Race
description: FLOWERY BRANCH, Ga., July 8George Follmer, at 39 years old one of the old men in motor racing, won the twoday Carling CanAm today, after a freakish mishap did in the favorite, Mark Donohue.

title: Lightning Kills Hungarians
description: BUDAPEST, July 8 (UPI) Lightning during Hungry's most severe thunderstorm in 25 years killed six persons in separate areas yesterday, officials said today.

title: $1 for Enemies Certificate
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 (UPI) One dollar now can buy an Enemy of Richard Milhous Nixon certificate for anyone disappointed that his or her name was not on the White [House list. The certificate, latest of many Watergate gags, is being sold by a company in Madison, Wis., that calls itself the OffWhite House.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: GREEK GIFT Last year George Christodoulakis, a young Greek playwright and director, staged his first Greek Arts Festival at Westbeth. This year, he's moving it to New York University's Loeb Student Center auditorium, where it will run for eight days at 7 P.M.tonight through Thursday and next week from Tuesday through Friday.

title: STRIKING LAWYERS WEIGH NEW OFFER
description: The Legal Aid Society made a new contract offer yesterday, to its 450 striking lawyers that their union president said could end their sevenday walkout.

title: Summer Apples
description: CHAPEL HILL, N. C.That summer the apples hung so low no grass grew beneath the tree. And it was wet; one of the wettest summers he could remember. Seemed like every week was filled with more rain than work. Can't paint outside in the rain. So he sat and watched the drenched boards get more drenched. Some say there ain't no such a thing. Once board is drenched it can't get no more drenched, but he knew it weren't so, he watched'm Pay days were cut in half and many's the time he sat on the porch and watched his dollars swim into the clay like little fishes.

title: BROOKE URGES HELP FOR WAR'S REFUGEES
Amon, Stuck Victors at Ring As FittipaldiStewart Car Fails
description: NUERBURGRING, West Germany, July 8 (UPI)  Chris Amon of New Zealand and HansJoachim Stuck of West Germany led a BMW 1, 2, 3 sweep today in the Nuerburgring grand prix for production cars,

title: Congress Unit to Inquire Into the Soviet Economy
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 (AP) The Congressional Joint Economic Committee announced today that it would hold hearings July 17 to 19 on the economic outlook in the Soviet Union.

title: Percussionists Do Their Drum Shtick
description: Saturday afternoon the vicinity of the Wollman Amphitheater in Central Park was hardly a place for a restful alfresco snooze. The Newport Jazz Festival's Drum Shtickwhere do they get those titles?was going on, and it seemed as if every drummer in town was up there onstage at one time or another during the fourhour affair, banging away.

title: REV. LESLIE W. PIPPERT
description: The Rev. Leslie W. Pippert, administrator of all churches in North America of the Christian and Missionary Alliance, died Saturday in Nyack (N.Y.) Hospital after having suffered a heart attack at his home, 4 Central Avenue, Nyack. He was 59 years old.

title: GURNEY ASSERTS PANEL SHOULD GET PRESIDENT'S FILES
description: WASHINGTON, July 8Senator Edward J. Gurney, who has been the stanchest defender of President Nixon on the Senate Watergate committee, said today that he believed that Presidential papers bearing on the Watergate investigation should be made available to the committee.

title: Rookie Fails Physical
description: MIAMI, July 8 (AP)Bill Palmer, a rookie tight end, failed to pass his physical examination today when the defending National Football League champion Miami Dolphins opened training camp. Palmer, from St. Thomas College in Minnesota, was the club's 15th draft pick.

title: BENZION DINUR, 89, HISTORIAN, TEACHER
description: JERUSALEM, July 8 (UPI)  BenZion Dinur, a Ukrainianborn historian and Israeli Minister of Education and Culture from 1951 to 1955, died late yesterday at the age of 89, a Government announcement said today.

title: Preservation of Upper Delaware Backed
AREAISSUES POLL TAKEN BY GALLUP
description: Residents of the New York metropolitan area favor creating state and Federal jobs for the unemployed, subsidizing public transportation while building more highways and replacing local property taxes with a statewide school tax, according to a Gallup survey released yesterday.

title: Lunch by Any Other Name Is Still Lunch
description: When it's eaten at work or in the Automat, it's called lunch. If the silverwale is real and the napkins linen, it becomes luncheon. (Paradoxically, at luncheonettes, it's always lunch.) In Latin countries, lunch is really midday dinner and is followed by a siesta. Americans are more likely to eat on the run. Except for threemartini businessmen on expense accounts, or women who go to in restaurants to be seen, most Americans take the lunch hour literally as 60 minutes.

title: Suburbia: A New Jazz Constituency?
description: UNIONDALE, LI., July 8  They were looking, they said, for a whole new constituency for jazz, and the promoters of the Newport Jazz Festival believed today they had found it in the green parkways and asphalt parking lots leading to the doors of the Nassau Memorial Coliseum here.

title: VERMONT CONVICTS RELEASE 2 GUARDS
description: WINDSOR, Vt., July 8 (AP) A disturbance at Windsor state prison ended tonight after rebellious inmates released two guards they had held hostage, a spokesman for Gov. Thomas P. Salmon said.

title: Newport Jazz
description: The Newport Jazz Festival wound up its second year in New York with a concert at Carnegie Hall on Saturday night that was the most completely realized program, in every aspect of presentation, in the Festival's 20year history. The evening was billed as SoLo Piano, and it was made up of unaccompanied piano solos played by pianists who, aside from George Shearing and Earl Hines, are not particularly well known beyond a specialist jazz following. Yet they attracted a soldout, av idly attentive house.

title: Central Bankers Issue Statement on Meeting
description: BASEL, July 8  Text of the communique issued by the Bank for International Settlements:

title: A Tiny Hamlet in the West Is Apparently Sold
description: LAMONT, Wyo., July 8This tiny town of 100, if you count the antelope and deer, has apparently been sold.

title: U.S. Advises the State to Curb Pollution by Buses and Trucks
ATLANTA N.A.A.C.P. FACES EXPULSION Officials Say Branch Must Yield on Integration Plan
description: ATLANTA, July 8  Officials of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People said today that the organization would expel its Atlanta branch if the branch did not yield to the national organization in a school integration dispute.

title: MAJORITY ELUDES LEFTISTS IN TOKYO
description: TOKYO, Monday, July 8 Japanese leftist parties have failed in their objective of winning a majority in the elections yesterday to the Tokyo Metropolitan Assembly, regarded as a political barometer for the nation.

title: Rose Ann Scamardella Is Married
description: Miss Rose Ann Scamardella, a reporter for Channel 7Eye Witness News, was married in Brooklyn yesterday morning to Assemblyman Michael L. Pesce, a Democrat representing the 52d Assembly District, Brooklyn. The ceremony was performed in St. Charles Roman Catholic Chapel by the Rev. Anthony Barretta, assisted by the Rev. Anthony Failla.

title: Medical Journal Says 5 Federally Aided Experiments on Humans Raise Disturbing Ethical Questions
description: WASHINGTON, July 8The Federal Government has supported at least five experiments on human beings that have been cited in the most recent issue of the Hastings Report, a journal of biomedical ethics, as raising disturbing ethical questions.

title: Reinsurance Unit Formed
description: The formation of AfroAmerican Reinsurance Brokers, Inc., to serve insurers in Ethiopia and other African nations was announced yesterday by Assegid Tessma, chairman, and Richard H. Weiss, president. The company maintains offices at 135 William Street.

title: Watergate's Impact on Agencies
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., July 8The Watergate scandal has had a deep and widespread impact on the Federal Government since White House involvement was exposed more than three months ago.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Police diving teams recovered the bodies of two persons in separate drowning incidents.

title: Aaron's 695th and 696th Subdue Mets
Major League Baseball
description: Monday, July 9, 1973

title: MRS. KING VICTOR IN MIXED DOUBLES Teams With Davidson to Win 3d Wimbledon Title and 17th of Her Career
description: WIMBLEDON, England, July 8 (UPI)Mrs. Billie Jean King won her 17th Wimbledon lawn tennis championship today and her third of the 87th tournament. The 29yearold from Hilton Head, S.C., who first came to Wimbledon 13 years ago as Little Miss Moffitt, added the mixed doubles crown to the iwomen's singles and women's doubles titles she collected yesterday.

title: The Danger Of Saying Goodby
description: PARISEurope is far from being safe today. Not because of an imminent or possible military aggression from the East, of which nobody believes at present, but because of the fading away of the American nuclear protection, due to nuclear parity with the Soviets and to SALT agreements. Also, the complete imbalance of military conventional forces in Europe, where a tightly integrated Warsaw Pact has twice as many divisions and planes, three times more tanks, than a more loosely united NATO, contributes to this unease. Moreover, NATO's main pillar, the U.S., seems to doubt her role for the defense of Europe and to hesitate to commit to it her considerable tactical nuclear weaponry which represented in the nineteenfifties a formidable regional deterrence.

title: Cuban Reportedly Links Convicts' Funds to Hunt
description: MIAMI, July 8The Cuban exile leader of the abortive 1961 Bay of Pigs invasion has reportedly delivered $21,000 in support money for the convicted Watergate burglars who were from Miami.

title: Broadway Again Blooms on Nantucket
description: NANTUCKET, Mass., July 9On this island there is a road called Broadway, a reminder of the time Nantucket had a theatrical community. But, with the exception of the Straight Wharf Theater, which specializes in homegrown revivals of Broadway hits, Nantucket had largely lost its interest in theateruntil this year when John Wu1p founded the Nantucket Stage Company.

title: Dissident Theologian Plans to Defy Vatican Order on Papal Infallibility
description: TUBINGEN, West Germany, July 8The Rev. Hans Kling, the Roman Catholic theologian who questions papal infallibility, said today that he was not against Pope Paul VII am only against an absolute, totalitarian, authoritarian papacy.

title: GinjimE/V Places First In Predicted Log Event
description: BLOCK ISLAND, R. I., July 8 The New York Athletic Club Yacht Club's 60th Block Island predicted log event finished today with Jim Moore's GinjimE/V taking first place for the fourth time in six years.

title: Trial in Thalidomide Case May Be Moved to Jersey
description: NEWARK, July 8  The danger of inadequate testing before a drug is put on the market was tragically illustrated more than a decade ago with the birth of babies in Germany and Britain whose mothers had taken thalidomide. The specter of these deformed youngsters has been raised in Federal Court here as a result of a legal battle that could make New Jersey the site of negligence suits on the ground that the controversial drug was manufactured here.

title: ATLANTA N.A.A.C.P. FACES EXPULSION
10 Soviet Astronauts Arrive To Plan Joint Space Flight
description: A team of 10 Soviet astronauts, accompanied by two dozen space engineers, arrived here yesterday on the way to Houston to plan the first joint AmericanSoviet space fligh, according to The Associated Press. The team included Col. Alexei Leonov, who became the first man to take a space walk when he stepped out of the Voskhod 2 spaceship in 1965.

title: Max Horkheimer, Philosopher And Frankfurt U. Rector, Dead
description: Dr. Max Horkheimer, a former rector of the University of Frankfurt who was a philosopher and an innovator in the social sciences, died Saturday in Nuremberg, Germany. He was 78 years old and lived in Montagnola, Switzerland.

title: Mayor Anna Latteri of Clifton, Sex Education Foe, Dies at 67
description: CLIFTON, N. J., July 8 (AP) Anna M. Latteri, the first woman Mayor of Clifton and one of the most outspoken municipal chief executives in New Jersey died today at her home, 50 Heights Road. She was 67 years old.

title: Riposte From the West
description: If we do not improve the life of ordinary people this conference, we shall be askedand with justicewhat all our fine words and diplomatic phrases have achieved. This is just the kind of talk that statesmen assembled need to hear, particularly at an amorphous gathering like the Conference on Security and Cooperation in Europe. It was Britain's Foreign Secretary, Sir Alec DouglasHome, whose candor swept like a fresh breeze through the marble corridors of Helsinki's Finlandia Hall, carrying the theme of a strong and remarkably cohesive Western response to the lofty rhetoric of the Soviet Foreign Minister, Andrei A. Gromyko.

title: Abplanalp Trust Inquiry Ruled Out by U.S. in 71
description: Justice Department officials overruled staff recommendations two years ago for an investigation of pricing practices of the Precision Valve Corporation, owned by Robert H. Abplanalp, the multimillionaire friend of President Nixon.

title: Follmer's Auto Captures TwoDay Georgia Race
description: FLOWERY BRANCH, Ga., July 8George Follmer, at 39 years old one of the old men in motor racing, won the twoday Carling CanAm today, after a freakish mishap did in the favorite, Mark Donohue.

title: Hungary Wins in Saber
description: GOTEBORG, Sweden, July 8 (UPI)Hungary scored an upset victory over the Soviet Union to win the men's saber team event in the world fencing championships tonight.

title: City Forms Engineer Corps to Build Sewers
description: One of the least noticed byproducts of the city's vast sewerconstruction program a plan to build 1,500 miles of sewers over 10 years at a cost of $1.5billionis the gathering by the city of its first substantial corps of young civil engineers since the Depression.

title: Ghost Town Fights Gold Rush of 73
description: SOUTH PASS CITY, Wyo.This ghost town in the southern Wyoming hills was a boom town in the regional gold rush of the 1860's, when pioneers disappointed in the California stampede turned back eastward to comb the Oregon Trail country they had ignored on their original trek west.

title: 30 Killed and 27 Injured In a Storm in Mexico
description: GUADALAJARA, Mexico, July 8 (AP)At least 30 persons were killed and 27 injured seriously today when a cloudburst hit the central Mexico town of Ocotlan south of here, authorities of Jalisco state said.

title: Events Today
description: SCHAEFER MUSICAL FESTIVAL Deodato), Calhoon, Reuben and the Jels, Wollman Rink, Central Park, 7.

title: Lanes to Be Shifted On the Queensboro During Rush Hour
description: Starting today, the upper roadway of the Queensboro Bridge will be converted to oneway, outbound route during the evening rush hour.

title: Detectives Charge Department With Eroding Their Prestige
description: New York City detectives, who have traditionally seen themselves as the elite of the Police Department, are complaining about what they feel is a departmental policy of deliberately eroding their prestige and depleting the ranks of the Detective Bureau.

title: Governor's Session
description: During the regular sessions of the New York State Legislature, Governor Rockefeller exercises extraordinary power because he is a vigorous, persuasive chief executive with tremendous personal clout and a full legislative programand also because the Legislature in recent years has been dominated by the Republican party and the Republican party has been dominated by Mr. Rockefeller. His power expands even further during special sessions of the Legislature, which are called at the Governor's command and are limited to an agenda prepared by the Governor.

title: Stunt Pilot Escapes Crash
description: LAKE CHARLES, La., July 8 (AP)One of the Navy's Blue Angel stunt planes crashed today during an air show, but the pilot ejected safely an walked away from the crash. The pilot was identified as Lieut. Steve Lambert, 29 years old of Sacramento, Calif. He was performing during a charity show near Chennault. Air Base.

title: Figure at Watergate Finally Gets Attention
description: STAMFORD, Conn., July 8 (AP)With all the national attention focused on the personalities involved in the Watergate affair, the name of one principal had gone virtually unrecognized: Frank Wills.

title: Classy Midnight Jamming
description: The midnight jam sessions at Radio City Music Hall were the high spots of last year's Newport Festival, and the midnight session on Friday, while not cresting the 1972 one, did provide four hours of exceptional jazz, intelligently put together and paced.

title: ISRAELIS ARE SAID TO MEET TUNISIANS
description: A Tunisian official has said that secret contacts between Tunisian and Israeli representatives are under way in Geneva to advance a new effort for peace in the Middle East, Time magazine reports this week.

title: BANKERS ARRANGE TO DEFEND DOLLAR
description: BASEL, July 8The major Western powers declared today that the necessary technical arrangements are in place for the defense of the dollar in the exchange markets and suggested the time may be appropriate to implement them.

title: CITY COURTS FOUND WEAK IN SECURITY
description: A study of court security problems in the city has concluded that the courts are grievously deficient in manpower, training capacity and equipment.

title: Stock Market Q. and A.
description: WASHINGTONQUESTION: Should the average person play the political stock market? ANSWER: Nobody should play the market  political investment is serious business, requiring much time and emotional commitment. The novice should first decide basic investment goalssuch as capital appreciation or dividend yield.

title: WIRE FOX TERRIER BEST AT WALLKILL
Horror Comics Are Banned By the Brazilian Authorities
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, July 8  Horror comic books were banned yesterday by Brazilian censors.

title: Dollar Plan Ready
description: Arrangements by which the United States could borrow funds with which to support the sagging dollar in foreign currency markets were reported ready by central bankers of the Western powers meeting in Basel yesterday Details on Page 51.

title: 60,000 Ducks or 78 Families?
description: WATER MILL, L. I., July There's some soulsearching going on these days in this small Hamptons community: Who should live on a 10acre tract of land running from Main Street down to Mecox Bay78 wealthy families or 60,000 ducks?

title: NationalCoalition Cabinet In Lebanon Is Announced
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 8 A national coalition Cabinet was formed here tonight under Premier  designate Takieddin Solh, ending a 17day political crisis that had threatened to split the country.

title: Sabotaging the G.O.P.'s Rivals: Story of a $100,000 Operation
description: The Republican party's effort to sabotage Democratic Presidential candidates in 1972 was a twopronged operation approved by some of President Nixon's most influential aides, directed in part by White House officials, and financed with more than $100,000 in unreported contributions to the Nixon campaign.

title: Soviet Opens Disputed Mill on Lake
description: MOSCOW, July 8A second controversial pulp mill started operations today in the basin of Siberia's pollutionthreatened Lake Baikal.

title: Major League Leaders
Joyce Rosen Wed to D. A. Simson
description: GREAT NECK, L.I., July 8  At the Great Neck Synagogue today, Miss Joyce Felicia Rosen, daughter of Mrs. and Mrs. Bernard Rosen of Kew Gardens Hills, Queens, was married to Douglas Allan Simson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Theodore Simson of Columbus, Ohio.

title: Region Backs State School Tax And Transit Subsidy, Poll Finds
description: Residents of the metropolitan area favor creating state and Federal jobs for the unemployed, subsidizing public transportation while building more highways and replacing local property taxes with a statewide school tax, acording to a Gallup survey released yesterday.

title: 1777 Vermont Flag Stolen
description: BOSTON, July 8 (AP)  A Bennington, Vt., flag flown in 17771795 has been stolen from a bicentennial exhibit of 17 flags hanging in the Grand Hall at Boston City Hall.

title: China's Colleges to Readmit Bourgeoisie
description: HONG KONG, July 8Some sons and daughters of the bourgeoisie of preCommunist days will have a chance this year of getting into institutions of higher learning in China for the first time since the Cultural Revolution.

title: COUNCIL TO EXPLAIN ROCKEFELLER U. AIM
description: Rockefeller University is forming an advisory council to help increase public understanding of the 72yearold institution's work in basic research, clinical investigation and advanced education.

title: Purchasers in Survey
description: A drop in new orders, increasing inventories, materials shortages, rising employment, poor quality of merchandise and poor service were reported by members of the National Association of Purchasing Management in June.

title: Yankee Records
2 CANADIANS SAFE, VIETCONG DECLARE
description: SAIGON South Vietnam, Monday, July 9 (Reuters)The Vietcong acknowledged today that they are holding two Canadian Vietnam truce observers who have been missing for more than ID days.

title: O! What a Fall It Was: Central Park Vandals Crack a Noble Head As Bard Loses Face
description: ALAS, poor Shakespeare! A fellow of infinite jest, of most excellent fancy. He hath borne graffiti beyond the flash of merriment. Now get him to the monument chamber and let them remove the paint an inch thick'Where be his features now, his eyes, his pate, his jowls?

title: TractorPulling, Too, Can Be Fun
description: CHATHAM, N. Y., July 8  A twoday oldfashioned exposition ended here today with a demonstration of the newest rural sport, tractorpulling.

title: Eagleton Calls Nixon Plan On Fuel A Colossal Bust
description: ASHINGTON, July 8 (UPI) Senator Thomas F. Eagleton, Missouri Demoract who sponsored a bill giving President Nixon authority to order fuel supplies to energyshort areas, said today that the Administration's voluntary program was a colossal bust.

title: Sabotaging the G.O.P.'s Rivals: Story of a $100,000 Operation
13 Still Missing in Rhodesia After Mission School Raid
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, July 8 (Reuters)  Security forces searching for guerrillas who abducted almost 300 pupils and staff members from a Jesuit mission school in northeastern Rhodesia found a 14yearold girl today who had collapsed after escaping from her kidnappers.

title: Lost Balloon Descends After Drifting 80 Miles
description: LINCKLAEN, N. Y., July 8 A helium balloon nine stories high drifted to earth in a stand of tall trees near this Chenango County village today. The 500pound bag, which was being prepared for a transatlantic flight later this year, had broken loose yesterday from its moorings near Lake Ontario, 80 miles to the northwest.

title: Czech Town on Coal Bed Being Razed
Miss Caroline Sidnam Is Bride Of Myer S. Berlow, an Ad Man
description: WACCABUC, N.Y., July 8 Miss Caroline Northcote Sidnam, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alan Sidnam of New York, was married here this afternoon in the Mead Memorial Chapel to Myer. Stanley Berlow, son of Dr. and Mrs. Stanley Berlow of Madison, Wis.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE SOVEREIGN STATE OF I.T.T. by Anthony Sampson. 323 pages. Stein and Day. $10.

title: Buffs Find New Hero To Emulate
description: To say the percussionist Milford Graves is phenomenal doesn't catch the grittiness of his performance Friday night at Alice Tully Hall.

title: Stockton Wins Milwaukee Golf by Stroke on 276
description: MILWAUKEE, July 8 (AP) A former Professional Golfers Association champion, Dave Stockton, scrambled home with a frontrunning 73 today for onestroke victory in the Greater Milwaukee open golf tournament.

title: 5 Bikers in State Races Attacked in Central Park
description: Five bike riders competing in the amateur state championship bicycle races in Central Park were attacked in separate incidents yesterday morning by young thugs armed with chains, knives and clubs.

title: New Books
Drinan to Seek Wiretap Ban
description: BOSTON, July 8 (AP)Representative Robert Drinan, Democrat of Massachusetts, said today that he would file a bill that would seek to ban wiretapping under all circumstances.

title: French Warn Ships in ATest Area
description: PARIS, July 8 (AP)  France issued a warning today to shipping around her South Pacific nuclear test site, in'a clear indication that the disputed atomic blasts may soon begin.

title: U.S. Accepts a Gift Of Mountain Land In North Carolina
description: ASHEVILLE, N. C., July 8 Public ownership of scenic western North Carolina mountain lands has been established with federal acceptance of a gift of 5,300 acres made to the Mantahala National Forest by a former forest ranger.

title: Bridge:
description: Some players are understandably mystified by the phrase fourthsuit forcing, which is common in tournament circles. Everyone agrees that a bid of the fourth suit at responder's second turn is forcing, so why bother to mention it?

title: Mercury Hits 94, and Even Bridges Find It Sticky
description: Highways were glutted yesterday with motorists returning from a hot and sunny weekend at beaches and in the country.

title: Diary of a Mugger Lists 30 Victims, Loot, Weapon
description: Alexander B. Jackson, a 19yearold high school dropout, kept a detailed official holdup record crediting himself with 30 muggings in five months. In neat columns, he carefully listed the date, time and place of each robbery, the sex, race and age group of the victim, the cash and other booty seized and the weapon used.

title: Turbotrain Fire Delays L.I. Service for an Hour
description: Service on the Long Island Rail Road into and out of Penn Station was disrupted for just over an hour yesterday afternoon after a fire broke out in an engine of a Bostonbound Turbotrain.

title: Superauthors Find Supersales Ease Pain of Superproduction
description: Michael Avallone plays pinball machines. John D. MacDonald pampers two of his vertebrae. Don Pendleton takes 15minute hot showers. Alan Riefe uses Speedwriting, and Susanne Jaffe plays British rock music on her phonograph.

title: Windward Passage Leads Fleet in TransPacific Race
description: LOS ANGELES, July 8 (AP) Windward Passage continued to lead her competitors today in the transPacific yacht race, but in corrected standing she dropped to 10th in the fleet.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MARBLEHEAD, Mass., July 8 (UPI)A record total of 109 boats left here late this morning in the 15th MarbleheadtoHalifax yacht race. Last year's winner, Ted Hood, removed himself from the field shortly before the race because he plans to enter his yacht, Robin, in the world oneton championships. There won't be enough time to get there [Halifax] and back ready to be shipped to Sardinia, Hood said.

title: Pam E. Seton Bride Of Joseph Lorenzo
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., July 8 Miss Pam Elinor Seton and Joseph Anthony Lorenzo were married here this afternoon at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Charles B. Seton. Rabbi Samuel Silver and the Rev. Peter Jacobs, Roman Catholic priest, officiated.

title: Jazz Fans Pack Up a Full Bag of Newport Memories
description: The Newport Jazz Festival ended its 10day run last night on a note of rousing jubilation before a capacity audience of 16,000 in the Nassau Coliseum, but it left its promoter, George Wein, a somewhat poorer and wiser man.

title: Ronald Klein Marries Miss Mariette Krausz
description: Miss Mariette T. Krausz was married here last evening at Temple Kehilath Jeshurun to Ronald Klein, a Ph.D. candidate at George Washington University. The ceremony was performed by Rabbi Heskel Lookstein.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The equivalent of Watergate occurs from time to time in all countries. This in no way excuses the illegal acts revealed in Washington, but why have these caused public confidence in our executive branch to be rated below that in many other countries?

title: Traffic to Be Narrowed for Repairs
description: Traffic will be restricted to one lane in each direction between the end of the New Jersey Turnpike extension and the entrance to the Holland Tunnel from now until the end of the summer.

title: Rates Continue to Rise
description: The upward spiral of interest rates, which already has made some forms of shortterm money more expensive than at their 196970 peaks, shows no signs of ending. In fact, it appears increasingly probable that credit Credit will become not only more costly but somewhat scarce as well.

title: Box Scores of Major League Baseball Games
Alaskan Village's Hopes Entwined With Oil and Pipeline
Fellow Lawyer Weds Darlene Diamond
description: Miss Darlene Meryl Diamond and Samuel K. Keiner, lawyers here, were married here last evening by Rabbi Max Schenk, auxiliary rabbi of Temple Rodeph Sholom, in the study of his home.

title: Pepitone Returns to U.S.
description: TOKYO, July 8Joe Pepitone, who joined the Yakult Atoms of the Japanese Central League on June 24, has returned to the United States to Iron out his marital problem, a team spokesman said today,

title: Networks to Rotate Coverage This Week
TROON TRIUMPHS IN 45MILE SAIL
description: GREENWICH, Conn., July 8 Kendrick R. Wilson Jr.s Troon, a Whitby45 sloop out of the Norwalk (Conn.) Yacht Club, won the Commodore Blattmann Trophy today by placing first on corrected time in the Riverside Yacht Club's 42d annual Stratford Shoal overnight race on Long Island Sound.

title: Diana Rigg Is Married
description: LONDON, July 8 (UPI) Diana Rigg, the actress, well known as Emma Peel in The Avengers television series, disclosed today she was secretly married to Menachen Gueffen an Israeli artist, on Friday.

title: Yankees Rout Twins,70, On Stottlemyre 4Hitter
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., July 8  Ignoring the pitfalls of trip to Minneapolis, including maneating escalator and hotel fire, Mel Stottlemyre steadied the Yankees today by pitching a fourhitter as they whipped the Twins, 70.

title: Amon, Stuck Victors at Ring As FittipaldiStewart Car Fails
description: NUERBURGRING, West Germany, July 8 (UPI)  Chris Amon of. New Zealand and HansJoachim Stuck of West Germany led a BMW 1, 2, 3 weep today in the Nuerburgring grand prix for production cars.

title: PARSONS IS FIRST IN VOLUNTEER 500
description: BRISTOL, Tenn., July 8 (UPI)  Benny Parsons of Ellerbe, N. C., gave Chevrolet a fifth straight victory at Bristol International Speedway today, scoring an easy sevenlap triumph in the Volunteer 500.

title: A Nervous Montevideo Awaits the Outcome as Workers Resist Army Crackdown
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 8A siren cuts through the rain and the winter air. A blue armored police wagon pulls up at a soap factory and disgorges policemen with machine guns. They force their way into the closed plant, round up the workers inside and drive them out. A few hours later, the workers return and reoccupy the building.

title: Midwest Governors Meet On Price Freeze and Fuel
description: RAPID CITY, S.D., July 8 (UPI)The Midwestern Governors met today to discuss the effects of the fuel shortage and the price freeze on food supplies but one governor said he would not ask for resolutions on the issues.

title: Bahamas Busily Adopts Trappings of a Nation
description: NASSAU, the Bahamas, July 8For George A. Smith Bahamian independence means more than selfdetermination. It means pink plastic flamingos, blue plastic marlins, at least 60,000 black, gold and aquamarine flags, a sensitive guest list, interminable protocol and even the Bible (Leviticus, 25th chapter).

title: ARTHUR CALWELL, LEADER IN SYDNEY
description: SYDNEY, Australia, July 8 Arthur Augustus Calwell, leader of the Labor party opposition in the Australian Parliament from 1960 to 1967, died in a hospital in Melbourne today. His age was 76.

title: Balloonist Loses His Top
description: LAKELAND, Fla., July 8 (AP) Kingswood Sprott's attempt to set a hotair balloon altitude record ended yesterday when the top of his balloon came apart 29,000 feet below his goal. At that time, Mr. Sprott, 39 years old, and his balloon were 6,000 feet above Lakeland.

title: U.S. URGED TO CUT DEATHS BY FIRES
description: WASHINGTON, July 8Eight thousand deaths by fire could he avoided over the next five years if the Government would setup a coordinated program costing about $150million year, the National Commission on Fire Prevention and Control says in its final report.

title: Stage: New Plays Festival on Bowery
description: The second annual international New Plays Festival at the downtown Workshop of the Players Art is a pip and a bargain. What we have here, at this thriving Off Off Broadway showcase, is a provocative cavalcade of new oneact works. In the final week, tomorow through Saturday, 12 W.P.A, plays will continue rotating at 333 Bowery (call 2280900 or 4739345).

title: Another Senate Test
description: LONDON, July 8  An American woman who has long been concerned at her country's role in Indochina was told about President Nixon's agreement to stop bombing Cambodia on Aug. 15. Is that A.M. or P.M.? she asked.

title: Advertising: Changes at Playboy
description: Los Angeles and San Francisco.

title: NED DAVID FRANK
description: Ned David Frank, a partner in the law firm of Sheldon, Tarnoff & Frank here and an Assistant Attorney General under Robert F. Kennedy in 196263, died yesterday in an auto accident near Peekskill, N. Y. He was 36 years old and lived at 500 East 77th Street.

title: Policy Discussions Planned This Week
description: Governing bodies of the New York Stock Exchange and the American Stock Exchange will hold policy meetings this week as worry clouds hang heavily over Wall Street.

title: Again Italy's Premier
Police Cruiser Missing
description: WILMINGTON, Mass., July (AP)The state police reported the theft early today of a fully equipped cruiser from the driveway of an unidentified state trooper's home.

title: F.B.I. Reform
description: One reform proposal which is gaining prominence as an outgrowth of Watergate is the deceptively simple notion of transforming the F.B.I. into an independent investigatory agency divorced from the President and his Attorney General. This is, in effect, proposal to remove the F.B.I. from the control of the elected representatives of the people.

title: Caramoor Medea Yields a New Star
description: A revival of Cherubini's Medea makes much sense in our day, if only a cautionary tale for chauvinistic males, the moral being that it is extremely chancy to underrate a woman whose previous record of violence includes having her brother dismembered. But bringing back this 1797 opera, which has never managed to gain a foothold in the repertory in this country, can also be defended on purely musical and dramatic grounds, as a staging of the work at the Caramoor Festival on Saturday night amply demonstrated. As is usual nowadays, an Italian version was sung rather than Cherubini's original French.

title: Oil Pipeline Equipment Seen By Touring Representatives
description: PRUDHOE BAY, Alaska, July 18 (UPI)  United States representatives planning legislative action on the proposed transAlaska oil pipeline inspected mountains of equipment today that has lain unused while controversy swirls around the project.

title: HERBERT S. CHASE
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., July 8 Herbert S. Chase, a former vice president and director of the Tide Water Associated Oil Company, died yesterday at his home here. He was 76.

title: Rogers Leaves Helsinki For Day's Visit to Prague
description: HELSINKI, Finland, July 8 (Reuters)Secretary of State William P. Rogers flew to Prague today, becoming the first American Secretary of State to visit Czechoslovakia since World War II.

title: JAVITS RECOUNTS EFFORT FOR JUDGE
description: Senator Jacob K. Javits said early today that Federal Judge Mark A. Costantino had been informally disapproved for his judicial appointment by the American Bar Association in late 1970 but that Mr. Javits later submitted his name formally after a campaign by bar associations here and by the Staten Island Republican political organization.

title: GURNEY ASSERTS PANEL SHOULD GET PRESIDENT'S FILES
description: WASHINGTON, July 8Senator Edward J. Gurney, who has been the stanchest defender of President Nixon on the Senate Watergate committee, said today that he believed that Presidential papers bearing on the Watergate. investigation should be made available to the committee.

title: STATE FUND CLAIM IS HELD UP BY U.S.
description: The Federal Government has held up New York State claims for reimbursement for $726million for various socialservice programs pending review It is also rechecking $589million in reimbursement payments already made to the state making a total of $1,315billior in dispute.

title: McLain May Drop Further
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, July 8 (UPI)Manager Joe Sparks of he ClassAAA Iowa Oaks said today he expected the former Cy Young Award winner, Denny McLain, to leave for Shreveport of the ClassA Texas League tomorow. McLain reportedly has talked with the Oaks owner Ray Johnston, who also owns the Shreveport team, about going there for more work. The 29yearold McLain has a 14 wonlost record with Iowa and a 7.55 earned run average in 31 innings.

title: SIR DALRAE PACES YEAR'S BEST MILE
description: Sir Dalrae won his sixth straight race and recorded the fastest time of the year on Saturday night at Sportsman's Park in Chicago.

title: Dodge Building Forecast Raised to $95.5Billion
description: Rising housing construction costs and a recovery in the business construction sector have resulted in an upward revision to $95.5billion in the 1973 construction forecast, the F. W. Dodge division of McGrawHill reported over weekend.

title: Parcel Post Service Is Restored With Chinese After 25 Years
description: WASHINGTON, July 8The United States Postal Service announced today that parcel post mail service between the United States and China was being restored.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, July 8Coach Bob Sprague thinks his Monmouth baseball team had a great season this year, but it's not because they won 10 of 18 games. It's because two of his players, Pete Cusick, a catcher, and Jeff Bouton, a pitcher, were drafted and signed major league teams. Cusick, from Demarest, was taken in the 10th round by the San Diego Padres, and Bouton, from Nutley, was grabbed on the last round by the Detroit Tigers.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Houston Astros, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens. 8:05 P.M. (RadioWHN, 8 P.M.)

title: 50,000 Spectators Searched as Security Surrounds Opening of Maccabiah Games
description: RAMAT GAN, Israel, July 9  The ninth Maccabiah Games, bringing Jewish sportsmen here from 27 countries, opened tonight under tight security as a precaution against a possible Arab attempt to disrupt the competition.

title: Bruno, on 67, Is Leader In Westchester Open Golf
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., July 9Bob Bruno of the Pelham Country Club scored a 34, 3367 on the 6,429yard, par 71 Sunningdale course for a onestroke lead after the first round of the Westchester County Golf Association's 51st annual open championship today.

title: ALIEN SMUGGLING CHARGED ON COAST
description: WASHINGTON, July 9  A group of 25 persons known as The Blondes, said by the Justice Department to be the largest aliensmuggling ring ever uncovered in the United States, has been indicted on charges of conspiring to smuggle in aliens from Mexico.

title: Traces of China Blast Gone
description: WASHINGTON, July 9 (AP)Radioactive particles, which crossed over the northern California coast last Thursday following a Chinese nuclear test on June 27, have passed over the United States, the Atomic Energy Commission said today. An A.E.C. spokesman said that the particles, carried in a high altitude air mass, had isappeared from all monitoring equipment.

title: U.S., IN SHIFT, PLANS YOUNGSCIENTIST AID
description: WASHINGTON, July 9 (UPI)  The Administration retreated today on its plans to phase out research training fellowships for young scientists. The Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, Caspar W. Weinberger, promised $30million for that purpose.

title: Cambodian Premier Says U. S. Isn't Consulting Him
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, July 9  Cambodia's Premier, In Tam, has declared that the Phnom Penh Government is not involved in negotiations with anyone to end the threeyearold war in this country,

title: Democrats Plan to Seek Testimony From Ziegler
description: WASHINGTON, July 9 (UPI) The Democratic National Committee said today that it would subpoena the White House press secretary, Ronald Ziegler, to give testimony July 23 in its Watergate civil suits.

title: Strong Arm And Red Hand
description: Chairman George A. Spater of American Airlines probably understated the case last week when he said that a large part of the money raised from the business community for political purposes is given in fear of what would happen if it were not given. Such money, in short, is largely payoff money, even if nothing is specifically purchased; yet, even as the Watergate investigations are finally exposing the system, another Senate committee is trying to ease off on the stronger campaign financing law that went into effect in 1972.

title: CONCERN SUES S.E.C ON AGENCY INQUIRY
description: A company under investigaLion by the Securities and Exchange Commission filed suit here yesterday against the Government agency on charges that the investigation was the result of bias, prejudice and prejudgment.

title: Major League Baseball
description: Tuesday, July 10, 1973

title: BROOKE CITES NEED OF AID TO INDOCHINA
description: WASHINGTON, July 9 (AP) Senator Edward M. Brooke reports that a human disaster of major proportions is possible in Indochina without extensive outside relief.

title: Lindsay Scores Governor On Planning for Drug Law
description: Mayor Lindsay charged yesterday that the Rockefeller administration had not yet forged a practical plan for implementing the state's tough new drug law, although the law is expected to cause thousands of extra trials after it goes into effect Sept. 1.

title: New Process Makes Cottonseed Oil a Source of LowCost Protein for Humans
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 9 An Agriculture Department laboratory here has developed a process that could make cottonseed an important source of lowcost protein for human consumption.

title: Weekend Boxing
description: By The Associated Press

title: P.S.C. Aide Holds Information Calls Should Cost 7.1c
description: A Public Service Commission examiner recommended yesterday that the New York Telephone Company be alloWed to charge 7.1 cents for an information call if the number is listed in any directory in the state.

title: Soviet Considers Shift on Trade
description: MOSCOW, July 9The Soviet Union is considering a far reaching reorganization of its cumbersome foreign trade administration in order to stimulate exports and give industry a more direct voice in foreign economic relations.

title: UNIONS AT BREWERY BACK PENSION RISE
description: ST. LOUIS, July 9 (UPI)Members of two unions that face fewer jobs because of automation at the world's largest brewery have ratified a contract that provides a married employe a $300 monthly bonus if he retires three years early.

title: 14 Organizations Urge the Government to Stop Providing Funds for Sterilization of Minors
description: WASHINGTON, July 9A group of organizations, most of them supporters of family planning and birth control, called today for an end to the use of Federal funds for the sterilization of minors.

title: TORTURE CHARGES DENIED BY SAIGON
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 9 (AP)  A Vietnamese Roman Catholic priest has charged in a complaint to the international peacekeeping commission that the South Vietnamese authorities tortured political prisoners after the ceasefire. He said their actions had led to 14 deaths and more than 500 injuries among inmates at Con Son, the island prison in the South China Sea.

title: Bias in Reverse Laid to the State By White Concern That Bid Low
description: Charging it is a victim of racial discrimination, a whiteowned electrical contracting company is suing the state because it was disapproved for a housingconstruction job on which it was the low bidder, but which a state agency feels should go to a minorityowned concern.

title: ACTION POSTPONED ON SHERIFF'S POST
description: WHITE PLAINS, July 9A proposal by the outgoing Westchester County Executive, Edwin G. Michaelian, to abolish the office of county sheriff was put aside today by the County Board of Legislators.

title: 3 Institutions Gain
description: Two large bank holding campanics reported yesterday higher earnings for the second quarter and the first half of 1973, but a third concern, while showing higher earnings for the first six months, had lower profits in the second quarter,

title: Couple Found Shot to Death
description: CORTLAND, Ohio, July 9 (UPI)An elderly steel company executive and his wife were found shot to death at their home in this northeastern community yesterday. Killed were C. Walter Holmquist, 78 years old, and his wife, Dorothy, also in her 70's.

title: State Sees a Doubling of Medicaid Rolls
description: Abe Lavine, State Social Services Commissioner, yesterday foresaw potential doubling of the state's 270,000 aged, blind and disabled welfare recipients after the Federal takeover on Jan. 1 of administration of their aid. Resulting Medicaid costs, he said, could wipe out a $165million annual savings of state and local cost.

title: Ticket Blitz and Traffic Taper Off
description: Only 361, summonses were issued to illegal parkas yesterday in the city's new gettough program between 30th and 66th Streets, compared to as many as 1,200 tickets a day issued in the same area last week when the drive officially got under way.

title: H. HARPER M'KEE
description: H. Harper McKee, a retired partner in Brokaw, Dixon and McKee, consulting engineers, died yesterday at his home, 60 Tennis Place, Forest Hills, Queens. He was 82 years old.

title: FIGURES ON GAS HELD UNOFFICIAL
description: WASHINGTON, July 9The Continental Oil Company has told the Federal Trade Commission that figures on the company's reserves that are given to the American Gas Association are the conscientious, professional calculations of individual engineers or geologists, not official corporate estimates.

title: For Arabs, a Reappraisal of Soviet Ties
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 9Arab governments in confrontation with Israel are painfully reappraising their relations with the Soviet Union in the. light of the agreement between Moscow and Washington to reduce tensions.

title: Sabotage by Segretti Network of Amateurs
description: The smallframed lawyer who arrived in Florida in December of 1971 resembled in style countless other young bachelors on a brief winter's fling.

title: FANS SAY LONGER TO SLY'S HIGHER
description: Sly and the Family Stone came onto the stage at the Louis Armstrong Memorial Stadium on Sunday under some difficulty. After waiting an hour for equipment to be set upa very lastminute announcement gave power failure as the causethe crowd, steaming in the evening's heat, had wilted, its commendable patience turned soporific.

title: Redundant Watchdog
description: Some of the state's public schools could undoubtedly be run more efficientlyas could the mass transit system and a variety of public service enterprises for which Albany is ultimately responsible. In view of the far from glorious record of some alreadyexisting watchdog agencies, creation of the new Office of Education Performance Review holds limited promise of dramatic educational reforms.

title: Mercury Reaches 94 Power Cut
description: New Yorkers perspired through another day of tropical heat yesterdaythe temperature reached 94 degrees at 2:15 P.M.but they were not alone. A stagnant air mass sat immobile over most of the Eastern Seaboard and stretched as far west as Chicago.

title: $11,170 in Win Tickets On Secretariat Uncashed
description: CHICAGO, July 8 (AP)More than 5,000 bettors, obviously souvenirminded, have yet to cash $11,170 worth of winning tickets on Secretaria in the June 30 Arlington Invitational.

title: Box Scores of Major League Baseball Games
Bhutto Given Authority to Recognize Bangladesh
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, Tuesday, July 10 (AP)  The National Assembly gave President Zulfikar Ali Bhutto authority early today to recognize Bangladesh.

title: High Court Upholds Atlantic City Plans for Ocean Housing
description: TRENTON, July 9 (AP)The New Jersey Supreme Court ruled today that Atlantic City could liberalize its zoning ordinance to promote apartment development a long the ocean as one means of revitalizing the city.

title: MISMANAGEMENT OF WHEAT SALES TO SOVIET FOUND
description: WASHINGTON, July 9The General Accounting Office charged Agriculture Department officials today with mismanagement of last year's massive wheat sales to the Soviet Union and said that excessive export subsidies and high American food prices had resulted.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Rise at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, July 9Yields on United States Treasury bills rose in the Government's weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: New Zealand Staves Off Cricket Loss to England
description: LEEDS, England, July 9 (Reuters)  An unfinished 70minute last wicket stand by Glenn Turner and Hedley Howarth foiled England's effort to beat New Zealand in the third test cricket match today with a day to spare.

title: 10 Law Men Killed in June
description: WASHINGTON, July 9 (UPI) Ten law enforcement officers were killed in the line of duty during June, the Federal Bureau of Investigation said today. Nine were slain in June, 1972.

title: 112 in Peace Corps Freed By Amin, Flown to Zaire
description: NAIROBI. Kenya, July 9After almost two and a half days of detention in Uganda, 112 American Peace Corps volunteers were permitted today to continue their journey to the neighboring central African country of Zaire.

title: American Airlines Asks Return of G.O.P. Fund
description: American Airlines said yesterday that it had formally requested the return of a $55,000 illegal corporate contribution it has admitted making to President Nixon's reelection Campaign, according to The Associated Press.

title: Holland Festival: A Variety of Sparkling Artistry
description: AMSTERDAM, the NetherlandsOver the years I have come to love the Netherlands, and to love in particular its Holland Festival.

title: VAN VECHTEN DEAD INVESTMENT BANKER
description: Schuyler Van Vechten, a vice president of Lee Higginson Corporation, former investment bankers, and a longtime trustee of St. Luke's Hospital, died Friday at his home in Rumson, N. J. He was 83 years old and also, lived at 925 Park Avenue.

title: Deaths
