description: ABRAHAMIsaac. Devoted father of Eva Stem and Dorothy Schwartz, loving grandfather or Norman, Judy, Phyllis and Cathy. Adored greatgrandfather. Services of The Boulevard Chapels, 312 Coney Island Avenue at Prospect Park, Brooklyn, today at 10:15 A.M.

title: The Cadman CoOp Acquitted of Fraud
description: A corporate housing sponsor and the attorney for the sponsor were acquitted of fraud charges in Supreme Court in Brooklyn yesterday in the sale of apartments in the Cadman Towers cooperative in Brooklyn Heights.

title: U.S. MAY PROPOSE CUT IN TRUCE UNIT
description: WASHINGTON, July 9The United States has run into difficulty in finding a suitable replacement for Canada on the fournation Vietman ceasefire, commission and may have to propose a revamped twonation body if a substitute is not obtained by the end of the month, an Administration official said today.

title: Judge Disqualifies Himself In Libel Suit by Chotiner
description: CONCORD, N. H., July 9 (AP)  Federal District Judge Bownes has disqualified himself from hearing further arguments in a $3million libel suit filed by Murray Chotiner, a former Presidential aide, against. The Manchester Union Leader and Arthur Egan, a reporter.

title: MATTWELL, ON 70 LEADS IKE GOLF
description: ELMSFORD, N. Y., July 9Mike Mattwell of Glen Cove, L. I., a golfcourse irrigation specialist, found the fairways and greens to his liking today as he led the Ike tournament with a 70.

title: Constitutional Conventions Limited in Scope by Senate
description: WASHINGTON, July 9 (AP) The Senate passed a bill today to establish ground rules for constitutional conventions called on the application of state legislatures.

title: ROGERS STOPS OFF FOR PRAGUE PACT
description: PRAGUE, July 9Secretary of State William P. Rogers signed a consular convention with Czechoslovakia here today that both sides said could be the beginning of new, normal relations between the two countries.

title: Bridge: Sometimes a Cunning Player Can Be Victim of His Cunning
description: Those who practice low cunning and deceptive maneuvers at the bridge table often get good results there by. But their victims can comfort themselves with the reflection that now and again the cunning ones cut themselves on their own sharpness.

title: Mets' Records
WRIGHT'S 66 LEADS L.I. GOLF BY 5 SHOTS
description: FORT SALONGA, L. I., July 9Jimmy Wright of Inwood took the lead today with a sixunderpar 66 in the opening round of the Long Island Professional Golfers' Association championship at Indian Hills Country Club.

title: SinoSoviet Anniversary
description: The most important international political development of the past generation took place exactly a decade ago. Between midJune and midJuly 1963, the formerly veiled tensions between Moscow and Peking suddenly exploded in full public view, and what had been the unbreakable comradely alliance of the 1950's became the open bitter enmity of the past decade. That enmity, of course, is the basic fact about which all current calculations of global politics now revolve.

title: The Dance
description: Lack of creative character makes the Bolshoi Ballet's spectacular scraps resemble one another to a startling degree. It is only when dancers appear in works that have musical substance, duration and a semblance of original choreography that one is able to discern more substantial individual qualities. On Sunday at the Metropolitan Opera it was possible to appreciate Ludmilla Semenyaka's considerable skill.

title: Radio
Seaman Here After Getting Heart Treatment at Sea
description: A seaman whose heart attack prompted scientists returning from observing the June 30 eclipse off Africa to improvise electronic devices for treatment of his condition was reported yesterday to be in satisfactory condition at the United States Public Health Service Hospital on Staten Island.

title: DWIGHT DAVIS JR SPORTSMAN, DIES
description: SOUTHAMPTON, LI., July 9  Dwight F. Davis Jr., a former vice president of the Mets, the New York National League baseball club, died today in Southampton Hospital after a short illness. He was 66 years old and lived here.

title: News Summary and Index
description: After almost two and a half days of detention in Uganda, 112 Peace Corps volunteers were permitted to continue their journey to the neighboring Central African country of Zare. The Uganda President, Maj. Gen. Idi Amin, ordered the volunteers released upon receiving assurances from Zare that they had indeed been invited there, most of them to teach in secondary schools. [Page 1, Columns 56.]

title: Marchi Begins Visit Of 3 Days in Israel
description: TEL AVIV, July 9. Reuters  State Senator John Marchi, the Republican candidate for Mayor of New York, arrived here today for a threeday visit. as guest of the Israeli Government.

title: Shopping Centers Change Habits in France
description: PARIS, July 4The water fountain in front of the Christian Dior boutique clinking a counterpoint to the James Taylor ballad on the sound system.

title: ABPLANALP AIDE DENIES INQUIRY
description: A spokesman for the Precision Valve Corporation said yesterday that it was unaware of any investigation of its pricing policies by Government antitrust experts in 1970 and 1971.

title: PRICES ADVANCE ON AMEX AND OTC
description: For the first time in five trading sessions, prices rose yesterday on the American Stock Exchange in stepped up volume, spurred by an increase in large block trading. Prices also rose in the overthecounter market.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yester. day was:

title: WESTON TRIUMPHS OVER ANTUO FERNIO
description: Harold Weston Jr. of Greenwich Village snapped the unbeaten string of Vito Antuofermo of Brooklyn at 18 last night at the Felt Forum when the referee, Herbie Kronowitz, stopped his fight with the Italianborn middleweight at 2 minutes 53 seconds of the fifth round.

title: MISMANAGEMENT OF WHEAT SALES TO SOVIET FOUND
description: WASHINGTON, July 9The General Accounting Office charged Agriculture Department officials today with mismanagement of last year's massive wheat sales to the Soviet Union and said that excessive export subsidies and high American food prices had resulted.

title: 16th Spoleto Festival Ends With BoxOffice Record
description: SPOLETO, Italy, July 9The 16th and most successful of all Festivals of Two Worlds closed here last night with the traditional concert in the square before the cathedral. Christopher Keene, the young American conductor, led the combined forces of three orchestras and three choirs in Benjamin Britten's War Requiem before an audience of thousands seated and standing on the ramps, steps and loggias of the architectural palimpsest enclosing the piazza and overlooking the valley of Spoleto.

title: U.S. PARTY IN CHINA TOURS FACTORY CITY
description: SIAN, China, July 9 (AP)A Congressional delegation that touring China visited a textile mill and a museum in this industrial city today and saw vast highproducing cotton fields.

title: 2 Holdup Suspects Shot, One Fatally By a Shop Owner
description: Two men who allegedly held up a Staten Island liquor store for $70 last night were shot, one of them fatally, by the store's owner, the police said.

title: Advertising: Continuing Battle
description: Victor G. Bloede, one time copywriter and now chairman and chief executive of Benton & Bowles, will, as the new chairman of the American Association of Advertising Agencies, continue the fightback spirit of his predecesor, James J. McCaffrey.

title: Table for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New York
BONVIVANT TRIES TO GET SOUP BACK
description: NEWARK, July 9A trial opened here today to determine whether the United States Government has the right to destroy 1.5 million cans of soup and other food products processed by Bon Vivant Soups, Inc., and now held in sealed warehouses throughout the country.

title: AUSTRIAN DEFEATS BROMIC BY 64, 64
description: BAASTAD, Sweden, July 9 (AP)Topseeded Stan Smith of the United States was on the sidelines with a bye as the $75,000 Swedish international tennis championships opened today.

title: DISMISSAL SOUGHT BY 3 IN VESCO CASE
description: Attorneys for John N. Mitchell moved yesterday to dismiss an indictment against the former Attorney General on the ground that the prosecution was guilty of persistent and deliberate misconduct.

title: Attack on Central Park Cyclists Spurs Increase in Police Patrols
description: Police and park officials voiced concern yesterday over a series of separate attacks on five bicycle racers in Central Park Sunday and said that police patrols in the park would be increased for the second time in six weeks.

title: BON VIVANT TRYING TO GET SOUP BACK
description: NEWARK, July 9A trial opened here today to determine whether the United States Government has the right to destroy 1.5 million cans of soup and other food products processed by Bon Vivant Soups, Inc., and now held in sealed warehouses throughout the country.

title: French Warning Notice Indicates Big Test Blast
description: PARIS, July 9 (AP) France gave a final warning to aircraft and shipping today to steer clear of her South Pacific nucleartest center and sent warships to force protest vessels from nearby international waters.

title: CANADA PRESSES VIETCONG ON MEN
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 9  Negotiations for the release of two missing Canadian officers continued today after the Vietcong conceded this morning for the first time that they had been holding the men for 12 days in a remote area east of Saigon.

title: Events Today
description: RAY ALEXANDER JAZZ BAND, Boro Hall, Staten Island, 12 Noon.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION OFF 3.7% IN WEEK
description: Steel production for the second half of the year got off to a slow start, according to figures released yesterday by the American Iron and, Steel Institute. Output for the week ended July 7 totaled 2.79 million net tons, or 3.7 per cent lower than the 2,897,000 tons poured in the preceding week. The production index slipped to 114.4 from 118.7 in the week ended June 30.

title: Astros Bow, 21 as Millan's Hit Scores Mays
description: The New York Mets treated 19,099 cheering customers to something out of their dim past last nighta small rally in the ninth inning and another in the 12thas they defeated the Houston Astros, 21, in Shea Stadium.

title: HARRY F. V. EDWARD FORMER STATE AIDE
description: Harry F. V. Edward, who retired in 1968 as supervisor of the professional employment section of the New York State Employment Service, died Sunday on a visit to Augsburg, Germany. He was 75 years old and lived at 2200 Madison Avenue.

title: Cyprus Floats the Pound
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, July 9 (AP)Cyprus announced today the floating of the Cyprus pound. Local banks began selling dollars at 3.0460 to the Cyprus pound and buying them for 3.0490 to the pound, an increase of 0.0890 from Saturday. The previous Central rate of the Cyprus pound was $2.8952 in terms of dollars.

title: ROLE IS CHANGING FOR PEACE CORPS
description: WASHINGTON, July 9Ten months ago the Peace Corps ordered 120 volunteers and their dependents to leave Uganda. A volunteer had been shot to death at an army roadblock and the situation in the country, under the Government of President Idi Amin, was uncertain,

title: McLain Drops in Class
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, July 9 (AP)The Iowa Oaks of the ClassAAA American Association announced today the optioning of the former Cy Young Award winner, Denny McLain, Ito Shreveport of the ClassAA Texas League.

title: First Injury on Dolphins
description: MIAMI, July 9 (AP)Mike Kadish, a defensive tackle, suffered a concussion today during the Miami Dolphins' first contact drill at their Biscayne College training camp,

title: GRADEFIX CHARGE SURPRISES U.C.L.A.
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 9 (AP) Charles Hitch, president of the University of California system, said today allegations that U.C.L.A. athletes got preferential treatment in grading were serious and would be examined closely.

title: Astronauts From Soviet and U.S. Begin A Briefing in Houston for Joint Mission
description: Soviet and American astronauts met in Houston yesterday to begin a threeweek briefing for their joint space mission, scheduled for July, 1975.

title: MR.S REBYL ZAIN
description: CORAL GABLES, Fla., July 9 Mrs. Rebyl Zain, Coral Gables city commissioner, died here today of cancer at the Doctors Hospital. She was 69 years old.

title: DETECTIVES END COURT PETITION
description: A petition by the Detectives Endowment Association demanding that the Police Commissioner be prohibited from transferring detectives to precinct duty was withdrawn in State Supreme Court yesterday after the Police Department had agreed to meet with representatives of the association and discuss the proposed transfers.

title: Mercury Reaches 94 Power Cut
description: New Yorkers perspired through another day of trop ical heat yesterdaythe temperature reached 94 degrees at 2:15 P.M.but they were not alone. A stagnant air mass sat immobile over most of the Eastern Seaboard and stretched as far west as Chicago.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Committee on Colonialism, subcommittee on Indian Ocean territories3 P.M.

title: Dining Out in New Jersey
description: The restaurants reviewed here are rated four stars to none, based on the author's judgment of quality in relation to the price of meals and the quality of comparable establishments. Roughly, one star may he translated as fair, two stars as good, three as excellent and four as superb.

title: Canada Warns That Pipeline in Alaska Would Weaken Chances for 2d Route
description: WASHINGTON, July 9  In a fresh effort to block a transAlaska oil pipeline, the Canadian Government has told Washington that if such a line were built the likelihood of a line ever being laid through Canada's Mackenzie River Valley to the upper Middle Western states would be slim.

title: Southern Utility Agrees to 8% Coupon on an Issue Rated A
description: Interest rates climbed high er yesterday along a broad front as the credit markets continued to reflect a booming economy and its resultant in flation as well as official efforts to put on the brakes.

title: When Does a Lot of jazz Become Just Too Much?
description: In a city the size of New York, can there he too much of anything? As this year's Newport Jazz Festival drew to a close, there was a feeling that it was too much, an expression that is applicable not only as the enthusiastic response of some energetic jazz fans but also as the view of those frustrated festivalgoers who found that two or more concerts that they wanted to attend were all occuring at the same time and as a weary summation of the last 10 days by the festival staff.

title: 5,000 Student Interns Flock to Capital to Learn How the Government Operates
description: WASHINGTON, July 9College students are streaming into this city to learn how the Government works. These summer interns, numbering about 5,000, come from more than 300 schools to spend one week to three months here. Some are paid and some are not for working on Capitol Hill, in the White House and Federal departments or for public interest groups.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Daylight Saving Time

title: U.S. Finds No Wrongdoing by Costantino, but Will Monitor Decisions by Him
description: Justice Department officials said yesterday that they had no evidence of wrongdoing on the part of Federal District Judge Mark A. Costantino that would merit a fullscale investigation, but added that they would be monitoring his conduct and his rulings quite closely in the future.

title: I Do Was Delayed at Circus Wedding
description: HOUSTON, July 9 The world's shortest man came through the receiving line twice, to be kissed by the bride. A champagne fountain tinkled in one corner, and a fourpiece orchestra played in another. And the judge gave a travel talk in the middle of the ceremony.

title: SelfHelp Is the Goal of a SkidRow Project
description: The sign over the entrance at 267 Bowery still reads Sammy's Bowery Follies of the Gay 90's. But instead of a night spot for the tourist trade, the loft building now houses the Bowery Residents' Committee a combination clubroom and rehabilitation center for neighborhood alcoholics, which is run by skidrow inhabitants.

title: Major League Leaders
Equity Financing
description: Directors of the National Detroit Corporation approved yesterday a plan to purchase from time to time up to 400,000 shares of its common stock. The stock of the holding company for the National Bank of Detroit closed at 41, up , on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Big Board Seat Sold
description: The New York Stock Exchange reported yesterday a seat sale for $72,000, unchanged from the previous sale last Friday.

title: Arthur Daley
description: Eddie Mathews has not the foggiest idea of when he first became aware of the existence of Henry Aaron, but Henry was very aware of Eddie right from the start. The start was spring training camp in 1954 at Bradenton, Fla. And that's where they met for the first time. Neither could possibly have imagined then that Mathews would now be managing the Braves and that Aaron would now be charging inexorably toward Babe Ruth's home run record of 714. Back in 1954 Mathews was a powerfully muscled young man of 22 with the ability to hit a baseball vast distances. No one dared dream in those days that any of the Babe's records would ever be threatened. If anyone had been that rase, however, he might have selected Mathews as a qualified challenger. This was the youthful slugger who had slammed 25 homers in his freshman season with the Boston Braves and then tagged 47 as a sophomore with the Milwaukee Braves, thereby celebrating the franchise switch.

title: GRADEFIX CHARGE SURPRISES U.C.L.A.
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 9 (AP) Charles Hitch, president of the University of California system, said today allegations that U.C.L.A. athletes got preferential treatment in grading were serious and would be examined closely.

title: 15 Places for Food Cited as Violators Of City Standards
description: Fifteen food establishments in the city were cited yesterday for violating the Health ?? after their owners had failed to provide valid reasons for not meeting the standards during two inspections.

title: Soviet Woman Foil Victor
description: GOTEBERG, Sweden, July 9 (AP)  Valentina Nikolova of the Soviet Union won the women's individual foil title tonight at the world fencing championships.

title: Jersey Inmates Oppose Fast Parole as Frivolous
description: RAHWAY, N. J., July 9Inmates criticized as frivolous today legislation that would make them eligible for parole within six months and they called instead for an overhaul of parole and rehabilitation programs during an unusual hearing held at the state prison here.

title: New Zealand's Dollar Increased 3% in Value
description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand, July 9 (Reuters)New Zealand revalued her dollar upward by 3 per cent effective today and severed its link with the United States dollar, Fhince Minister Wallace Rowling announced.

title: Television
Dance: From Two Periods
description: Ballet can be many things. It can be a 19thcentury classic such as Giselle, which the American Ballet Theater presented twice Sunday at the State Theater, or it can be an explosive contemporary work such as The Maids, given by the company Saturday night.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: COFFEE, ONE SUGAR For those of you who appreciate the uproarious nuances of cabby squabbles and hockey litigations, head for the New York Coffee and Sugar Exchange, on the second floor of the office building at 79 Pine Street, at Water Street (2698637).

title: Padding Public Payrolls
description: Former New York Deputy Commissioner of Welfare Barry Van Lare, who has just been hired by the State Senate to make fast but thorough studies of state problems, may have no lack of problems and no confusion on where to begin. Burdened state taxpayers can nonetheless be excused for making a suggestion.

title: JUDGE TO REVIEW PLEA OF RADICALS
description: DETROIT, July 9A United States District Court judge ruled today that the Government's categorical denial of burglary, illegal wiretapping or other misconduct while investigating Weathermen radicals, issued two weeks ago, was inadequate.

title: PLUMBERS DATA REPORTEDLY KEPT FROM F.B.I. IN 1972
description: WASHINGTON, July 9for many months, two high Justice Department officials withheld information from Federal Bureau of Investigation agents that would have led the agents much earlier to the White House group set up to scrutinize Government leaks to newsmen; according to sources close to the F.B.I. Watergate investigation.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Now that John Dean, the antiAdministration zealots' most effective tool, has completed his testimony, it is appropriate that a new fresh look be taken into the Watergate affair. While much of the Nixon appointees' action appears indefensible it must be viewed in the light of the vastly more pernicious activities of the radical left as exemplified by their widespread criminal conduct in Chicago during the Democratic convention and later during the Republican rally in Miami.

title: Weekend Boxing
description: By The Associated Press

title: DOLLAR RALLIES ON THE CONTINENT
description: BASEL, Switzerland, July 9  Spurred by reports of imminent central bank intervention, the dollar rallied substantially today, but market specialists said that they still expected the lows set last week to be tested.

title: News Summary and Index
description: After almost two and a half days of detention in Uganda, 112 Peace Corps volunteers were permitted to continue their journey to the neighboring Central African country of Zare. The Uganda President, Maj. Gen. Idi Amin, ordered the volunteers released upon receiving assurances from Zaire that they had indeed been invited there, most of them to teach in secondary schools. [Page 1, Columns 56.]

title: Mentally Ill Mothers Try to Help Themselves and Their Children
description: Their lives have been shot through with nightmares of drug addiction or mental breakdown, or both; with long gray periods of time spent in and out of mental hospitals or of trying to kick the habit; with vast deserts of loneliness, of social and emotional isolation, when even calling a friend was too dangerous because it courted rejection.

title: Tricia Nixon Report Denied
description: WASHINGTON, July 9 (UPI) The White House denied today reports that Mrs. Edward Finch Cox, President Nixon's daughter, was pregnant. A press spokesman told reporters there is no basis for the report in The Washington StarNews about the Nixons' daughter Tricia.

title: Roaring Newport Finish A Fervent Gospel Shout
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., July 9The Newport Jazz Festival finished its 10day run last night with a dib of Latin music, a dab of jazz and a heavy dose of soul.

title: Melbourne Bergerman, 72 Lawyer and ExCIT Officer
description: Melbourne Bergerman, a lawyer who retired in 1962 as vice president and general counsel of the CIT Financial Corporation, died Sunday at his home, 1130 Park Avenue. He was 72 years old.

title: Watergate as Trial by Television
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J.The likelihood is growing that the major participants in both the planning and coverup of the Watergate bugging incident will escape punishment. This development, if it occurs, will not be the result of some sinister Nixonian plot. Rather, it will be the natural outgrowth of continued public testimony before the Ervin committee.

title: Taking Refuge
description: President Nixon has a strong constitutional case in refusing to testify before the Senate Watergate investigation. The committee has indeed been mindful of the separationofpowers doctrine from the start, and has never made any serious move to subpoena the President.

title: And for Israelis, Hope on Negotiations
description: JERUSALEM. July 9Israeli officials feel that the prospects of negotiations between their country and the Arabs, while still remote, have improved as is result of the meeting between President Nixon and the Soviet leader, Leonid I. Brezhnev.

title: Calls to 911 Show That One Man's Vexation Is Another Man's Dire Emergency
description: The calls were pouring in at an unusually high rate at Police Headquarters yesterday about how hot it was, how the water wasn't running, how a big dog was after a cat again and, occasionally, about a shooting or a suicide.

title: Rail Break on L.I.R.R Delays Service to City
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I., July 9Two broken rails on the Long Island Rail Road delayed thousands of New Yorkbound passengers on their way back to the city last night.

title: Sabotage by Segretti Network of Amateurs
description: The smallframed lawyer who arrived in Florida in December of 1971 resembled in style countless other young bachelors on a brief winter's fling.

title: Legal Aid Lawyers Vote to End Strike
description: After spending more than nine hours in furious, intense and often comical debate, striking Legal Aid lawyers voted 2 to 1 last night to return to work today on the basis of an informal contract agreement negotiated Sunday with the Legal Aid Society.

title: Invitation to Trouble
description: The dangers which accompany Administration efforts to boost United States arms sales abroad are nowhere more obvious and grave than in the Middle East, where oilrich states have become a prime target for American military merchants.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey, daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Du Pont Interest in Bank Held Inadequately Divested
description: WASHINGTON, July 9The Federal Reserve Board made a preliminary determination today that the Alfred I. du Pont Trust of Florida had not sufficiently divested itself of a bank holding company, Florida National Banks of Florida, Inc.

title: Hanoi Leaders in Moscow On First Visit Since Truce
description: MOSCOW, July 9 (UPI) Officials of North Vietnam's Communist party and Government leaders arrived today for their first official visit to the Soviet Union since the signing of the Vietnam peace agreement with the United States in January.

title: In Japan, This Coed Is a Goddess
description: TABUSE, JapanTwentytwo years ago, when Kiyokazu Kitamura was an infant, her grandmother used to put her in a vegetable basket on the back of a bicycle and the two of them would travel around the Japanese countryside while her grandmother did her missionary work.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MARBLEHEAD, Mass., July 9 (UPI)Ticonderoga and Yankee Girl, two Class A boats, were reported running far ahead and free today in the 362mile MarbleheadtoHalifax yacht race. The United States Coast Guard cutter Active reported that the main body of the fleet was located about 120 to 150 miles east of Marblehead.

title: The Slippery Politics of Oil
description: POWER PLAY: Oil in the Middle East. By Leonard Mosley. 457 pages. Illustrated. Random House. $10.

title: 6 STOLEN PICASSOS RETRIEVED BY POLICE
description: Six paintings by Picasso, stolen last week from a psychiatrist's East Side townhouse, were recovered by detectives early yesterday.

title: Poverty Order Extended
description: WASHINGTON, July 9 (AP) United States District Court Judge William B. Jones extended today a temporary restraining order preventing unspent antipoverty funds from reverting immediately to the Treasury.

title: Picketer Has 93d Birthday Along With 234th Arrest
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., July 9 (AP)  Robert H. Simpson celebrated his 93d birthday and his 234th arrest yesterday.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: The International Systems and Control Corporation said yesterday that its British process engineering subsidiary, PritchardRhodes, Ltd,, was awarded a contract for about $120million for the design, engineering and supply of two baseload natural gas liqueficaLion facilities in Algeria.

title: THE CADMAN COOP CLEARED OF FRAUD
description: A corporate housing sponsor and the attorney for the sponsor were acquitted of fraud charges in Supreme Court in Brooklyn yesterday in the sale of apartments in the Cadman Towers cooperative in Brooklyn Heights.

title: 112 in Peace Corps Freed By Amin, Flown to Zaire
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, July 9After almost two and a half days of detention in Uganda, 112 American Peace Corps volunteers were permitted today to continue their journey to the neighboring central African country of Zare.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: David Sive, a widely known environmental lawyer, will draw up a new zoning code for Huntington Town based on ecological concepts as well as traditional commercial and residential planning.

title: House Group Investigating Welfare Computer Award
description: Congressional investigators have opened an inquiry into the awarding of a welfarecomputer contract by New York State officials to a concern headed by H. Ross Perot, the millionaire who earlier this year pleaded his case in an interview with Governor Rockefeller.

title: 13 Iraqis Dead in Second Round of Executions for Plot
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq, July 9 Iraq announced today a second round of executions, this one involving 13 persons convicted of an attempt to overthrow the Government. She also announced the life imprisonment of a member of the ruling Revolutionary Command Council.

title: Muskie Aide Enters Race
description: PORTLAND, Me., July 9 (UPI) George J. Mitchell, a longtime advisor to Senator Edmund S. Muskie, announced yesterday that he would seek the Democratic nomination for Governor of Maine. Gov. Kenneth M. Curtis, a Democrat, is forbidden under the State Constitution to seek a third fouryear term.

title: Costa Rican Leader Concedes He Helped Vesco Write Speech
description: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, July 9 (AP)President Jose Figueres acknowledged tonight having written part of a speech Robert L. Vesco, the fugitive American financier, delivered on national television earlier this year.

title: Commodity Traders Mark Time and Study Report
description: The nation's grain, soybean and livestock markets marked time yesterday as traders studed the respected Leslie Crop Report, issued over the weekand, and awaited the Governmeat's figures on farm production, which are due after the close of trading today.

title: Bill Seeks to Enlarge Brigantine Wild Area
description: WASHINGTON, July 9 Senator Clifford P. Case introduced legislation today calling for designating 16,800 acres of the Brigantine National Wildlife Refuge as a wilderness area.

title: Nickel Prices Are Raised
description: The N. C. Trading Company, Inc., a subsidiary of Socit le Nickel, said yesterday that it was raising prices by 6 to 7 cents a pound on ferronickel sold in the United States.

title: Disney Festival Offers Nostalgia for Old and Deja Vu for Young
description: It was a had day yesterday to be dressed up as Br'er Bear in a thick fur costume and to dance in the sun in front of Alice Tully hall, but the occasion called for it, and so it was done with a goodwill that perhaps only an employe of Walt Disney Productions could muster for the stint in 90degree heat.

title: Who Duzzit, 12, Scores By a Neck in Juvenile
description: Only four horses competed in the $26,975 Juvenile at Aqueduct yesterday. Who Duzzit of the Calumet Farm was the winner, finishing ahead of Totheend, Sensatoll and Plug Alone, in that order.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: The common American eel, which is spawned in the Sargasso Sea, has been a favored bait for striped bass for many years, although its use has always been limited by its availability.

title: Wood Gets 16th White Sox as Rally Off Ace
description: CHICAGO, July 9The Yankees pushed Wilbur Wood to the precipice tonight, but couldn't produce the final nudge to shove him off.

title: Du Pont to Add to Capacity For Making Polyester Yarn
description: E. 1. du Pont de Nemours & Co., Inc., which now has a worldwide capacity for producing 1 billion pounds of polyester yarn and fiber, announced yesterday that it would increase its capacity by a substantial amount over the next few years.

title: Notes on People
description: Plunging into the subject under discussion, Senator Edward M. Kennedy of Massachusetts went bobbing down the turbulent Colorado River. With him on the outing were his 11yearold son, Teddy, and three fellow Democratic CongressmenSenator John V. Tunney of California and Representatives Wayne Owens of Utah and William J. Green of Pennsylvania and their sons.

title: Major League Leaders
Strike in Puerto Rico Reduces Electricity and Water Service
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., July 9 Much of Puerto Rico was without electricity and running water today as the effects of a violent strike by employes of the Governmentowned power company continued to escalate.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Congressional investigators have opened an inquiry into the awarding of a welfarecomputer contract by New York State officials to a concern headed by H. Ross Perot, the millionaire who earlier this year pleaded his case in an interview with Governor Rockefeller.

title: DISMISSAL SOUGHT BY 3 IN VESCO CASE
description: Attorneys for John N. Mitchell moved yesterday to dismiss an indictment against the former Attorney General on the ground that the prosecution was guilty of persistent and deliberate misconduct.

title: Alexander Is Rotated Off Prison Board of Trustees
description: NEWARK, July 9LArchibald S. Alexander Jr., newly elected chairman of the State Board of Prison Trustees, said today that he had been summarily removed from his post as of June 30 without reason and that his departure had been involuntary.

title: People and Business
description: The farmers of today have had to learn to live with a new realitythe philosophy of permanent debt, J. Phil Campbell Jr. Under Secretary of Agriculture, said yesterday.

title: Businessmen Flocking In To Study South Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 9The American troops have gone, and now the businessmen are coming.

title: MITCHELL MEETS WITH PANEL STAFF
description: WASHINGTON, July 9John N. Mitchell, the former Attorney General and onetime confidant of President Nixon, met with Senate investigators for four hours today to outline the testimony he will give tomorrow when the Senate Watergate hearings resume.

title: Policeman Wounded As He Tries to Stop Burglary Next Door
description: VOORHEES TOWNSHIP, July 9 (AP)An offduty patrolman was shot and wounded late last night after he interrupted a burglary in the home of a neighbor, a police sergeant who was away on vacation.

title: 2 U.S. DOCTORS use JAPANESE SURGERY
description: WASHINGTON, July 9 (AP)Two physicians reported encouraging results today from the first known American use of a technique developed in Japan to correct a congenital liver defect in babies.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: A while ago, a reader complained that a famous and expensive restaurant here would honor only one brand of credit card  not, presumably, one of those he was carrying. An inquiry reveals that the restaurant had its reasons.

title: Watergate Witness for Today
description: WASHINGTON, July 9For, two months now, since his indictment in the Vesco case in New York and awaiting more bad news from the Watergate grand jury here, John N. Mitchell has lived and felt like a prisoner. His lawyer described him as shaken. A friend calls him betrayed. Another visitor says that shrunken may be too strong a word for the former AttorneyThe Keenest Hurts

title: Jipcho Wins 3,000 Meters At Meet in Copenhagen
description: COPENHAGEN, July 9 (AP)  Ben Jipcho, Kenya's long distance running star, overcame a bad cold today to win the 3,000meter run in an international track meet.

title: UNITED AIRCRAFT PLANNING MERGER
description: An agreement in principle for the merger of the Signal Companies into the United Aircraft Corporation was approved yesterday by directors in an exchange of stock. The transaction of the huge industrial producers involves $750million, according to a spokesman for United Aircraft. This is based on the stock that Signal shareholders will receive in terms of liquidating value. Under terms of the agreement, three shares of the Signal Companies' common stock would be exchanged taxfree for one share of new convertible preferred stock of United Aircraft bearing an annual dividend of $5.50 and a liquidating value of $100 a share. Each of the new preferred shares would be conlvertible into shares of United Aircraft at $45 share.

title: GrassRoots Tennis Program For City Youngsters Thriving
description: On a patch of green surrounded by towering apartment houses in Harlem the National Junior Tennis League yesterday started its fifth season.

title: Soviet Scholar and Family Reach Israel as Immigrants
description: TEL AVIV, July 9 (Reuters)  A noted Soviet Jewish scholar, Dmitri M. Segal, 36 years old, and Ns wife, Yelena, a granddaughter of the Soviet novelist Aleksei N. Tolstoi, arrived here today as new immigrants.

title: DENT SAYS GOAL IS TO EASE CURBS
description: Secretary of Commerce Frederick B. Dent reiterated yesterday the Nixon Administration's determination for an early return to a noncontrolled economy.

title: Myths of Fron tier Summarized in Art
description: The Whitney Museum's new summer exhibition which runs until Sept. 16, is sort of daring in its way. Called The American Frontier  Images and Myths, it accepts the 19thcentury notion that a painting is a picture of something and that what it is a picture of is the most important thing about it. You couldn't get much further away from the current art gabble, the current realistic revival notwithstanding. Almost every picture tells story, and threequarters of them would have been sniffed at as calendar art 15 years ago.

title: Homosexuality Ruled No Basis for Bar Rejection
description: A homosexual lawyer cannot be denied admission to the New York State Bar solely on the grounds of his homosexuality, the State Court of Appeals has ruled.

title: Troops in Montevideo Crush a Protest
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 9  The militarybacked Government of President Juan M. Bordaberry vigorously crushed a demonstration today called to protest the abolishment of democratic institutions. Some casualties were reported.

title: Tanker Set Ablaze in Mekong Ambush Others Get Through
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, July 9 (UPI)Guerrillas armed with rifles, machine guns and rockets today ambushed a Mekong River supply convoy, setting an oil tanker ablaze. But the rest of the convoy managed to get to Phnom Penh with supplies from South Vietnam.

title: Watergate Witness for Today
description: WASHINGTON, July 9For two months now, since his indictment in the Vesco case in New York and awaiting more bad news from the Watergate grand jury here, John N. Mitchell has lived and felt like a prisoner. His lawyer described him as shaken. A friend calls him betrayed. Another visitor says that shrunken may be too strong a word for the former Attorney General, but that Mr. Mitchell has lost weight and the old inner confidence is not what it used to be.

title: Communists Make Gains in Tokyo Municipal Election, but Left Coalition Falls Short of Majority
description: TOKYO, July 9The Japan Communist party registered strong gains in Tokyo's municipal election yesterday but, with their leftist allies, failed to gain a joint majority in the Metropolitan Assembly.

title: Smoker Rule on Planes in Effect Today
description: WASHINGTON, July 9 Airlines that fail to segregate smokers and nonsmokers will be subject to fines by tile Civil Aeronautics Board under a regulation that goes into effect tomorrow.

title: CHANGE ASKED IN BILL ON CAMPAIGN DONORS
description: WASHINGTON, July 9Senator Walter F. Mondale, Democrat of Minnesota, said today that he would seek to restore a requirement that candidates disclose the occupation and place of business of contributors when campaign reform legislation reaches the Senate floor later this month.

title: Second $500,000 Gold Theft Discovered
description: A $500,000 gold theft, similar to one that took place Saturday in Queens, was reported yesterday at a Manhattan jewelrycasting company.

title: Israeli Antiguerrilla Chief
description: JERUSALEM, July 9 (AP)Brig. Gen. Israel Lior, 52 years old, today took charge of Israel's antiguerrilla activities, succeeding Maj. Gen. Aharon Yariv, who has resigned to enter politics. General Lior has been a military aide for Premier GoIda Meir and her predecessor, the late Levi Eshkol.

title: Southeast Connecticut In Special Vote Today
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., July 9Because of the heat and the vacation season, a light turnout is expected tomorrow for the election in a shore district in southeastern Connecticut to fill the seat in the State Senate made vacant this month by the elevation of Peter L. Cashman to Lieutenant Governor.

title: Cambodian Premier Says U. S. Isn't Consulting Him
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, July 9  Cambodia's Premier, In Tam, has declared that the Phnom Penh Government is not involved in negotiations with anyone to end the threeyearold war in this country.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Houston Astros, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 8:05 P.M.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
CARDINAL ASSAILS SWISS THEOLOGIAN
description: STUTTGART, West Germany, July 9  The chairman of the Roman Catholic Bishops Conference of West Germany, Julius Cardinal Dpfner, today deplored criticism of Vatican Kng, the controversial Swiss theologian, and appealed to him for serene collaboration.

description: By The Associated Press

description: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX

title: Erratic Autocrat
description: The 112 Peace Corps men and women who were freed yesterday after two days of anxious detention in Uganda are among the luckier targets of President Idi Amin's erratic xenophobia.

title: Dow Average Climbs 7.15 As the Dollar Rises Abroad
description: Speculation that the United States would move to shore up the sagging dollar in foreign currency dealings helped the stock market score a moderate gain yesterday in light trading.

title: Death of the Iron Man
description: We had sat up all night with the dollar, and made the children do the same although they did not like the idea very much. They did not have the feeling about the dollar which we had.

Watergate investigation.

title: Business Briefs
description: The person who sits on the board of directors of a company other than his own gets more than pocket money these dayssomething like $9,000 a year.

title: PIRATES ACQUIRE MAIVILL OF A'S
description: PITTSBURGH, July 9 (AP)The Pittsburgh Pirates, seeking to mend their tattered defense, today acquired 34yearold Dal Maxvill from the Oakland Atliletics. He is expected to become the starting shortstop.

title: Chess: For Fast, Fast, FAST Play Try a Swiss System Today
description: In the Swisssystem tournaments popular throughout the United States, the highest quality of play cannot be expected. Instead of the standard international time limit of 40 moves in two and a half hours, these Swisses are conducted at a faster rate, often 40 moves in two hours or 50 moves in two and a half hours.

title: SITIN AT P.S. 208 CURTAILS CLASSES
description: East Flatbush parents occupying Public School 208 on an issue of local control prevented the start of summerschool classes in the Brooklyn school yesterday.

title: Canada Widening Controls On Export Commodities
description: OTTAWA, July 9, (Reuters)  The Canadian Government announced tonight it is widening the export controls on commodities it imposed June 29 in response to control measures taken in the United States.

title: Prisoners in Jersey Oppose Fast Parole
description: RAHWAY, N. J., July 9Inmates criticized as frivolous today legislation that would make them eligible for parole within six months and they called instead for an overhaul of parole and rehabilitation programs during an unusual hearing held at the state prison here.

description: BOSTON, July 9 (AP)Research to Prevent Blindness, Inc., has awarded $5,000 in funds to Harvard University for studies of blinding diseases at the Howe Laboratory of Ophthalmology at the Massaehu; setts Eye and Ear Infirmary.

title: Filion Is Not Surprised At Otaro Hanover's Pace
description: YONKERS, July 9Herve Filion's decision to hit the Grand Circuit in earnest this year is paying off, and one of the reasons is Otaro Hanover, his rap idly blossoming 3yearold and the likely favorite for Satur day night's $100,000 Cane Pace at Yonkers Raceway.

title: Abernathy Resigns Post, Scoring Affluent Blacks
description: ATLANTA, July 9The Ralph David Abernathy resigned today as president of the Southern Christian Leadership Conference, accusing affluent blacks of not giving financial support to the organization.

title: Alaskans Watching Hickel For Clues to 1974 Races
description: ANCHORAGE, July 9With the Democraticheld Governorship and a Senate seat to be filled next year, Republican politicians across Alaska are waiting to see what former Gov. Walter J. Hickel will do. Among other things, he seems to have at least a corner of his mind on the Presidency and VicePresidency.

description: The Baltimore Orioles, in a battle with the Yankees and Boston for top honors in the American League's Eastern Division, have had their troubles this season.

description: BOSTON, July 9 (AP)Research to Prevent Blindness, Inc., has awarded $5,000 in Funds to Harvard University for studies of blinding diseases at the Howe Laboratory of Ophthalmology at the Massachur setts Eye and Ear Infirmary.

title: Kelley, With Nixon at Side,Pledges Integrity of F. B. I.
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., July 9With President Nixon at his side, Clarence M. Kelley took office today as director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation and promised to shield the agency from improper outside influences.

title: DOLLAR RALLIES ON THE CONTINENT
description: BASEL, Switzerland, July 9  Spurred by reports of imminent central bank intervention, the dollar rallied substantially today, but market specialists said that they still expected the lows set last week to be tested.

title: Heath on Birthday Tackles Prices Crisis and Hopes for Happy Vote Returns
description: LONDON, July 9The weather has been unusually warm here in recent days and Prime Minister Heath has been inspired to take off his tie and sit down in the garden at 10 Downing Street to greet visitors and read documents under lowhanging branches that have shaded his predecessors.

title: Chain's Sales Up by 11%
description: Safeway Stores, Inc., the nation's second largest supermarket chain and the industry leader in maintaining profitable operations, reported yesterday increases of 5.3 per cent in secondquarter earnings and about 3 per cent for the half year ended June 16.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Houston Astros, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 8:05 P.M.

title: Senate Votes to Establish An institute on Aging
description: WASHINGTON, July 9 (AP) The Senate voted today to establish a special governmental agency to deal with the problems of growing old.

title: FLORIDA CHARGES GAS CONSPIRACY
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., July 9 (UPI)Florida's Attorney General, Robert Shevin, filed a Federal antitrust suit today alleging that 15 major oil companies had conspired to create a gasoline shortage to drive competitors out of business and force up prices. The suit was filed in United States District Court in Tallahassee.

title: Cleveland Bank Asked to Back Down From 8 to The 8% Level
description: The Nixon Administration, which has been standing on the sidelines for the past two and onehalf months or so as the prime lending rate of the nation's banks has rushed upward, intervened yesterday to ask the banks to slow things down just a bit.

title: Second $500,000 Gold Theft Discovered
description: A $500,000 gold theft, similar, to one that took place Saturday in Queens, was reported yesterday at a Manhattan jewelrycasting company.

title: 1970 Spy Plan Reportedly Ended Without an Edict
description: WASHINGTON, July 9  A White House aide who helped draft a master plan in 1970 for expanded domestic intelligence gathering indicated today that President Nixon never formally rescinded approval of the operation.

title: Soviet Woman Foil Victor
description: GOTEBERG, Sweden, July 9 (AP)  Valentina Nikolova of the Soviet Union won the women's individual foil title tonight at the world fencing championships.

title: Disney Festival Offers Nostalgia for Old and Deja Vu for Young
description: It was a had day yesterday to be dressed up as Br'er Bear in a thick fur costume and to dance in the sun in front of Alice Tully hall, but the occasion called for it, and so it was done with a goodwill that perhaps only an employe of Walt Disney Productions could muster for the stint in 90degree heat.

title: People in Sports: GolferAt Odds With 661 Odds
description: Who do they think I am, Jos Feliciano? said the golfer, Chi Chi Rodriguez, when told thatt bookmakers were listing odds of 661 against him winning the British Open. Rodriguez's referral was to the blind, singerguitarist, who also is Puerto Rican.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The former head of the night security force in the Newark school system has pleaded guilty to charges conspiracy and extortion.

title: AllStar Voting
description: FIRST BASEDick Alien, Chicago, 735,021; John Mayberry, Kansas City, 438,837; Carl Yastrzemski, Boston, 189,205; Norm Cash, Detroit, 166,944; Harmon Killebrew, Minnesota, 118,268; Georse Scott, Milwaukee, 100,835.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: FLANDERS, July 9Golfers from varied walks of life, who play exclusively on public courses will be in action here Wednesday in the national amateur public links championship.

title: 2 Armed Boys Break In And Free Girl in Center
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., July 10 Two armed and masked boys burst into a detention center here today, fired one shot into a wall and escaped with a 14yearold said to he a girlfriend of one of them. She was being held there as a runaway.

title: DEAN BROWN DEAD; PHOTOGRAPHER, 36
description: Dean Brown, a freelance photographer noted for graphic interpretations of nature and for portraitures, died Sunday at the Maine Medical Center in Portland of injuries received in a fall last Thursday near North Conway, N.H. He was 36 years old and lived at 37 Walker Street.

title: 2 Crash Victims Identified
description: NORFOLK, Va., July 10 (AP) The Navy has identified two men who died in a multivehicle wreck on the Chesapeake Bay BridgeTunnel yesterday as Chief Storekeeper Wayne Newie Ferris and Machinist Mate First Class David Phillip Hatfield of the submarine Skate. The automobile in which the two sailors were riding was struck from the rear by a tractortrailer and burst into flames, the police said.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: For the last twenty years I have lived in New York Times country (specific locales being too varied to list) but I am a product of Senator Sam Ervin's North Carolina. And while, given that opportunity, I would certainly vote contrarily to most votes cast by that singular gentleman, I take enormous pride these days in sharing a state with him.

title: 4 SLAIN IN FAMILY BURIED IN NEWARK
description: NEWARK, July 10 (AP)The four slain members of the Faulk family were buried here today.

title: Top Nixon Economists Say job Bias Reduces Women's Wages by 10 to 20%
description: WASHINGTON, July 10The Nixon Administration's top economists said today that what appeared to be pure discrimination reduces the average earnings of women to 80 or 90 per cent of what men make for the same work.

title: Report Says Police At Louisiana School Were Overarmed
description: BATON ROUGE, July 10 (AP) A report on the shooting deaths of two Southern University students last November says the entire confrontation between law enforcement officers and students was unjustified.

title: Thieu Reorganizes Civil Service Setup To Build Efficiency
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 10 (Reuters)President Nguyen Van Thieu today announced sweeping changes in the organization of South Vietnam's civil service aimed at increasing its efficiency and stamping out corruption.

title: People and Business
description: Leif H. Olsen, senior vice president and economist of the First National City Bank, drawing a bead on the current price freeze in the bank's July economic letter, declares it has succeeded only in increasing uncertainties and creating shortages and adds that it should be ended now. Citibank's letter concedes that prices will rise somewhat further if all controls are ended but continues:

title: Rosenbaum Says Crangle Sought 50 of New Judges
description: The state Republican chairman, Richard M. Rosenbaum, ?? yesterday that the Democratic state chairman, Joseph F. Crangle, had demanded that half of the 100 new narcotic judgeships go to Democrats in return for his party's support when the bill was before the Assembly last May.

title: Ehrlichman Account Links Election Aides to BreakIn
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 John D. Ehrlichman, once one of President Nixon's closest advisers, has told Senate investigators that he believed shortly after the Watergate burglary that high officials of the President's reelection campaign had been involved in the operation.

title: HENRY G. GREENFELD
description: Henry G. Greenfield, a certified public accountant, was drowned on Sunday in Bermuda, where he had been vacationing. He was 80 years old and lived at 80 Central Park West.

title: BELFAST ARSONISTS BURN MORE VEHICLES
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, July 10Buses, trucks and automobiles were burned in Belfast last night in a new wave of terrorist violence.

title: Business Briefs
description: MOSCOW, July 10The Soviet Union and France today adopted a 10year program of cooperation in industry, providing for the construction of industrial complexes in the two countries.

title: Market Climbs Broadly Reflecting Dollar's Rise
description: The stock market posted its broadest advance in six weeks yesterday in response to renewed strength in the dollar overseas and to indications here that the Nixon Administration was rapidly moving toward Phase 4 of its economic program.

title: Business Records
COUNCIL NAMES 9 TO ELECTION BOARD
description: The City Council approved nine new members for an expanded Board of Elections yesterday, but deferred approval of the 10th candidate, Vincent J. Velella, amid controversy over allegations that he is connected to the underworld.

title: Bridge: Even Opening NoTrump Bid Can't Prevent Overoptimism
description: One of the advantages of a notrump opening bid is that it tends to produce shorter auctions. As the declaring side starts with a limited bid, less information is exchanged and the defenders have fewer clues, particularly in choosing the opening lead.

title: SANDY HOOK BEACH CLOSED BY RED TIDE
description: TRENTON, July 10 (AP)The beach at Sandy Hook State Park was closed today until further notice because of the presence of the red tide, millions of small marine microrganisms that irritate the eyes and noses of bathers.

title: Midlantic Banks Planning Common Name for Units
description: Midlantic Banks, Inc., one of New Jersey's largest bank holding companies, announced yesterday that in the fall it would adopt a common name for all of its banking subsidiaries including its lead bank, National Newark and Essex.

title: New Chief Intent on Bolstering ArmsControl Agency
description: WASHINGTON, July 10Fred C. Ikl took over as head of the Arms Control and Disarmament Agency today, determined to rebuild confidence in the organizationbadly demoralized by one of the Nixon Administration's most severe personnet shakeups.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The National Academy of Record Arts and Sciences has announced the establishment of a Hall of Fame to honor recordings of lasting, qualitative or historical significance.

title: Top Merrill Executives Pay Cut
description: Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., the world's biggest broker and underwriter, confirmed yesterday that it was cutting the base salaries of some 140 top executives in an effort to reduce costs.

title: Philadelphia Man Named To the Prosecutor's Staff
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 (AP)  Assistant District Attorney Carl B. Feldbaum of Philadelphia was named today to the staff of Archibald Cox, the special prosecutor in the Watergate case.

title: Freed Peace Corps Group Off for Training Camp
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, July 10 (AP)About 50 American Peace Corps volunteers flew to their training camp in eastern Zaire today on the final stretch of a journey interrupted by a twoday detention in Uganda.

title: Books of The Times
description: FOREIGN DEVILS. By Irvin Faust. 295 pages. Arbor House. $7.95.

title: House Votes to Limit Farms to $20,000 in Subsidies
description: WASHINGTON, July 10The House, in a surprising setback to large farm interests, voted today to impose a $20,000 ceiling on subsidy payments to any one farm.

title: Ann Klein, Working for Byrne, Won't Seek Return to Assembly
description: MORRISTOWN, July 10 (UPI) Ann Klein, unsuccessful candidate in the Democratic gubernatorial primary says she will not run to retain her Assembly seat.

title: JOHN W. G. POWELL 75, INVESTMENT ADVISER
description: WASHINGTON, July 10John W. G. Powell, a retired investment counselor and the husband of Dr. Janet Travell, who was White House physician to Presidents Kennedy and Johnson, died Monday of cancer in George Washington University Hospital. He was 75 years old.

title: Yonkers Harness Entries
New Jersey Sports
description: COLTS NECK, July 10Everything is looking upand downfor the Thurston family.

title: State U. Allots $100,000 To Foil Campus Thefts
description: ALBANY, July 10 (AP)In an effort to stymie wouldbe burglars, the State University at Albany is preparing for a widespread change in locks that will cost $100,000, a university spokesman said.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Police Start a Dialogue on TV To Reach Community Residents
description: Clustered in front of two television monitors in a long narrow storefront on the Lower East Side yesterday, city police officials, members of the Ninth Precinct and local residents watched an hourlong production called No More Words.

title: SENATE UNIT CUTS TRIDENT PROGRAM
description: WASHINGTON, July 10A Senate Armed Services subcommittee challenged today a major new strategic program of the Administration by voting against accelerated development of the Trident missilelaunching submarine.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Houston Astros, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 2 P.M.

title: News Summary and Index
description: John N. Mitchell swore to the Senate Watergate committee that he had deliberately withheld information from President Nixon about the 1972 campaign conspiracy and White House horror stories to prevent damage to the President's bid for reelection. He persistently denied that he had authorized the political intelligence gathering scheme that led to the Watergate breakin. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Half the Detectives To Co to Precincts Under Cawley Plan
description: Police Commissioner Donald F. Cawley said yesterday that he was planning a major reorganization of the detective force that would put about half of the detectives back in the precincts and make detectives responsible for the first time to uniformed precinct commanders.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Radio
Lindsay and Beame Clash Over Madison Ave. Mall
description: Mayor Lindsay and the man most likely to succeed him, Controller Abraham D. Beame, clashed head on yesterday in a confrontation that jeopardized a pet Lindsay project, the Madison Avenue Mall.

title: U.S. to Admit North Korean
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., July 10  Secretary General Waldheim today reported that the United States had informed him that it was prepared to grant a visa to a representative of the North Korean Government. North Korea recently was granted observer status by the United Nations, but Mr. Waldheim said that so far no one had been designated to the post.

title: Rites for Miss Lake Today
description: A memorial service will be held at the Universal Funeral. Chapel, Lexington Avenue at 52d Street, at 5 o'clock today for Veronica Lake, the film star of the nineteenforties, who died in Burlington, Vt., Saturday. The ashes of Miss Lake, who succumbed to acute hepatitis at 53, will he flown to the Virgin Islands and scattered at sea.

title: 2 Armed Boys Break In And Free Girl in Center
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., July 10 Two armed and masked boys burst into a detention center here today, fired one shot into a wall and escaped with a 14yearold said to be a girlfriend of one of them. She was being held there as a runaway.

title: W.C.T.U. Adds Targets As 100th Birthday Nears
description: OCEAN GROVE, N. J., July 10 With undiminished fervor, the 99yearold Women's Christian Temperance Union is girding itself for a second 100 years of war against alcohol.

title: JOHN S. AMES JR.
description: CAMDEN, Me., July 10 John S. Ames Jr., a special assistant to Winthrop Aldrich when he was Ambassador to the Court of St. James, and a former member of the Massachusetts Governor's Council, died in a hospital here yesterday. He was 63 years old and lived in North Easton, Mass.

title: U.S. Predicts More Crops; Warns of Food Price Rises
description: WASHINGTON, July 10The Agriculture Department reported today prospects for strong increases in soybean, corn, wheat and feedgrain crops this year. Nevertheless, various Government officials warned consumers that food prices would climb still higher before 1973 is over.

title: Bill to Ban Forced Busing Barred in Massachusetts
description: BOSTON, July 10 (UPI)Gov. Francis W. Sargent vetoed today a bill to prohibit the busing of children without parental consent to achieve racial balance in public schools.

title: MORE COLD SPRAYS ORDERED RECALLED
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 (UPI) The Government has ordered a recall of five more brands of aerosol cough and cold sprays that it said contained the same ingredient that forced it to act against Pertussin spray last week.

title: Dollar on Rubbery Legs
description: The dollar got off the floor this week, but on legs that remain rubbery. After the pounding the currency had taken during the preceding two weeks, however, the news of the dollar's ability to rise at all was enough to spark a rally in Wall Street.

title: Wright, on 74 for 215, Wins Long Island P.G.A. by Shot
description: FORT SALONGA, L.I., July, 10Jimmy Wright of Inwood won the annual 54hole Long Island Professional Golfers Association championship today over the 6,850yard Indian Hillscourse with a 74 for 215. Rex Baxter of Glen Oaks, the runnerup, trailed by a stroke.

title: An Orchestra Tries SelfGovernment
description: The players of the American Symphony Orchestra will have to be careful from now on when they complain about the management. They are it.

title: 9 of 12 Escaped Tigers In Canada Are Captured
description: HEMMINGFORD, Quebec, July 10 (Reuters)  Twelve young tigers escaped last night from a wildlife reserve near this community, 35 miles south of Montreal, and nine were recaptured today near the reserve's grounds.

title: Ehrlichman Account Links Election Aides to BreakIn
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 John D. Ehrlichman, once one of President Nixon's closest advisers, has told Senate investigators that he believed shortly after the Watergate burglary that high officials of the President's reelection campaign had been involved in the operation.

title: U. S. Predicts More Crops; Warns of Food Price Rises
description: WASHINGTON, July 10The Agriculture Department reported today prospects for strong increases in soybean, corn, wheat and feedgrain crops this year. Nevertheless, various Government officials warned consumers that food prices would climb still higher before 1973 is over.

title: Chile and Creditor Nations To Meet in Paris on Debts
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 Chile and her creditor nations will meet in Paris starting on Thursday to discuss the rescheduling of Chile's multimilliondollar debts for this year.

title: State Prison Panel Asked Not to Dismiss Alexander
description: TRENTON, July 10  Senafor James H. Wallwork, Republican of Essex County, asked the State Board of Institutional Trustees today to reconsider its illtimed and illadvised dismissal of Archibald L. Alexander Jr. as chairman of the State Board of Prison Trustees.

title: SENATE UNIT CUTS TRIDENT PROGRAM
description: WASHINGTON, July 10A Senate Armed Services subcommittee challenged today a major new strategic program of the Administration by voting against accelerated development of the Trident missilelaunching submarine.

title: Nixon's Daughter Talks To British TV Viewers
description: LONDON, July 10  Mrs. David Eisenhower, accompanied by her husband, carried her role as her family's main public spokesman to England tonight.

title: END OF CONTROLS SOUGHT THIS YEAR
description: WASHINGTON, July 10The Nixon Administration's labormanagement advisory committee declared today with a single vote that all wage and price controls should be eliminated as soon as possible this year.

title: W.C.T.U. Adds Targets As 100th Birthday Nears
description: OCEAN GROVE, N. J., July 10 With undiminished fervor, the 99yearold Women's Christian Temperance Union is girding itself for a second 100 years of war against alcohol.

title: 4 Die in Crash Near Leipzig
description: BERLIN. July 10 (AP)An express train jumped the tracks at a suburban station, near Leipzig today, killing four persons and injuring 29, the official East German press agency A.D.N. reported.

title: Only Safety Off Met Is Helms's Double in 6th
description: Jon Matlack threw a curveball down and in to Tommy Helms leading off the sixth inning last night and the Houston Astros second baseman lined the ball six inches inside third base for a double and the only hit off the Mets southpaw.

title: Artist Studios Set at Midtown Hotel
description: A large realestate concern with extensive holdings in Times Square said yesterday that it would convert the Aristo Hotel, formerly a prostitute's hangout, into housing for artists as part of a new effort to upgrade the tawdry area.

title: 10 Racing Leaders Urge Delafield for State Post
description: Charles B. Delafield for chairman of the new state racing board.

title: Leak of Radioactive Waste
description: RICHLAND, Wash., July 10 (UPI)A second leakage of highlevel radioactive waste from a storage tank at the Hanford Atomic Energy Commission facility was reported today by the A.E.C. The agency said that about 1,500 gallons of radioactive waste was found missing from a tank. This is in addition to the 115,000 gallons reported to have been lost from the tanks last month.

title: Newsman Privilege Backed
description: DOVER, Del., July 10 (Al)Gov. Sherman W. Tribbitt has signed a bill giving newsmen absolute privilege to refuse to name their sources in any judicial or investigative proceedings, an administration spokesman said today.

title: 34% of Women in West Side Poll Victims of Robbery in Last Year
description: Have you been a victim of a robbery in the past year? residents of the West Side were asked.

title: Sanitationman, Chiding Boys at Hydrant, Shot
description: A sanitation worker was shot on a South Bronx street yesterday when he stopped his truck to chastise a group of youths who sprayed the windshield with water from an open fire hydrant, the police reported.

title: TRW Profit Up 32% in Quarter on 28% Sales Rise
description: TRW, Inc., a diversified industrial producer, had a 32 per cent rise in secondquarter earnings on a sales gain of 28 per cent, bringing the halfyear increases to 34 per cent for both sales and earnings, the Clevelandbased concern reported yesterday.

title: Cash Prices
Record Penalty Imposed On Laker Airways Ltd.
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 (UPI)The Civil Aeronautics Board announced today the imposition of a record penalty of $101,000 against a British charter company, Laker Airways Ltd.

title: WNET AND N.Y.U. LAW TO ASSIST CONSUMER
description: Starting today and continuing for a month, public television station WNET/13 and the New York Unversity School of Law will jointly operate a Consumer Help Center at the station. The resultant findings will be used in a weekly affairs program. Consumer Help, that Channel 13 plans to air beginning in midSeptember.

title: Nixon Cruises on Potomac
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 (UPI) President Nixon took a twohour cruise on the Potomac River aboard the Presidential, yacht Sequoia tonight. The White House said Mr. Nixon was accompanied by only Ronald L. Ziegler, the President's press secretary and assistant.

title: Pragmatic Bahamian Leader
description: NASSAU, the Bahamas, July 10  Our Government has no intention of killing the goose that lays the golden egg.

title: Atlanta N. A. A.C.P. Defies National Office and Refuses to Drop Approval of School Plan
description: ATLANTA, July 10  Thelocal branch of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People last night defied instructions from the N.A.A.C.P. headquarters in New York and refused to back away from its endorsement of a plan that leaves a solid majority of Atlanta students in allblack schools.

title: MIGRANT UNIT AIDE SCORES DISMISSAL
description: Marco A. Rigau Jr. said yesterday that he had been fired as national director of the Puerto Rican Migration Division for his efforts to enforce wage and working conditions for the 15,000 farm migrant workers employed on the mainland through Puerto Rican government contracts.

title: BROKER INDICTED ON FRAUD CHARGE
description: United States Attorney Paul J. Curran disclosed here yesterday that a Federal grand jury had returned an indictment against a New York stockbroker and four others on charges of bribery and stock fraud.

title: Final Tally on Mexican Vote
description: MEXICO CITY, July 10 (AP) The final count of the July 1 elections gave the ruling Institutional Revolutionary party 189 of the 194 direct election seats in the Chamber of Deputies, the federal electoral commission announced today. Candidates of the major opposition party, the National Action party, won four seats and the Authentic party of the Mexican Revolution took one.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: CHICAGO, July 10 (UPI)Plans for constructing a $20million O'Hare Sports Arena northwest of Chicago to house the Chicago Cougars of the World Hockey Association were announced today by Donald E. Stephens, Mayor of suburban Rosemont. He said groundbreaking for the Chicago area's first new major sports facility since 1934 was expected within 90 days. It is hoped, he said, the arena will be ready for the Cougars 197475 season.

title: Six Westhampton Jetties Voted, But Klein Vows to Veto Measure
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., July 10The Suffolk County Legislature today passed a controversial resolution authorizing construction of six jetties to prevent further erosion at Westhampton Beach, but County Executive John V. N. Klein immediately vowed to veto the legislation.

title: Television
PRESSURE EASES ON MONEY RATES
description: A rally by the dollar in overseas currency markets relieved some of the upward pressure yesterday 9n shortterm interest rates, or money rates, and generated demand for securities of the United States Treasury.

title: MARCHI IN ISRAEL ON POLITICAL TOUR
description: JERUSALEM, July 10State Senator John J. Marchi of New York, the Republican candidate for Mayor, toured northern Israel today as part of an unabashedly political pilgrimage.

title: One of Two Major Strikes Is Ended in Puerto Rico
description: SAN JUAN, P. R. July 10 (UPI)  One of two major strikes that crippled Puerto Rico's basic services, causing the Governor to mobilize the National Guard, was settled today when the island's largest electric workers union agreed to return to work immediately.

title: Director of Finance Resigns in Newark To Get School Post
description: NEWARK, July 10 (AP) Anton Jungherr, Newark's director of Finance, resigned today.

title: FRENCH HOSPITAL DELAYS ON DEBTS
description: The French and Polyclinic Medical School and Health Center filed a petition under the Federal Bankruptcy Act yesterday to postpone repayment of nearly $6million owed to creditors.

title: Illegal Buying of 3 Rifles Draws 5Month Sentence
description: Stuart Cohen, a 20yearold member of the Jewish Defense League, was sentenced in Federal Court here yesterday to five months in prison for the illegal purchase of three rifles.

title: 2 Named to Medical Library
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 (AP) President Nixon announced today his nominees to fill two vacancies on the 10member board of regents of the National Library of Medicine. Nominated for terms expiring Aug. 3, 1976, are Dr. Ethel Weinberg, associate dean of the Medical College of Pennsylvania in Philadelphia, and Dr. Eddie Smith Jr. of Washington, president of the National Dental Association.

title: MEETING OF INDIA AND PAKISTAN SET
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, July 9Pakistan and India, deadlocked for two months, are set to begin a crucial effort to resolve the tangled issues dividing the subcontinent.

title: The Bahamas, Amid Pomp and Calypso, Becomes Independeig
description: NASSAU, the Bahamas, July 10As a new flag of black, aquamarine and gold was raised here today, the Bahamas became an independent nation, emerging from three centuries of British colonial rule.

title: NO ONE IS ACCUSED IN LEAK ON BIAGG
description: An official report has concluded that there is no basis to bring criminal charges against anyone known to be involved in the leak of Marid Biaggi's grandjury testimony.

title: Journal Editor Is Named Director of Naval Institute
description: Robert. P. Brewer, a retired Navy commander, has been promoted to the post of executive director of the United States Naval Institute.

title: Brown & Williamson Says 51% Of Gimbel Stock Is Already In
description: The Brown & Williamson Tobacco Corporation announced yesterday that more than 4.3 million shares of Gimbel Brothers, Inc., common stock had been tendered in response to its offer of June 12.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
Equity Financing
description: United Financial Corporation of California announced yesterday that it intended to acquire up to 200,000 shares of its common stock on the open market or through unsolicited private transactions at prices not higher than the then current price on the New York Stock Exchange. The stock closed at 7, up . The company has 6,497,000 shares outstanding and is the parent of the Citizens Savings and Loan Association.

title: Pilic, Returning to Court, Beats McManus, 64, 62
description: BAASTAD, Sweden, July 10 (UPI)Nikki Pilic, who caused the mass boycott at Wimbledon, moved into the second round of the $50,000 Swedish tennis tournament today by defeating Jim McManus of Berkeley, Calif., 64, 62.

title: CHARGES ARE CUT
description: Charges against a man and his wife involved in an altercation with three policemen last month in Jamaica, Queens, were reduced yesterday following a hearing in Queens Criminal Court. Charges against a second man were dismissed.

title: Mitchell Version Differs From Prior Testimony
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 John N. Mitchell's version of events in the Watergate affair varies drastically and irreconcilably from the testimony of other key witnesses heard by the Senate investigators.

title: U.S. May Call 3 Dozen Microbiologists In Suit to Destroy Bon Vivant Products
description: NEWARK, July 10The Federal Government said today that it would produce perhaps three dozen microbiologists to testify as expert witnesses in its suit seeking to destroy 1.5 million cans of food products seized from Bon Vivant Soups, Inc.

title: Mitchell Version Differs From Prior Testimony
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 John N. Mitchell's version of events in the Watergate affair varies drastically and irreconcilably from the testimony of other key witnesses heard by the Senate investigators.

title: Mellon and Harris Banks Earnings Up
description: Two major regional banks announced sharp increases in earnings for the second quarter and the first half of 1973 yesterday. Both institutions reported higher rates of return on their shareholders investments, but substantial increases in the cost of lendable funds narrowed their profit margins.

title: The Surplus Children of South Vietnam
description: The terrace of Saigon's Hotel Continentale is one of the few constants in the capital's kaleidescopic physical and human landscape. In the late afternoon and on into the evening, the good and the evil sit cheek by jowl sipping and nibbling, buying and selling, drinking and brooding. The players change, but the cast is always the sameforeign soldiers, local hustlers, expatriate Frenchmen, worldweary newsmen. Along the side and rear walls are the prostitutesmale, female and indeterminate. And shuffling around from table to table are the beggars and the pushers. The mood music is a melange of turnedup rock, flatulent Honda, occasional siren.

title: EXBOXER SHOT DEAD IN A STREET DISPUTE
description: CINCINNATI, July 10 (UPI)  Wallace (Bud) Smith, 44 years old, a former lightweight boxing champion, was shot and killed today when he attempted to act as a peacemaker between a man and a woman who were arguing on a city street.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: SHOEIN Summertime and the living has moved out to Southampton and points east in the art world, so what to show that's seasonable in town?

title: TwoDay Dollar Rally Adds 5% To Value of Battered Currency
description: PARIS, July 10The dollar continued to rally today and has now added approximately 5 per cent to its depressed value in the last two days, amid reports in Europe that a policy of official intervention in foreignexchange markets may have already been activated.

title: Lindsay and Beame Clash Over Madison Ave. Mall
description: Mayor Lindsay and the man most likely to succeed him, Controller Abraham D. Beame, clashed head on yesterday in a confrontation that jeopardized a pet Lindsay project, the Madison Avenue Mall.

title: Major League Baseball
New Deal in Auto Racing: 2 Pots for Every Chicken
description: The crafty optometrist was fitting a customer with eyeglasses. As he spoke, he studied the customer's facial expression for a clue to how far he could go. That will be $20, the optometrist said. He watched the customer's face and, seeing no reaction, he added: For the frames. Pause. The lenses are $15. Another watchful pause and still no response from the customer, whereupon the optometrist added: Each.

title: Relics Hunted in Syrian Valley Doomed by New Euphrates Dam
description: MESKENE, Syria, July 5The great dam across the Euphrates River 20 miles downstream from here will soon drown this agricultural village in a lake that will force 60,000 peasants to find new homes.
