description: MADRID, July 11 (Reuters)Three Spanish Roman Catholic missionaries said today that two fellow priests had personally met survivors of a massacre of at least 400 men, women and children by Portuguese troops in a Mozambique village.

title: A Woman's Punch Stops Mugger
description: A mugger followed Beatrice McCormack and her woman friend late Tuesday evening, slugged the friend and tried to steal the women's purses. The 35yearold Mrs. McCormack whirled around, felled the 22yearold man with two punches and sat on him until the police arrived.

title: Mitchell Inquiry Brings Talk of Power and Truth
description: WASHINGTON, July 11What makes John N. Mitchell different in the Watergate cast is his strong implication that he would play his part much the same way again.

title: $2Million Class Suit Filed In Cruise Hit by Dysentery
description: LOS ANGELES, July 11 (AP) Four passengers have filed $2million class action suit over a dysenteryplagued Carribean cruise.

title: Leading Scores at the British Open
description: Leading Scores at the British Open

title: Nixon Campaign Returns Illegal $55,000 to Airline
description: WASHINGTON, July 11The Finance Committee to Reelect the President announced today that it had returned a $55,000 illegal corporate contribution to American Airlines while denying that it had been aware of the illegal nature of the contribution.

title: State Contracts for Sale Of Power to Alcoa Plant
description: The State Power Authority last night announced a new contract, subject to Governor Rockefeller's approval, to sell electricity to the Aluminum Company of America at Massena.

title: URUGUAYAN UNION CALLS OFF STRIKE
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 11The powerful Communistdominated National Workers Confederation called off a general strike tonight, urging workers to go back on the job tomorrow in what was considered a major step toward a solution of the political crisis that has paralyzed the life of this country for the last two weeks.

title: Mets Lose to Astros, 71; Fregosi Traded to Texas
description: The Mets helped make it as painless as possible for their followers at Shea Stadium yesterday by taking only 1 hour 159 minutes to lose to the Houston Astros, 71.

title: Big Board Stirs Storm on Warrants
description: New York Stock Exchange directors approved yesterday a plan to relax listing standards for warrants on the Big Board and thereby stirred up a storm of criticism at the American Stock Exchange.

title: SOUTH KOREA ORDERS ECONOMIC CONTROLS
description: SEOUL, South Korea, July 11 The South Korean Government announced today a series of economic measures, including a ban on construction of nonessential buildings and rationing of steel billets, to cope with the effects of United States export controls on scrap iron and farm products.

title: F P.C. Concedes It Approved S.I. Gas Tank Without Plans
description: WASHINGTON July 11 (AP)  The Federal Power Commission has acknowledged that it approved construction plans for a giant liquefied gas tank in New York City without having the specifications on hand. Six years later, on Feb. 10 this year, a fire in the tank killed 40 men.

title: 7 Killed and 19 Hurt In Tenement Blaze In Worcester, Mass.
description: WORCESTER, Mass., July 11 (AP)  Seven persons were killed, 19 injured and three missing after fire swept a fivestory brick apartment building here early today, officials said.

title: GERTRUDE DAVIS, SOCIALWORK AIDE
description: HARRISON, N. Y., July 11Mrs. Gertrude Ross Davis, for many years a leading figure in the state and national socialwelfare fields and on problems of the aging, died today in the White Plains Hospital after stroke. Her age was 79.

title: DOLLAR ADVANCES 3D STRAIGHT DAY
description: PARIS, July 11The dollar completed three days of advance today, but traders said there were signs the rally was fading despite confirmation by West German authorities that they were already engaged in an active intervention policy.

title: Suspect in Slaying at C. W. Post Is Indicted in Rape in Bethpage
description: MINEOLA, L. I., July 11Samuel M. DeNicola, a 25yearold former mental patient from New Hyde Park, L. L, has been indicted by a Nassau County grand jury in the rape of a 15yearold girl.

title: Weiskopf 68 Leads British Open
description: TROON, Scotland, July 11 In a late charge long after the leaders had been in and a fierce wind had moderated Tom Weiskopf welded a 33, 3568 to snatch a stroke lead over Jack Nicklaus and Bert Yancey in the opening round of the 102d British Open golf championship today.

title: The winning New Jersey, daily lottery number yester. day was:
Utility Sees Fuel Shortage
description: The Southern California Edison Company told the state Public Utilities Commission yesterday that unless it was able to get additional supplies of fuel oil to operate its generating plants, there would be power shortages in the southern California area next year.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Flours Giver; in Daylight Saying Tinle

title: Swedish Research Team Devolops First Blood Test to Detect Presence of Marijuana in Humans
description: STOCKHOLM, July 11A Swedish research team has developed the first blood test for marijuana. It detects the presence of THC, the potent chemical ingredient that scintists consider the key to a marijuana high.

title: Disaster Area Declared
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (AP) New Hampshire has been declared a Federal disaster area because of recent floods, Representative James C. Cleveland said today. The declaration by President Nixon qualifies the state for immediate Federal aid for clearance of debris, highway repairs and homeowner loans at 5 per cent interest.

title: Trading Is Brisk as Average Advances
description: The stock market's summer rally gathered momentum in brisk trading yesterday as confidence grew that another international monetary crisis would be averted and that the Nixon Administration was moving closer to Phase 4 of its economic program.

title: WAGE RESTRAINT PUZZLES EXPERTS
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 Now that the International Brotherhood of Teamsters has signed with the trucking industry, most of this year's major labor negotiations are over and the pattern of wage settlements is pretty well established.

title: On Attorneys General
description: McLEAN, Va.The Ervin committee is barking up the wrong tree, It has been distracted by its pursuit of crime from addressing the serious question of governmental organization which Watergate raises.

title: MADISON AVE MALL IS DEFEATED,1210, BY ESTIMATE UNIT
description: The Board of Estimate killed the proposed Madison Avenue Mall yesterday and dealt a damaging blow to the prestige of Mayor Lindsay, who had made the project a top priority of his last six months in office.

title: Era of Investigation
description: WASHINGTON, July 11  In Mr. Nixon's first term, he moved from an era of confrontation to an era of negotiation; in his second term, Democrats are determined to move us into an era of investigation.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: NEW ZEALANDERS ENTER TEST ZONE
description: PARIS, July 11 (Reuters)France's warning to world shipping and aircraft to stay away from her nuclear test zone in the South Pacific came into force today as New Zealand's protest frigate, the Otago, entered the banned area.

title: Fulbright Assails Efforts to Link Soviet Trade Accord to Emigration Issue
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 Senator J. W. Fulbright, chairman of the Foreign Relations Committee, today assailed as a renewal of the cold war the moves on Capitol Hill to block trade concessions to the Soviet Union until Jews and others are allowed to emigrate freely.

title: U.S. Agency Finds No Grain Fraud
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 The Justice Department reported today that no evidence of criminal fraud or conflict of interest had been uncovered in its investigation of alleged price manipulation by grain companies to get larger Government subsidies in connection with last summer's sale of grain to the Soviet Union.

title: Equity Financing
description: The Northern Illinois Gas Company's offering of a million shares of common stock was won by underwriters headed by Blyth Eastman Dillon & Co. The group bid $24.773 a share and will reoffer them to the public at $25.50 a share. Northern Illinois Gas closed at 25, up , on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: State Nears Plan for Implementing New Drug Law
description: Governor Rockefeller said yesterday that a plan to implement the state's new drug law was in its final form and would be taken up with the Lindsay administration by the end of the week.

title: Stocks and Dollar Up
description: Stock prices advanced sharply yesterday on the New York Stock Exchange, pushing the DowJones industrial average up 19.87 points. In European trading, the dollar gained for the third day in a row. Details on Page 55.

title: People and Business
description: Early retirement, at 55, is being taken by Jackson R. McGowen, president of the Douglas Aircraft Company diVision of the McDonnell Douglas Corporation. John C. Brizendine, 48, who has been executive vice president of the Douglas division and a corporate vice president of McDonnell Douglas, has been elected to succeed him.

title: Policeman Is Found Guilty In Rochester Bomb Hoax
description: ROCHESTER, July 12 (AP)Lieut. Robert Coyne of the Rochester Police Department has been found guilty of a departmental charge of bringing discredit on the force for his part in a bomb hoax at police headquarters.

title: Computer Services Unit To Aid Banks Is Formed
description: A new company, FBC, Inc., has been formed by subsidiaries of the First National

title: Tough Act to Follow, Moore Tells Mitchell
description: WASHINGTON, July 12The hearingroom meeting between John N. Mitchell and his old friend Richard Moore, special counsel in the White House, began with a clenched fist salute from Mr. Moore and sardonic humor from Mr. Mitchell.

title: 2 New White House Arrests
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 (UPI) Two more antiwar protesters were arrested at the White House today when they knelt to pray during a tour of the mansion, The arrests bring to 118 the number of persons detained since last Friday at the White House for protesting the bombing in Cambodia.

title: Academy Elects Mirisch
description: HOLLYWOOD, July 12 (UPI) The film producer Walter Mirische, who won an Oscar in 1967 with In the Heat of the Night, has been elected president of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Science, it was announced today. Mr. Mirisoh, formerly treasurer of the academy, succeeds Daniel Taradash, who will remain on the board of governors.

title: FREEHOLDER TO GET 2D TRIAL 1N 2 DEATHS
description: ATLANTIC CITY, July 12 (UPI)A Superior Court judge in Atlantic City has ordered new trial for Robert Halpin, the Cumberland County Freeholder convicted last April of two counts of death by auto.

title: ExFinance Minister of Netherlands Says He Would Accept
description: THE HAGUE, the Netherlands, July 12Dr. Hendrikus Witteveen, 52, a former Dutch Finance Minister and leading European Market candidate to be managing director of the International Monetary fund, told the Dutch news agency today he would accept the job if it is offered to him.

title: British Panel Finds No Security Breach
description: LONDON, July 12A highlevel official commission reported today that the recent callgirl scandal that forced two Government officials to resign did not involve any actual Heach of security.

title: Planet of Apes Goes Into Battle
description: BATTLE FOR THE PLANET OF 1 HE APES, directed be I. Lee 1 meson; sr;eenplay by John William Corrington Joyce Hooper Corrington, based on story by Paul Dehn and characters created Ny Pierre Boulle; produced by Arthur J. Jacobs; music, Leonard Rosen. man; director of photography, Richard H. Kline, editors, Alan L. Jaggs and John C. Elorger; an Apiac International Production, released by 20th CenturyFox. Running time! 86 minutes. At the New Embassy Theater, Broadway at 46th Street, the Juliet 2 Theater, Third Avenue at 83d Street, and other theaters. This film has been class. ified G.

title: F.B.I. Seizes an Ohio Man Here and $1.7Million in Bogus and Stolen Securities
description: Agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation discovered nearly $1.7million worth of counterfeit and stolen securities here in a white suitcase carried by a 24yearold Ohio man whom they had arrested on charges of possessing stolen traveler's checks.

title: MRS. PHILIP RHODES
description: Mrs. Mary Jones Rhodes, wife of Philip L. Rhodes, New York naval architect, died Wednesday in New Rochelle Hospital. She was 78 years old and lived in Pelham Manor, N.Y.

title: Inquiry Renewed on Alleged Payoffs to Teamsters
description: WASHINGTON, July 12The Justice Department will seek indictments of teamster's union officials and lettuce growers in California next week on criminal charges alleging illegal cash payments to the union ,officials, informed Government authorities disclosed today.

title: Weyand Ends Vietnam Tour Next Stop Is Cambodia
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 12 (Reuters)Gen. Frederick C. Weyand, Commander in Chief of Army Forces in the Pacific, today completed a threeday visit to South Vietnam, where he has been assessing the military situation that has obtained since the ceasefire.

title: Podell Indicted on Charge Of Taking Airline Bribes
description: Representative Bertram L. Podell of Brooklyn was indicted yesterday on charges of conspiracy, bribery, perjury and conflict of interest involving efforts to obtain a route for an airline.

title: Excerpts From Notes on Interview of Haldeman by Senate Committee Lawyers
description: WASHINGTON, July 12Following are excerpts from notes on an interview of H. R. Haldeman on May 4, 1973, conducted by Samuel Dash, Fred P. Thompson and James Hamilton, staff counsel in the Senate Watergate committee. John J. Wilson and Frank Strickler represented Mr. Haldeman, and Douglas Parker was present on behalf of the White House. Mr. Haldeman's statements have been paraphrased by the committee staff:

title: Retail Store Sales Up
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $854million, up 13 per cent fronfthe yearearlier $756million.

title: AIR FORCE BACKS TRIP BY GENERAL
description: WASHINGTON, July 12The Air Force got into a quarrel today with Representative Les Aspin of Wisconsin on the question of whether Gen. John D. Ryan was taking a Governmentpaid junket with his wife before retiring as Chief of Staff of the Air Force.

title: Judge Defers Decision On a Plant's Fish Kill
description: TOMS RIVER, July 12 Ocean County Judge Robert H. Doherty Jr. reserved decision today on two remaining counts of a state suit against the Jersey Central Power and Light Company.

title: White House Horrors
description: Out of John N. Mitchell's testimony has come the useful and allpurpose phrase: White House horrors. It a most appropriate label, not merely for the Watergate breakin and coverup, but for the entire list of White Housesponsored illegal acts of political espionage and even broader violations of constitutionally guaranteed rights and liberties.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: Winning numbers drawn on July 12 were:

title: DALE S. RENAULT
description: MIAMI, July 12 (AP)Dale S. Renault, for 16 years real estate, financial and business editor of The Miami Sun and later SunReporter, died Tuesday of a heart attack. He was 79 years old.

title: Poughkeepsie Recalls Liddy: Gun gHo Deputy Prosecutor
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, July 12 It was Easter Sunday last year in this quiet Hudson River city when a local woman was startled to see G. Gordon Liddy, a former assistant district attorney here, attending a party.

title: JAYITS MAY SEEK OUSTER OF JUDGE
description: WASHINGTON, July 12Senator Jacob K. Javits said today that he was considering recommending impeachment procedures against Federal Judge Mark A. Costantino, whose performance in the Eastern District has prompted Government lawyers to complain to the Justice Department.

title: CONGRESS IN MOOD TO DEFY PRESIDEN
description: WASHINGTON, July 12When Republican Congressions leaders go to the White HOUSE usually every Tuesday to tall about legislation with Presiden Nixon, they now take alonl eight or so other Republica] Senators and Representative not involved in the leadershil so as to present a broader Con gressional viewpoint to th President.

title: The New Nasser
description: Acting as if he already owned the place, Libya's ambitious young leader, Col. Muammar elQaddafi, has been in Cairo recently, uninvited, lobbying vigorously for the EgyptianLibyan merger which he has been pressing on a reluctant President Sadat for more than a year.

title: Lansky Tax Trial to Start
description: MIAMI, July 12 (AP)United States District Court Judge Joe Eaton has set the Federal tax evasion trial of Meyer Lansky, the underworld figure, for next Tuesday.

title: 6 McCord Letters Are Sold for $950 At an Auction Here
description: Six letters written by James W. McCord while he was working for the Central Intelligence Agency brought $950 at an auction here last night after brief but spirited bidding by two veteran collectors.

title: DUNLOP FORESEES SIGNIFICANT RISE IN PHASE 4 PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, July 12The Government's chief price monitor warned today that there would be significant price increases, not stability, under Phase 4 of President Nixon's economic stabilization program.

title: Westinghouse Net Flat
description: Two of the nation's largest electronicelectrical giantsthe Westinghouse Electric Corporation and the RCA Corporation reported yesterday that operations under the present economy produced different results.

title: U.S. Suspends Fighting Doctor
description: TEL AVIV, Israel, July 12. (AP)The chief of the American contingent in the ninth Maccabiah Games suspended today a team doctor who bloodied the nose of an Israeli sports federation leader.

title: Nixon Aide and Friend Richard Arthur Moore
description: WASHINGTON, July 12At Yale in the nineteenthirties, Red Moore was the flamboyant Irishman from Brooklyn. As editor of The Yale Daily News, he devoted an entire issue of the paper to a spoof about how the university was dominated by Communists.

title: Rooftop Smoke Bombs Tested as Burglar Alarms
description: Smoke bombs and amberandwhite strobe lights flaring from a roof are bound to catch the eye, and if they are connected to a building's regular alarm system, they may even help the Police Department's helicopter units catch a burglar.

title: Met Had Expert Advice OnPaintings'Provenance
description: In line with the Metropolitan Museum's policy of greater public disclosure, the announcement of its acquisition of 25 Chinese paintings was accompanied by a 30page appendix verifying the legality of their provenance and giving the opinions of authorities outside the museum on their authenticity, quality and desirability as additions to. the Metropolitan's collections.

title: Electrical Workers In Puerto Rico End EightDay Walkout
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., July 121 (UPI)An eightday strike by Puerto Rico's biggest electrical workers union ended today, and a nineday strike of firemen appeared also to have collapsed.

title: Television
description: SENATE WATERGATE HEARINGS

title: Massive Equity Audit Said to Delay Criminal Action
description: LOS ANGELES, July 12 Criminal proceedings growing out of the Equity Funding fraud have been slowed by the monumental accounting job under way to determine company assets.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: FICTION

title: NIXON CRITICIZES SENATE ON ENVOY
Eastern Awarded $31Million On Late Delivery of Jet Orders
description: Eastern Air Lines was awarded $31,870,316 in damages yesterday from the McDonnel Douglas Corporation for late manufacture and delivery of Jet airliners in the 1966to1968 period. The was handed down

title: Byrne Names a Watchdog To Insure Legal Campaign
description: TRENTON, July 12Brendan T. Byrne, the Democratic candidate for Governor of New Jersey, announced today that he had named Archibald S. Alexander Jr. to head a watchdog committee in his campaign for election.

title: CANADA'S INDIAN ACT RULED INOPERATIVE
description: TORONTO, July 12 (Canadian Press)In a decision that might have farreaching effects across Canada, Justice Osier of the Supreme Court of On tario ruled today that the Indian Act was inoperative by virtue of its discrimination by reason of race.

title: White House Aide Rejects Dean Report on President
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 A White House official contradicted before the Senate Watergate committee today charges by John W. Dean 3d that President Nixon knew of efforts to cover up the scandal as early as last September.

title: Indi and Pakistan Agree to Hold Talks on Prisoners
description: NEW DELHI, July 12India and Pakistan agreed today to hold talks in Islamabad on July 24 in an effort to resolve the bitter problems resulting from the December, 1971 war over Bangladesh.

title: U.S. to Start Withdrawing B52's in Southeast Asia
description: WASHINGTON, July 12The Defense Department plans to start withdrawing B52 bombers from Southeast Asian operations this weekend as the Administration, responding to a Congressional order, begins to phase out the air war over Cambodia.

title: Burundian Reports Attack By Tanzanian Army Force
description: BUJUMBURA, Burundi, July 12 (Agence FrancePresse)A large Tanzanian army company attacked a Burundian army post early today at Mugina, two and a half miles from the border near the town of Mabanda, President Michel Micomhero said today.

title: Red Smith
description: Larry Mahan, a cowboy who can extract money from a rogue bronco or misanthropic bull almost as efficiently as Herbert W. Kalmbach can squeeze it out of an airline executive, is up to his old tricks. After two years when his hospital bills ran a bangup second to his earnings, Mahan is back at the top of his form and raking in loot

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Police Accused of Ignoring a Tip

title: Lawyers Examine Ethics In the Light of Watergate
description: The incoming president of the American Bar Association pledged yesterday a major thrust in the coming year toward improving the way in which the nation's lawyers are regulated and disciplined.

title: Advertising: BuyStocks Drive
description: Next week Blyth Eastman Dillon & Co., a major investment banking and brokerage firm, will begin a newspaper advertising campaign that it hopes will induce the average investor to buy stocks as he. did in the good old days.

title: Deaths
description: ADELBERGHIlda. Friends and colleagues of Hilda Adelberg at the Jewish Board of Guardians mourn her death. Her devotion, gentleness and dedicated friendship will always be remembered.

title: The Pop Life
description: Norman Schwartz, who is a producer for the Cobblestone record label, has a major task ahead of him. He recorded all the jazz that came out of the July 4 afternoon concert at this year's Newport Jazz Festival. For that concert, Mayor Lindsay redirected the air traffic to counter noise pollution and renamed Singer Bowl in Queens Louis Armstrong Stadium. It was also a concert that contained an almost complete directory of major jazz names  more than 60 of themwho were anxious to contribute something to the afternoon and salute Mr. Armstrong, one of jazz's authentic titans.

title: Poughkeepsie Recalls Liddy Gun gHo Deputy Prosecutor
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, July 12 It was Easter Sunday last year in this quiet Hudson River city when a local woman was startled to see G. Gordon Liddy, a former assistant district attorney here, attending a party.

title: Cleveland Stadium Pact
description: CLEVELAND, July 12 (UPI) Mayor Ralph J. Perk and representatives of the Cleveland Stadium Corporation announced today agreement on a $24million package to renovate Municipal Stadium and provide the city with additional revenues

title: West Berliners Barred in East For 9 Days of Youth Festival
description: BERLIN, July 12The East Germans have decided to bar West Berliners from East Berlin and surrounding parts of East Germany during the Communistdominated World Youth Festival from July 28 to Aug. 5.

title: Good Crops Ahead?
description: For most Americans, normally, Department of Agriculture reports on crop prospects are of less interest than baseball scores, television program listings, or the daily crossword puzzle. The availability of a bountiful supply cheap food has almost always been taken for granted here. Except during World War II, public and governmental concern about agriculture has normally been focused on the cost of curbing surpluses.

title: Radio
description: 8:0510 A.M., WNCN. Sinfonia in B flat, J. C. Bach; Hungarian Dances: Nos. 5 and 6, Brahms; Symphony No. 1, Sibelius; String Quartet No. 6, Bartok.

title: Public Defender Asked to Fight Fingerprinting of 8th Graders
description: NEWARK, July 12Parents of two former eighthgrade students in a Newark public school have asked the Public Defender's office here to represent them in fighting an order that would require their sons to be fingerprinted along with 50 to 60 other boys in the class.

title: I% Decline Reflects Lack of Concerted Official Support
description: FRANKFURT, July 12 (Reuters)The dollar slipped today in Europe by an average of about 1 per cent against other major currencies, ending a threeday rally which had taken it up from its alltime lows.

title: For 61, Great American Dream Is a Baseball Career in Canada
description: They came in search of what once was The Great American Dream, a major league baseball contract. They brought their own gloves, balls, uniforms and spikes. Some even brought girl friends.

title: Met Had Expert Advice OnPaintings'Provenance
description: hi line with the Metropolitan Museum's policy of greater public disclosure, the announcement of its acquisition of 25 Chinese paintings was accompanied by a 30page appendix verifying the legality of their provenance and giving the opinions of authorities outside the museum on their authenticity, quality and desirability as additions to the Metropolitan's collections.

title: Problems Delay B1 Strategic Bomber for Year and Add $80Million to Cost
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 The Air Force disclosed today that its new B1 bomber had run into developmental problems that delay the multibilliondollar program by nearly a year and: add $80million to its cost.

title: 6 EXCAMPAIGN AIDES GIVEN JOBS AT F.T.C.
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 (UPI)Six former employes of President Nixon's reelection committee have been given highranking jobs at the Federal Trade Commission, it was disclosed today.

title: Soviet Grain Purchases Cut Back, U.S. Reports
description: WASHINGTON, July 12The Soviet Union has apparently begun to curtail sharply its purchases of American grain, apparently because of a new health in their domestic grain production and high prices in the United States, Department of Agriculture specialists said today.

title: Reporters Challenge a Spokesman for Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, July 12For months, the mood in the White House briefing room has been sour and querulous. For months, exchanges between spokesmen and reporters have centered almost exclusively on Watergate.

title: VIOLATION OF RULES IS LAID TO SMITHERS
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced formal disciplinary charges yesterday against F. S. Smithers & Co., Inc., a member firm which suffered serious financial problems.

title: Suit Filed on Clamming Ban
description: EASTON, Md., July 12 (UPI) The Maryland Watermen's, Association has filed suit against the Maryland Health Department in an effort to force the reopening of Chesapeake Bay and its tributariesi, to soft shell clamming. The association challenged the contention by state health officials that the clams are unsafe to eat. The department imposed the ban on June 22.

title: GOLDWATER ASSAILS KENNEDY LECTURE
description: ATLANTA, July 12 (AP)Senator Barry Goldwater told the National Young Republicans Convention tonight that Senator Edward M. Kennedy should be the last person in the country to lecture us on Watergate.

title: On the Streets of Cairo, Your Status Is the Car You're Driving
description: CAIROSo you wound up in a little red Fiat, too, a young girl told her older sister teasingly on seeing her driven home from a dinner party by a friend the other evening.

title: Yankees Get, 17 Hits and Rout Royals, 103
description: The New York Yankees, who lost their touch on the road last week, regained it at home last night and also saved their perch in first place with 17 hits and a 103 victory over the Kansas City Royals.

title: AIRLINES TO SHIFT %. AUG. 8 AT NEWARK
description: The improvements at Newark International Airport, where the first of three new terminals will open Aug. 8, will include a $4.6million administration and police garage building.

title: Scholarships Are Granted By ScrippsHoward Fund
description: Trustees of the ScrippsHoward Foundation authorized record number of scholarships yesterday to go to undergraduates in the field of journalism as well as cash grants to colleges and universities.

title: GOVERNOR'S PANEL TO SCREEN JUDGES
description: Governor Rockefeller has decided to name a panel of prominent citizens to screen potential appointees to the courts under his new authority to name to 100 additional judges for narcotics cases.

title: BIG POTENTIAL SEEN FOR EXPORT GROWTH
description: WASHINGTON, July 12Henry Kearns, chairman of the ExportImport Bank, said today that there were potential United States exports in the next five years of between $9.75billion and $12.5billion in the single area of collection, liquefaction and storage facilities for natural gas abroad.

title: ARGENTINE LEADER IS REPORTED READY TO YIELD TO PERON
description: BUENOS AIRES, July 12 High Argentine Government and military officials reported to night that President Hector J. Campora would imminently announce his intention to resign, paving the way for a takeover of the Presidency by Juan D. Peron, the nation's former dictator.

title: City Puts Off Bond Sale Until July 24
description: Interest rates moved inconclusively yesterday as the credit markets contemplated the international status of the dollar, the prospects for Phase 4 and this week's huge supply of new and only moderately well received  bond and note financing.

title: Once So Worried by Campus Drugs and Sex, Parents Seem Calmer
description: ROCHESTERWhat is a reasonable allowance for my son? Are refrigerators and hot plates permitted? Should I put name tapes on my child's clothes? How much time is available for sports? How widespread is the use of graduate students as teachers? What is the difference between a B.S. and a B.A. in physics?

title: Dr. Abbie Shapiro Wed to J. E. Salny
description: WEST ORANGE, N. J., July 12 The marriage of Dr. Abbie F. Shapiro, widow of Seymour Shapiro, to Jerome E. Salny took place at The Manor here tonight. Rabbi Jerome H. Blass performed the ceremony.

title: Haldeman Denials Contradict Witnesses
description: WASHINGTON, July 12H. R. Haldeman, President Nixon's former chief of staff, has told Senate investigators that he took no part in planning the Watergate burglary and did not know of efforts to block the investigation and cover up the facts until March this year.

title: CLEMENCY OFFER TO FOUR REPORTED
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 An attorney for four of the original defendants in the Watergate bugging case has told Federal prosecutors that his clients accepted offers of money and executive clemency in return for their guilty pleas at the Watergate trial last January, wellinformed sources said today.

title: PRICES ON AMEX UP 4TH STRAIGHT DAY
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange were higher yesterday for the fourth consecutive session. Volume was slightly higher than the day before.

title: White House Aide Rejects Dean Report on President
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 A White House official contradicted before the Senate Watergate committee today charges by John W. Dean 3d that President Nixon knew of efforts to cover up the scandal as early as last September.

title: An Uncontrolled Visitor to Mongolia Sees Contrasts With Neighbor China
description: ULAN BATOR, MongoliaUnlike their Chinese neighbors, the Mongolians do not go in for stagemanaged tours. Whereas a foreigner traveling in China is likely to be conducted from one carefully chosen institution to another, meeting people who have been painstakingly schooled for the purpose, a visitor to Mongolia is left largely to his own devices, with visits to anything but the obvious tourist spots arranged reluctantly, and only after considerable badgering.

title: Giants Ticket Sales Set
description: NEW HAVEN. July 12 (AP)The first of the New York Giants football subscription tickets, limited to the Giants five regularseason games in Yale Bowl this fall, vill be available Monday, city officials said today.

title: Dean Asks Not to Testify In Democratic Civil Suits
description: WASHINGTON, July 12, (UPI) A lawyer for the dismissed White House counsel, John W. Dean 3d, asked the United States District Court today to prevent the Democratic National Committee from forcing Mr. Dean to testify in the Watergate civil suits.

title: Confrontation Avoided by Basel Accord
description: PARIS, July 12A confrontation between France and the United States was avoided at the last minute to pave the way for last weekend's agreement designed to end the latest monetary crisis.

title: Thieu Makes Cabinet Changes That Will Increase His Control
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 12President Nguyen Van Thieu announced a Cabinet shuffle today that puts control over the Government even more firmly in his own hands.

description: All Hours Given In Daylight SavingTIme

title: Podell Indicted on Charge Of Taking Airline Bribes
description: Representative Bertram Podell of Brooklyn was indicted yesterday on charges of conspiracy, bribery, perjury and conflict of interest involving efforts to obtain a route for an airline.

title: DEFENSE VOWED IN SIGNAL MERGER
description: Merger News

title: Market Mixed as Turnover Declines
description: The stock market paused to rest yesterday after three consecutive sessions of strong gains and closed mixed in moderate trading.

title: 12th Day of Christmas: Trotter in a Pear Tree
description: The new state superagency for racing is considering, and is expected to approve, yearround racing starting next winter.

title: Iraqi Party to Share Power With Reds
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq, July 12the ruling Baath party of Iraq, shaken by a plot within its ranks to overthrow the Government, has made a political agreement with its main rival, the Communist party, and resumed peace talks with the rebellious Kurdish minority.

title: On CrossExamination
description: The public is obsessed by the television coverage of the Watergate hearings. It considers the questioning of witnesses to be crossexamination. Indeed, the members of the Select Committee have occasionally referred to their examinations of witnesses, present and future, as crossexamination.

title: Refinery Hearing to Reopen;
description: AUGUSTA, Me, July 12 The Maine Board of Environmental Protection will resume hearings Monday on the Pittston Company's application for a $350million oil refinery all Faqport.

title: Police Department Bows to Objection To Quick Dismissal
description: The Police Department retreated yesterday from a court test of its power to seek dismissal of a police officer for incompetence without detailing the charges he was to face at departmental hearing.

title: MORTGAGE RATES UP AS SAVINGS DECLINE
description: Interest rates on home mortgages rose modestly and irregularly in June, the Federal Home Loan Board said yesterday.

title: Presidential Essay
description: The principles underlying the Government of the United States are decentralization of power, separation of power and maintaining a balance between freedom and order.

title: Football Transactions
description: AMERICAN CONFERENCE

title: City to Plant 50,000 Trees by Spring
description: Mayor Lindsay announced massive treeplanting program yesterday, citing the incredible number of trees in Paris and the way in which they add to the quality of life there.

title: Cluchette Hearing Delayed
description: LOS ANGELES, July 12 (UPI) A parole revocation hearing for John Cluchette, one of the Soledad brothers, was postponed indefinitely yesterday while officials considered his request that he be represented by an attorney. He was arrested two weeks ago after the police came into possession of a photo showing him carrying guns, violation of his parole terms. Cluchette and two other inMates were charged with killing a guard at Soledad prison.

title: Bill QuiMan, Tennis Star, Dies of Leukemia at 39
description: SEATTLE, July 12 (UPI) Bill Quillian, who dominated the Pacific Northwest tennis scene for 20 years, died Tuesday night in a Victoria, British Columbia, rest home of acute leukemia. He was 39 years old.

title: Excerpts From Testimony Before the Senate Committee in Inquiry on Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, July 12Following are excerpts from the transcript of the testimony of John N. Mitchell and Richard A. Moore today on the 19th day of the hearings on the Watergate case before the Senate Select Committee on Presidential Campaign Activities:

title: HOUSE UNIT REBUFFS NIXON ON TARIFFS
description: WASHINGTON, July 12The House Ways and Means Committee has tentatively decided to reject President Nixon's request, as part of hia manysided trade bill, to be given a free hand to negotiate removal of two sensitive non. tariff United States trade barriers, it was reliably reported by Committee sources today.

title: Worcester Fire Toll at 9
description: WORCESTER, Mass., July 12 (AP)The death toll rose to nine today in a fire that swept a fivestory rooming house on Main Street yesterday, officials said. A search at the site continued for the body of at least one resident still unaccounted for.

title: Missouri Fire Ruins Data on Veterans
description: ST. LOUIS, July 12 (UPI)A fire in the United States Military Personnel Records Center destroyed today the files of hundreds of thousands of servicemen and veterans.

title: Weiskopf Leads British Open by 3 Shots
description: TROON, Scotland, July 12Tom Weiskopf shot a fiveunderpar 67 today for a 36hole total of 135 and a threestroke lead halfway through the British Open golf tournament.

title: Rail TonMileage Up 20%
description: WASHINGTON, July 12The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week totaled an estimated 13.2 billion tonmiles, 20.2 per cent above the corresponding week last year. Carloadings in the same week, which included the July 4 holiday, totaled 427,543 cars, 14.7 per cent above the corresponding holiday week year ago. The American Trucking Associations, Inc., reported intercity truck tonnage last week was 11.8 per cent above last year.

title: Never Bold, $3.40, Wins Dash by a Neck
description: Never Bold was the strong, choice in the feature race at, Aqueduct yesterday, and he won, truly enough. But his trainer, Dave Erb, was quick to, point out that the colt should have done better.

title: Uruguay Chief Acts to Strengthen Hold
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 12Resistance to the establishment of a militarydominated civilian dictatorship waned here today with the end of a 15day general strike.

title: STATE SAYS CITY DRIVES RENTS UP
description: The State Welfare Inspector General, George F. Berlinger, charged yesterday that the city's Department of Social Services had become the largest decontrolling agency on rents here.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: PETE SEEGER AND OTHERS, Washington Square Church, 135 West Fourth Street, 7.

title: Mayer and Nastase Gain Swiss Net Quarterfinals
description: GSTAAD, Switzerland, July 12 (AP)  Alex Mayer, the Wimbledon semifinalist from Wayne, N. J., defeated Peter Kanderal, an exiled Czechoslovak playing out of Switzerland 68, 61, 62, today and advanced to the quarterfinals of the Swiss international tenlnis championships.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Grossinger's Sets Stage Plan

title: Extra Police Roam Riot Site in Newark Following Rampage
description: NEWARK, July 12Strengthened police patrols tonight roamed the North Ward neighborhood that had been disrupted by violence last night when one youth was shot and critically wounded and others ran through the area breaking windows of homes and cars.

title: HOUSE SUSPENDS FARM BILL DEBATE
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 The House abruptly suspended action today on a controversial farm bill to give leaders time to work out a new compromise with a disgruntled Administration.

title: Lindsay Proposes a Limit On HighRise Apartments
description: A proposal by Mayor Lindsay for a major overhaul of the city's residential zoning law was made public yesterday. The changes would prevent the construction of highrise housing in lowrise neighborhoods and have other farreaching effects on the design,  amenities and safety and security aspects of new apartment houses.

title: Business Briefs
description: Ford and Colgate Revise Dividends

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: The Seaboard Coast Line Railroad Company has placed orders for 62 new diesel locomotives valued at approxiately $16million, W. Thomas Rice, chairman, announced yesterday. He reported the orders were divided equally between the General Electric Company and the ElectroMotive division of the General Motors Corporation.

title: GOIN OUT Guide
description: AND THEN I WROTE Peter Link, the composer of music to, among other things, Much Ado About Nothing and Salvation and assorted New York Shakespeare Festival and Broadway productions, is getting something of a retrospective at midnight tonight in Central Park.

title: Revisiting Caravelle: A Pleasant Chore
description: The restaurants reviewed here each Friday are rated four stars to none, based on the author's subjective judgment of quality in relation to the price of meals and the quality of comparable establishments. Roughly, one star may be translated as fair, two stars as good, three as excellent and four as superb.

title: THIRD YOUTH SEIZED IN CYCLIST ATTACK
description: The police yesterday arrested a 15yearold boy who was charged with being one of a gang of youths who atacked and stole bicycles from contestants in a cycling event in Central Park last Sunday morning.

title: SOVIET DISPUTES SHIM VIEWS
description: MOSCOW, July 12The Soviet press agency Tass today accused Andrei D. Sakharov, the physicist and civilrights advocate, of having slandered the Soviet way of life in an interview with Swedish television.

title: Witnesses at Congress Allege Sex Bias in Insurance Policies
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 Women are discriminated against in what they pay for insurance and even in whether they can buy insurance against certain risks, witnesses before the Joint Economic Committee g Congress said today.

title: Open Door to Work
description: Older teenagers need the opportunity to work parttime and in the summer both for economic and social reasons that are selfevident. There is much work be done in parks, playgrounds, day care centers and hospitals, but local government agencies and nonprofit organizations rarely have the funds to hire all the workers they can use or to train inexperienced parttime employes. Congress established the Neighborhood Youth Corps to bring lowincome youths and parttime jobs together.

title: ALCOA SUIT ENDED AT TRADE CENTER
description: A $43.5million claim by the Aluminum Company of America a claim that has delayed completion of the exterior aluminum walls of the World Trade Centeris being settled for $5.5million

title: Lawyers Examine Ethics In the Light of Watergate
description: The incoming president of the American Bar Association pledged yesterday a major thrust in the coming year toward improving the way in which the nation's lawyers are regulated and disciplined.

title: Rehnquist's Father Dies
description: MILWAUKEE, July 12 (AP) William B. Rehnquist, father of William H. Rehnquist, associate justice of the Supreme Court of the United States, died today in Columbia Hospital, where he was admitted after suffering a stroke yesterday. He was 79 years old. Mr. Rehnquist, of suburban Whitefish Bay, was sales office manager for medicalsupply company before he retired nine years ago.

title: NIXON SUFFERING VIRAL PNEUMONIA
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 President Nixon entered Bethesda Naval Hospital tonight, suffering from what his personal physician said was an attack of viral pneumonia.

title: Sliced Cucumbers With Cold Chicken
description: In the menus below, the dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: BIG BOARD'S PLAN OPPOSED BY AMEX
description: The American Stock Exchange, in a move that runs counter to the New York Stock Exchange, proposed yesterday that brokerage fees remain unchanged on all orders between $100 and $2,500.

title: Ocean County Builder Accused of Pollution
description: NEWARK July 12 (AP)  Pollution charges that could lead to a fine of $30,000 were levied against a major Ocean County home developer today by the United States Attorney's office.

title: Mills to Enter Hospital
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 (AP)  Representative Wilbur D. Mills, Democrat of Arkansas, will enter Bethesda Naval Hospital tomorrow for diagnosis of a stubborn and painful back ailment. An aide said Mr. Mills, chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, expected to be back at the Capitol on Monday when the committee resumes work on trade legislation.

title: Miss Lehner Bride Of Dr. R. E. Doyle
description: In the Holy Family Roman Catholic Church here yesterday afternoon Miss Madeleine Lehner, daughter of Mrs. John Lehner af Rego Park, Queens, and the late Mr. Lehner, was married to Dr. Robert E. Doyle, son of Mr. and Mrs. John J. Doyle of Franklin Square, L. I., and Seminole, Fla. Msgr. Timothy J. Flynn performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass.

title: BALBUCO IS VICTOR AT UPSTATE SHOW
description: LAKE PLACID, N. Y., July 12Rod Jenkins won his first open jumper class of the show today when he rode Patrick Butler's Balbuco to victory in the Au Sable Forke Stake at the Lake Placid horse show.

title: East German Hijacking Law Provides for 3 Years to Life
description: BERLIN, July 12 (UPI)The East German Parliament passed a law today that provides prison terms of three years to life for aircraft hijacking.

title: I.R.S. Joins Investigations Into Recording Concerns
description: The Internal Revenue Service has begun a broad investigation of the tax records of recording companies, Justice Department sources said yesterday.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: COLLINGSWOOD, July 12The tidewaters in the Cooper River here will flow a little faster for the next two days. Starting at noon Saturday, the National Association of Amateur Oarsmen will stage its senior championships.

title: 2 TeenAgers Are Injured In Boating Mishap in Bay
description: A teenage boy and girl were injured in Jamaica Bay last night when their motorboat struck an abutment of the North Channel Bridge and capsized, according to firemen who rescued them.

title: Baldwin Wins Junior Sail For Third Straight Time
Lottery Numbers
description: Winning numbers dratvn on July 12 were:

title: Carla Fracci Convinces In La Sylphide Ballet
description: Carla Fracci looks as close to our impressions of a Romantic ballerina as an image from a lithograph. It is an enormous advantage when dancing a period ballet such as La Sylphide. She was partnered Wednesday evening by Paolo Bortoluzzi in American Ballet Theater's production at the State Theater.

title: Building CaveIn Fatal to 14 Causes Court Fine of $300
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 (Reuters)The builders of a 24story apartment house that collapsed near here March 2, killing 14 workmen, were fined $300 yesterday for using inadequate supports beneath the newly poured concrete floors.

title: Jersey Seeks De Carlo Medical Data
description: TRENTON, July 12  The State Commission of Investigation asked the Federal Bureau of Prisons today to forward copies of all medical records of Angelo De Carlo so the commission can decide whether the 70yearold organizedcrime is too ill to testify.

title: Campaign Aid to Meskill in 1970 From a Dummy Fund inW ashingtonW as Never Reported
description: HARTFORD, July 12  Gov. Thomas J. Meskill's campaign in 1970 received money from a dummy fund in Washington, according to state officials. The contribution was never reported.

title: Ellen Green: Sings Back the 20's and 30's
description: Ellen Green, who, in her dress and demeanor, looks like a Gibson Girl gone delightfully wrong, is having fun with period songs this week at Reno Sweeney, 126 West 13th Street, but without resorting to sheer camp. Despite her appearance, Miss Green concentrates on the nineteentwenties and thirties  the torch songs, the blues and the gangling pop songs of those days.

title: Kite, Harris and Graham Share Lead With 66's
description: ROBINSON, Ill., July 12 (AP)Tom Kite of Austin, Tex., a 23yearold rookie pro, Labron Harris and David Graham of Australia shot fiveunderpar 66's today to share the firstround lead of the $125,000 ShrineRobinson golf open.

title: All McGraw Is the Bride Of Steve McQueen in West
description: CHEYENNE, Wyo., July 12 (AP)All MacGraw, star of the film Love Story, and the actor, Steve McQueen, were married in a city park today by a justice of the peace.

title: Neighbors Fete West Pointer Shunned by Classmates
description: BRENTWOOD, L. I., July 12 Second Lieut. James J. Pelosi, whose graduation from West Point five weeks ago followed 19 months of official ostracism known as the Silence, got a graduation party from his neighbors here last night.

title: TV: Mailer Discusses Death of Marilyn Monroe
description: On a television interview with Mike Wallace this evening, Norman Mailer discusses his new biography of Marilyn Monroe and says that I could not ignore the possibility of a murder.

title: A SYRIAN TANK RAID REPORTED BY ISRAEL
description: TEL AVIV, July 12, (UPI)The Israeli military command said that three Syrian tanks entered the occupied Golan heights of Syria today and fired on Israeli positions for 20 minutes.

title: Kalmbach Sought 72 Gift From Head of Chrysler
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 A few months before Herbert W. Kalmbach, President Nixon's former personal attorney, obtained an illegal corporate contribution of $55,000 from American Airlines, he asked the chairman of the Chrysler Corporation for a major gift to the President's reelection drive, the company disclosed today.

title: 25 Major Chinese Paintings Acquired by the Metropolitan
description: The Metropolitan Museum has acquired 25 important Chinese paintings dating from the 11th to 14th centuries, including 10 formerly in Imperial collections, it was announced yesterday.

title: NIXON CRITICIZES SENATE ON ENVOY
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 The White House said today that the Senate Foreign Relations committee's rejection of President Nixon's nominee as Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian Affairs was deplorable and that the consequences go far beyond the injustice done an outstanding Foreign Service officer.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Text of Statement to Watergate IPanel by Richard Moore, Aide to the President
description: WASHINGTON, July 12Following is the text of statement today by Richard A. Moore, special counsel to the President, before the Senate Select Committee on Presidential Campaign Activities:

title: NIXON CONSENTS TO A MEETING WITH ERVIN ON PLEA TO AVERT CONSTITUTIONAL CRISIS BUT WON'T TESTIFY OR RELEASE DOCUMENTS
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 President Nixon consented today to meet with the chairman of the Senate Watergate committee to discuss the President's refusal to make White House documents available to the Congressional investigators. But a White House spokesman said that Mr. Nixon would not budge from his refusal.WASHINGTON, July 12Following are the texts of a letter from Senator Sara J. Ervin Jr., chairman of the Senate Watergate Committee, to President Nixon, and of a Watergate committee resolution on access to Presidential papers:

title: Colson Revisited
description: WASHINGTONCharles W. Colson, with his faultless ear for the bombastic, is an inevitable focus for popular demonology in the Watergate scandal. But we have a right to expect more than witchhunting from skilled journalists. In their current coverage of Mr. Colson, many in the news media have missed the mark.

title: Nixon and Scheel Discuss Atlantic Ties
description: WASHINGTON, July 12Foreign Minister Walter Scheel of West Germany conferred with President Nixon and his top aides today on what the White House described as the Atlantic relationship.

title: U.S. Jets Give Strong Support In Clashes Near Phnom Penh
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, July 12 (UPI)Heavy fighting was reported today south and west of Phnom Penh, and United States pilots again flew heavy air strikes in support of Government troops.

title: Roundup: Aparicio, 39, Helps Defeat Clyde, 18
description: Luis Aparicio, the 39yearold shortstop of the Boston Red Sox, passed a major league baseball milestone last night, while David Clyde, the heralded 18yearold bonus baby of the Texas Rangers, got another lesson in tile earnest business of professional baseball as Boston beat him, 52.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SUPPORT IN JAPAN HARVARD SEEKING
description: TOKYO, July 12Dr. Edwin O. Reischauer, the Asian scholar and former American Ambassador here, has returned to Tokyo to invite Japanese industry to participate in financing a $15million center for Japanese studies planned Harvard University.

title: Testimony Against Bon Vivant Shaken
description: NEWARK, July 12The lawyer for Bon Vivant Soups, Inc., drew from a key Government witness today the acknowledgment that his testimony yesterday about discrepancies and irregularities In the processing of the company's canned goods might have been inaccurate.

title: Mrs. Mitchell Defers Comments on Hearing
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 (UPI)Mrs. John N. Mitchell, calling from somewhere in the South, said today that she would not comment on her husband's Watergate testimony until it's all over but stood by everything she had said previously. about the scandal.

title: DUPONT GLORE SUES BERNHARD CONCERNS
description: DuPont Glore Forgan, Inc., has filed suit in Manhattan Federal court bcharging Arnold Bernhard & Co., Inc., with ndndisclosure of inside information in connection with duPont Glore Forgan's purchase of 35,000 shares of Jet Air Freight, Inc., common stock.

title: Wottle, Back in Munich, Wins 800 Meters Again
GRAINS ADVANCE ON EXPORT NEWS
description: The Government's report that 10.5 million metric tons of grains and soybeans had been registered for export thus far this season sent those commodities to limit rises yesterday on the big Chicago markets.

title: Nixon Given Support
description: ATLANTA, July 12 (AP)The nation's Young Republicans went on record today in support of President Nixon in the Watergate scandal but urged him to speak out on the case in a forum of his choice.

title: People and Business
description: Bradford Mills, first president of the Overseas Private Investment Corporation, the Government agency that insures American business investors in lessdeveloped countries against such developments as expropriation, has resigned, President Nixon announced yesterday.

title: Levitt Audit to Assail Fees Of School Board Members
description: He also said that at least this portion of the audit was in part prompted by a letter of inquiry by Dr. Kenneth B. Clark, the psychologist, City University professor and member of the Board of Regents, who has called the payments to board members excessive.

title: New Antibiotic Approved For Gonorrhea Treatment
description: SYRACUSE, July 12 (AP)The Food and Drug Administration has approved the use of a singletreatment liquid antibiotic for the early stages of gonorrhea, Bristol Laboratories announced today.

title: Insurance Company Sues
description: CHICAGO, July 12 (AP)One of 10 insurance companies ordered by the state to halt misleading and illegal adverising filed suit in Circuit Court today against the Illinois Department of Insurance. Country Life Insurance is seeking $250000 damages from the department, asserting that the order had damaged the company's reputation.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: The Poor And the Work Ethic
description: What is the difference between the working poor, who are not despised In America, and the welfare poor, who are? Is it that the working poor have jobs? Or that those jobs will lead them inevitably out of poverty? Or that they are motivated by the work ethic while the welfare poor take handouts?

title: Haldeman Denials Contradict Witnesses
description: WASHINGTON, July 12H. R. Haldeman, President Nixon's former chief of staff, has told Senate investigators that he took no part in planning the Watergate burglary and did not know of efforts to block the investigation and cover up the facts until March this year.

title: Slaying to Avenge Holdups Charged to Sonny Carson
description: Robert C. (Sonny) Carson, a Brooklyn black activist, surrendered to the police yesterday in the alleged murder of one man and the attempted murder of another.

title: Agency Says It Captured Major Cocaine Supplier
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 (AP) The Government said today that it had captured one of the biggest cocaine suppliers in the nation with the arrest of Benjamin HerreraZuleta. He was captured in Peru and flown to Miami under police guard.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: White House Agent Linked To Taking of Protest Sign
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 (AP) The Secret Service said today that a White House volunteer, not one of its agents, was responsible for tearing down protest sign during a visit to Pekin, Ill., last month by President Nixon.

title: 4 Poles Fly Atlantic 5 Times In Effort to Find Home Here
description: Four young persons from Poland, including a family of three, have crossed the Atlantic five times since Sunday in a futile search for a country that will permit them to enter.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Cleric Indicted in BribeTaking Case

title: Price Aide Sees Phase 4 Rises
description: WASHINGTON, July 12The Government's chief price monitor warned today that there would be significant price increases, not stability, under Phase 4 of President Nixon's economic stabilization program.

title: Money Growth Rapid
description: Monetary expansion is proceeding at a rapid rate, the Federal Reserve System reported yesterday, while at the same time most shortterm interest rates are continuing to surge upward.

title: KAWAIDA WORK MAY RESUME SOON
description: NEWARK, July 12  Construction of Kawaida Towers, the controversial highrise housing project in this city's North Ward, is expected to resume by the end of the month, Imamu Amiri Baraka said today.

title: People in Sports: A Wire From Hughes
description: Howard Hughes, the billionaire recluse who once was a prominent sportsman, finally was heard from yesterday. Hughess emergence was in the form of a congratulatory telegram sent to 71yearold Gene Sarazan, who scored an ace in the opening round of the British Open in Scotland on Wednesday. Congratulations, you have not changed a bit, read the wire. You are still as good as ever. Your accomplishment refreshed many pleasant memories.

title: Notes on People
description: Manuel Ycaza, the 35yearold, Panamanian jockey, has been appointed Panama's Consul General here. Mr. Ycaza's successful 20year career ended three years ago, after he suffered a fall at Hialeah, although it had been expected until recently that he would try to make a comeback. Asked yesterday how he should be addressed, he shot back, Call me, Mr. Consul General.'

title: Carnegie Panel Bids Middle Class Pay Bigger Share of College Cost
description: The Carnegie Commission on Higher Education recommended, in a report released yesterday, that middleclass families pay a larger portion of the costs of sending their children to college so that the taxsupported education subsidies they now get could be used to increase enrollments of lowincome students.

title: Ii ARE CONVICTED IN NARCOTICS TRIAL
description: A Federal jury convicted 10 New Yorkers and a New Jersey man yesterday of narcotics conspiracy. They were accused of being members of a major ring that supplied heroin and comine to customers in Manhattan and the Bronx.

title: Cam pora Says He Will Resign Today To Open the Way for Peron's Election
description: BUENOS AIRES, Friday, July 13President Hector J. Campora of Argentina announced early today that he and Vice President Vicente Solano Lima would resign later in the morning to pave the way for former dictator Juan D. PerOn's election as president.

title: Jersey Asks U.S. Prisons For De Carlo Health Data
description: TRENTON, July 12  The State Commission of Investigation asked the Federal Bureau of Prisons today to forward copies of all medical records of Angelo De Carlo so the commission can decide whether the 70yearold organizedcrime figure is too ill to testify.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE DELTOID PUMPKIN SEED. By John McPhee. 184 pages. Farrar, Straus & Giroux. $6.95.

title: Prison Guard, a New Czech Film, Is a Grotesquerie
description: PRISON GUARD, directed and written by Ivan Renc; Produced by NovotnyKubala; presented by Filmaco, the Film of America Corporation. At the First Avenue Screening Room, at 61st Street. Running time: 90 minutes. (This film has not been rated.)

title: POVERTY PROGRAMS ARE TRANSFERRED
description: WASHINGTON, July 12All but three programs administered by the Office of Economic Opportunity will be transferred to other Federal departments next month.

title: To Gault, the Jets Camp Is a Site for Sore Eyes
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. L, July 12 Being with the New York Jets, even if it's only to try out for the No. 2 quarterback slot, is like a homecoming for Don Gault in more ways than one.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: HALIFAX, Nova Scotia, July 12 (AP)After nearly 11 hours of waiting while about 70 other boats crossed the finish line yesterday, the crew of La Forza Del Destino was assured of victory in the 360mile MarbleheadtoHalifax yacht race. La Forza crossed the finish line in the mouth of Halifax harbor first Tuesday night. As the other omits allived yesterday morning, it became apparent that adjusted time of 51 hours 18 minutes 24 seconds gave her the Class A championship as well as the overall race title. Unless there are disqualifications or disputes, the Sunapee, N.H., sloop will receive the Halifax Herald trophy tomorrow.

title: Shooting Down the Y
description: America's organized hunters have proved that their fearlessness goes beyond confrontations with deer and ducks. They have taken on, as target of the year, nothing less than the Young Women's Christian Association, which was rash enough at its convention to adopt a resolution favoring a strong Federal guncontrol law.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Quotation of the Day

title: I.R.S. Joins Investigations Into Recording Concerns
description: The Internal Revenue Service has begun a broad investigation of the tax records of recording companies, Justice Department sources said yesterday.

title: Gasoline Prices Raised
description: TORONTO, July 12 (Canadian Press)An increase of one cent a gallon in gasoline prices to dealers in most of Ontario was announced today by Shell Canada Ltd. Ontario communities in the Ottawa River valley are excluded from the increase, which follows a similar announcement last week

title: 25 Major Chinese Paintings Acquired By the Metropolitan
description: The Metropolitan Museum has acquired 25 important Chinese paintings dating from the 11th to 14th centuries, including 10 formerly in Imperial collections, it was announced yesterday.

title: Bridge: Third Member in One Year Resigns From Aces Team
description: America's most famous bridge team, the Aces, seems to be in the doldrums. In the wake of their heavy world championship dereat at the hands of the Italian Blue Teamthe third such defeat on major occasions in an 18month period  comes the news of the third defection frbin the team within a year. Mike Lawrence, a charter member of the team and a world champion in 1971 and 1972, has resigned from the team, following the example of Paul Boloway and Jim Jacoby.

title: SUIT SEEKS TO VOID STERILIZATION LAW
description: The American Civil Liberties Union announced here yesterday that it was filing a suit in Federal District Court seeking to void as unconstitutional North Carolina law allowing sterilization of mentally defective persons.

title: Newark Police Roam Site Of Violence in North Ward
description: NEWARK, July 12Strengthened police patrols tonight roamed the North Ward neighborhood that had been disrupted by violence last night when one youth was shot and critically wounded and others ran through the area breaking windows of homes and cars.

title: Lutheran Meeting Votes to Condemn Seminary Faculty
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 12 (AP)  Another mass protest erupted late today at a National Lutheran convention after it condemned teaching of its leading theological faculty as subversion of the authority of the Bible.

title: Equity Financing
description: A public offering of a million shares of Public Service Electric and Gas Company, Inc. common stock (without nominal or par value) at $22.50 per share was made yesterday by a group led by Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith Inc. Public Service closed at 22, up , on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: NIXON SUFFERING VIRAL PNEUMONIA
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 President Nixon entered Bethesda Naval Hospital tonight, suffering from what his personal physician said was an attack of viral pneumonia.

title: Mrs. Redmond Has Nuptials
description: GLEN COVE, L. I., July 12 Mrs. Anne Martin Redmond of Brookville, daughter of Mrs. Henry Clifford Martin of New York and Shelter Island Heights, was married here this afternoon to I. Townsend Burden Jr. of Locust Valley, son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Burden of New York and Newport, R. I.

title: Fay's Sundance Wins Again
description: LYSEKIL, Sweden, July 12 (AP)Ernest Fay, of Houston sailed his 5.5meter yacht Sundance to victory for the second straight day in the Gold Cup yachting series today.

title: MSGR. FRANCIS SULLIVAN
description: SOUTH AMBOY, N. J., July 12Msgr. Francis J. Sullivan, pastor of St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church here from 1941 until his retirement in 1970, died yesterday in the Oakview Nursing Home in Morgan, His age was 83.

title: Major League Leaders Includes games of July 11.1
description: BATTING

title: Archer's Bribe Conviction Overturned
description: A strongly wordec: decision by the United States Court of Appeals here yesterday reversed the conviction of an assistant district attorney from Queens and two associates who Imre found guilty of taking a $15,000 bribe to fix a criminal case.

title: Weekend Fishing and Boating Outlook
description: Fishing Report

title: SURVIVOR REPORTS FIRE, ABOARD PLANE
description: PARIS, July 12 (Reuters)A steward on the Brazilian airliner that crashed here yesterday, killing 122 people, said today that the pilot had decided to crashland because he was afraid a fire on board would asphyxiate everyone before the plane could reach Orly Airport.

title: Notes on People
description: Nadezhda Pavlova, the 17yearold ballerina from the Soviet Union who has been getting rave notices for her appearances with the Bolshoi Ballet, is returning home before the end of the tour. A spokesman for the Hurok organization, which is sponsoring the company's performances at the Metropolitan Opera House, said that Miss Pavlova, who has appeared at every performance except two, is returning home for rest in order not be overworked.

title: 4 Poles to Get Refugee Hearing
description: Four young Poles who made five transAtlantic air crossings in search of a country that would take them in received permission yesterday to remain here pending hearing on whether they can be given asylum as political refugees.

title: U.S.NowWouldWiden Strategic Trade in East
description: PARIS, July 13 The ad States, which used to be the main force pressing Western Europeans to outlaw a number of items for export to Cornmunist countries on strategic grounds, is now pushing for more exceptions to the banned list.

title: AllStar Balloting
description: NATIONAL LEAGUE

title: People and Business
description: I am a firm believer that gold is the real money that can't be substituted by paper, Representative Philip M. Crane, Republican of Illinois, told a group of New York securities analysts yesterday at a luncheon session at 15 William Street. Mr. Crane, a member of the House Banking and Currency Committee, has introduced legislation to restore the right of United States citizens to hold gold.

title: Cordero Guides 3 Winners Day Before His Suspension
description: Angel Cordero, who starts a fiveday suspension today, left them laughing at Aqueduct yesterday. The happy rider from Puerto Rico registered a triple, and in so doing tightened his hold on first place among the riders at the Big A.

title: Sihanouk to Visit North Korea During Kissinger's China Stay
description: PEKING, July 13 (Reuters)Prince Norodom Sihanouk, the deposed Cambodian head of state, said today that he would leave next week for a threeweek visit to North Korea, and would not meet Henry A. Kissinger, President Nixon's adviser on national security, when he comes to Peking.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: JUDGE DENIES BAIL FOR SONNY CARSON
description: Robert C. (Sonny) Carson, Arooklyn black activist, and four other men were held without bail yesterday in the alleged killing of one man and the attempted murder of another.

title: Football Transactions
description: AMERICAN CONFERENCE

title: Doctors Say Nixon Illness WillCutHis Work by 75%
description: BETHESDA, Md., July 13 President Nixon, still suffering chest pains as a result of viral pneumonia, will be able to carry no more than a quarter of his normal work load for the next few days, doctors attending him reported today.

title: REICHEL LEADS BY 4 IN PUBLIC LINKS GOLF
description: FLANDERS, N. J., July 13Phil Reichel, a 23yearold Minneapolis golfer, extended his lead to four strokes over Gary Hitch today in the third round of the United States public links championship at Flanders Valley Golf Course.

title: SEARCH UNCOVERS 3 YOUNG FUGITIVES
description: BRIDGEPORT, July 13 Bridgeport policemen this morning captured a 14yearold runaway girl and two youngsters who, they said, burst into the juvenile detention center here at gunpoint three days ago and helped her escape.

title: Falconbridge Raises Price
description: Falconbridge Nickel Mines, Ltd. announced in Toronto yesterday that its marketing subsidiary had raised its base price for ferronickel sold in the United States by seven cents, to $1.46 a pound of nickel content. Corresponding price increases for the products were made in all other markets of the world.

title: Table for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New Yorkl
description: Hours are given In Eastern Daylight Time.

title: American League
description: Saturday, July 14, 1973

title: Vast Upheavals Hinted By Midwest Rock Scar
description: Evidence from magnetic, gravity and geologic surveys of the Middle West has persuaded a number of earth scientists that great forces once began to tear the United States apart, initiating what could have developed into an ocean basin between east and west.

title: WINE TALK
description: The resistance to high wine prices seems to be accelerating, with a liquor dealer in Syosset, LI., one of the latest to fall in line.

title: GEORGE GLECKEL
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., July, 13George Gleckel, who retired as New York regional! sales manager of Mohawk Rubber Company in 1972, died today in New Rochelle Hospital. He was 62 years old and lived here.

title: WITNESS ADMITS ON VIVANT CLAIM
description: NEWARK, July 13A United States Department of Agriculture inspection of the Bon Vivant Soup plant showed no objectionable sanitary conditions during the third week in May, 1971, a former Food and Drug Administration inspector testified in Federal District Court here today.

title: GRAIN CONTRACTS ADVANCE SHARPLY
description: Soybean, corn and wheat Icontracts showed sharp gains lyesterday, indicating that traders expect prices for basic foods to rise despite recent Government action to limit rises and despite the expectation of record or nearrecord crops.

title: Finding Belfry Fugitive Stirs Sleepy Town
description: LEESBURG, July 13 (AP)This sleepy little river town is still buzzing with the excitement generated by the discovery of a young fugitive in a church belfry where he said he spent the last two years.

title: Uncertain Trumpets
description: The dollar rallied earlier this week, spurred by reports that the central bank governors, meeting in Basel, had agreed to come to its defense. The United States let it be known that it had increased its arrangements to swap dollars for foreign currencies from $12 billion to $18 billion, but refused to say whether or not the Federal Reserve Bank of New York would or would not actually intervene in markets to support the dollar.

title: Bill Urbanski, Shortstop For Old Boston Braves, Dies
description: PERTH AMBOY, N. J., July 13 (AP)  Bill Urbanski, who played shortstop with the old Boston Braves in the National League during the nineteenthirties, died last night at Perth Amboy Hospital. He was 70 years old.

title: Switch in Party Cost S.I. Chief Naval Post
description: Robert T. Connor, the Staten Island borough President, who recently switched from the Republican to the Democratic party, has resigned his $8,051ayear post as the commanding officer of the New York Naval Militia, the state's naval counterpart of the National Guard. The commander serves at the pleasure of the Governor.

title: Independent Group Rates Cleanliness Of Streets as Guide to Sanitationmen

title: Figure in Macke11Office Inquiry Convicted on a Narcotics Charge
description: A 38yearold insurance agent who had been used as an undercover agent last year in an investigation of the office of former Queens District Attorney Thomas J. MackeII has been found guilty of narcotics charges after a twomonth trial, according to Frank Rogers, a special narcotics prosecutor, who made the announcement yesterday.

description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.In The. Comedy of Errors, the first line belongs to a man being led to the scaffold.

description: CINCINNATI, July 13Possibly provoked over losing the opener of a twilightnight doubleheader to the Cincinnati Reds by a 21 margin, the New: York Mets staged a major uprising in the opening inning of tonight's second game.

title: LT,T IS PUNNING A MICROWAVE NET
description: The International Telephone Ind Telegraph Corporation has Isked the Federal Communicadons Commission for permission to build a microwave communications network between New York, Atlanta and Houston.

title: 1,386 NEEDY YOUTHS ARE ASSURED JOBS
description: TRENTON, July 10 (AP) State Labor Commissioner Ronald M. Heymann has announced that 1,386 underprivileged youngsters would be placed in summer jobs with the help of a new Federal grant of $594344.

title: 110MICIDES HERE UP 10 OVER 72
description: The number of homicides in the city in the first half of 1973 increased by 81, or 10 per cent, over the same months last year, to a new high, according to statistics released by Dr. Milton Helpern, the Chief Medical Examiner.

title: 2 Circuit Judges Confirmed
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 (AP) Two judges for the United States Court of Appeals were confirmed today by the Senate. They are Thomas G. Gee of Texas for the Fifth Circuit and William H. Webster of Missouri for the Eighth Circuit.

title: CommodityPrice Index Off 0.6 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and industrial materials fell to 172.7 from 173.3 last week.

description: Yonkers Raceway Results
