title: U.S. Implanting an Electronic Fence To Shut Mexican Border to Smuggling
description: WASHINGTON, July 13  A complex series of electronic devices, similar in nature to the illfated McNamara line in Vietnam, is being implanted along the 2,000mile border between the United States and Mexico and may be completed as early as mid1974, according to sources in the Border Patrol and Immigration and Naturalization Service.

title: Cambodia Weighs Troop Conscription
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, July 13  The Cambodian Government is considering military conscription for the first time because its system of voluntary recruitment is not replacing fast enough the soldiers it is losing through desertion and casualties.

title: Bergen Court Judge Dismisses Capello Wiretapping Charges
description: HACKENSACK, July 13 (AP)  Wiretap charges against former State Police Superintendent Dominick R. Capello and two others were dismissed today by Bergen County Court Judge Frank C. Galda. However, the iudge ordered a new grand jury inquiry into the case.

title: SHULTZ DISCOUNTS TAX RISE REPORTS
description: WASHINGTON, July 13George P. Shultz, the Secretary of the Treasury, said today that he considered it very unlikely that Phase 4 of the economic stabilization program would include a proposal to Congress to raise taxes.

title: 2 Canadian Utilities Order From Babcock
description: Babcock & Wilcox Canada, Ltd., announced yesterday receipt of orders in excess of $10.5million from two Canadian utilities to supply fossilfueled steam generating units.

title: MOORE SAYS NIXON REGRETTED IN MAY NOT SEEING CLUES
Victory in Sight for a Fallen Dictator on the Road Back
description: In Juan Domingo PerOn, Argentines may soon once again have as their leader the man who was a quintessential dictator. He was at once during his first 12 years of power a fatherly and benign populist, yet also ruthless and arrogant, chilling in his suppression of opposition.

title: Miller Cuts Weiskopfs Lead To One Shot in British Open
BURGUNDIANS FLEE IN TANZANIAN RAID
description: MABANDA, Burundi, July 13 (Agence FrancePresse)Thousands of panicstricken Burundi farmers are fleeing with their families and herds away from the border with Tanzania afterl yesterday's attack by the Tanzanian Army on a military post in which 10 Burundi soldiers were killed and four wounded.

title: Willy Fritsch, 72, Actor, Starred in German Movies
description: HAMBURG, West Germany, July 13 (AP)Willy Fritsch, the movie actor, died yesterday, apparently of heart failure. He was 72 years old.

title: Karachi, a Clean City Once, Is Now a Trough of Urban Squalor
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, July 10 Once Karachi was the cleanest city in the East, with tidy streets. At midday the British drove to beach huts for a swim in the cool Arabian Sea.

title: MONEY DECISIONS DUE IN SEPTEMBER1
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 1High financial officials of the 20 nations negotiating internatibnal monetary reform spelled out their disagreements on major issues today, leaving the necessary compromises to be reached, if possible, by their bosses, the finance ministers.

title: Senate, 6129, Blocks Bid To Delay Alaska Pipeline
description: WASHINGTON, July 13By a vote of 61 to 29, the Senate defeated today a coalition of Midwesterners and environmentalists who had sought to delay licensing of a transAlaska oil pipeline while a Canadian route was studied.

title: Excerpts From Testimony Before the Senate Committee Inquiry Into Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, July 13Following are excerpts from the transcript of testimony today by Richard A. Moore on the 20th day of hearings on the Watergate case before the Senate Select Committee on Presidential Campaign Activities:

title: Break in Truck Assembly Caused L.I.R.R. Derailment
description: The wheels broke away from the truck assembly on a 1927vintage coach and caused the derailment last May 21 of a Long Island Rail Road train near Woodside, Queens, which linjured 38 persons, the railroad said in an official accident report yesterday.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: Foes Are Friends

title: F.D.I.C. LOSES FIGHT TO BLOCK A MERGER
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 13 (UPI)A Federal Court ruled today that the Federal Deposal Insurance Corporation cannot veto bank mergers that meet, antitrust standards.

description: Morning

title: Crime Figure Lays Illegal Deals To Big Banks and Brokers Here
Record Center Fire Checked
description: OVERLAND, Mo., July 13 (AP)  Flames were brought under control again today after consuming millions of service records in a twoday fire on the top floor of the Military Personnel Records Center. More than 200 firemen battled the blaze that started Wednesday night and flared again late yesterday.

title: H.E.W. FORESEES MAJOR SAYINGS
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 The Department of Health, Education and Welfare is expanding a program of cash management that it says could save the Government $51million a year if extended to all states.

title: Waldheim to Visit Mideast In Effort to End Deadlock
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., July 13  Secretary General Waldheim announced today that he would visit the Middle East in an effort to resolve IsraeliArab differences.

title: Democrats Name Press Aide
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 (AP) Vince Clephas, a former radiotelevision newsman, has been named to head press operations of the Democratic National Committee. He will succeed Joe Carter, who resigned to become executive assistant to Gov. David Hall of Oklahoma.

title: DOLLAR ADVANCES ON THE CONTINENT
description: LONDON, July 13 (UPI)The fluctuating American dollar ended the week substantially higher today after five days in which it had often appeared at the mercy of rumors in the money markets of Europe.

title: U. S. Is Blocked From Enforcing Safeguards on Farm Pesticides
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 Me Labor Department said tolay that it was being prevented from enforcing its regulations governing farm use of pesticides that it has determined are dangerous to human beings.

title: Concert
description: A group of his admirers played a concert of Johann Joachim Quantz's music on Thursday evening at Lincoln Center's Library Museum of the Performing Arts in commemoration of the death of the great flutist and good composer. That, as the old wheeze goes, may come as a surprise to many flute players, who didn't even know he was sick. In fact, though Quantz died 200 years ago and is not even a name to most concertgoers, he has always been a flutist's hero, and many of his pieces are the flutist's daily bread.

title: Massage Parlor Bombing Laid to Hodas and 2 Others
description: Martin J. Hodas, reportedly the head of a multimilliondollar pornography operation here who has been closely linked with organized crime, was indicted yesterday charges of firebombing two rival massage parlors in the Times Square area.

description: Margin debt, that barometer of the stock market's vulnerability to accelerating selloffs, continues to offer unpleasant forebodings.

title: Nixon Feeling Discomfort; Full Recovery Is Expected
description: BETHESDA, Md., July 13President Nixon's viral pneumonia is likely to keep him in the hospital and reduce his ability to work for a week or so, his doctors said today, but the probable outlook is for complete recovery.

title: Plea by Mail Is Not Guilty In Death of Paralyzed Man
description: FREEHOLD, July 13  Lester M. Zygmaniak, the 23yearold Perrineville man accused of killing his paralyzed brother in a Neptune hospital last month, pleaded not guilty by mail to a firstdegree murder charge in Superior Court here today.

description: An increasing number of private insurance companies, including some of the nation's largest, have become involved in prepaid group medical practice as owners, managers and financiers.

description: Gilbert and Sullivan fans should relish a new homebcreen series of eight comic operas starting tonight at 9 over WNET/Channel 13. They come, of course, from Britain.

description: The world's largest container crane179 feet high, 90 feet wide and capable of lifting 70 tons on the end of a 100foot boomwas dedicated in Brooklyn by Mayor Lindsay yesterday.

title: Bedford Shatters 10,000 Record By 7.4 Seconds in London Race
description: LONDON, July 13 (AP)Dave Bedford, Britain's biggest flop in the Munich Olympics, broke the world record for the 10,000meter run tonight by imore than seven secondsdespite a hamstring injury tha curtailed his training.

title: Two Former Saints Prefer to Be Men With Jets
description: HEMPSTEAD, LI., July 13 By Sept. 1, when the New York Jets go marching into New Orleans to play a preseason game, they'll have their squad down to 49 players and both Richard Neal and Delles Howell, two former Saints, hope to be in that number.

Presented by American Ballet Theater at the New York State Theater, Lincoln Center.

description: WASHINGTON, July 13 Bell Laboratories believes its control of the carbon dioxide laser, which is widely used in industry, has been strengthened by a patent issued this week.

description: BASEBALL

title: But Ratio of Stockpiles to Sales Is Remaining Relatively Small
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 Total business inventories rose by nearly $2billion in May, the second largest monthly increase during the current expansion of the economy, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Luxury Liner Runs Aground Off an Island in Caribbean
description: LONDON, July 13 (Reuters)Two tugs are assisting a luxury liner that has run aground on a sandbar off the Caribbean Island of Grenada.

title: There Will Be a Delay
description: The 8:20 A.M. out of Old Greenwich had just cleared Rye station and was picking up speed when the brakes grabbed on with a jolt that snapped our heads. Below us sparks flew from the iron wheels. In four car lengths we were at a full stop.

description: HACKENSACK, July 13 (AP)  Wiretap charges against former State Police Superintenden Dominick R. Capello and two others were dismissed today by Bergen County,Court Judge Frank C. Galda. However, the judge ordered a new grand jury inquiry into the case.

description: Senator Jacob K. Javits denied yesterday that he was considering recommending impeachment procedures againsti Federal Judge Mark A. Costantino and said he found, any implication of impeachment highly unfortunate, unfair to Judge Costantino and inappropriate to objective consideration of the matter.

title: In the Spell of John Mitchell
description: When the proposal for President Nixon's China visit was first made nobody told the President.

title: TRAIN FIRE REPORT DISPUTED BY M.T.A.
description: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority said yesterday that the May 29 fire in a computer train in the Park Avenue tunnel was reported to the Fire Department 10 to 12 minutes after it had broken out and not after an alleged delay of 75 minutes.

title: Joy Slater Aboard Winner, RunnerUp In Jumpoff Upstatel
description: LAKE PLACID, N.Y., July 13  Joy Slater, a 19yearold rider from Far Hills, N.J., snapped a badluck streak; today and rode both the winner and secondplace finisher in the amateurowner jumper stake at the Lake Placid horse show.

title: Israeli Government Moves to Dissociate Itself From Jesus Christ Superstar'
description: JERUSALEM, July 13  The Israeli Government moved today to dissociate itself from the film production of Jesus Christ Superstar, the rock opera that has been denounced as antiSemitic by major Jewish organizations in the United States.

title: Loot Recovered in Chase

The chase ended with the shooting of one man and the capture of two others.

title: Watergate, the West German Version, Is Being Handled in a Different Manner
description: TEGERNSEE, West Germany, July 13Tegernsee is a small resort on the northern tip of lake nestled in the Bavarian foothills on the road between Munich and Salzburg. This week, it has been the scene of a German version of the Watergate hearings  but with some revealing differences.

title: MOORE SAYS NIXON REGRETTED IN MAY NOT SEEING CLUES
description: WASHINGTON, July 13President Nixon was deeply trgubled last May that he did not recognize the Watergate coverup earlier, according to a White House official who saw him often throughout the spring.

description: HORSHAM, Pa., July 12 (AP) Sandra Haynie, back on the Ladies Professional Golf Association tour after a week of rest, shot a Threeunderpar 70 today to take the firstround lead in the $30,000 George Washington classic.

description: BATH, England, July 14 (AP)The Soviet Union won the European team chess championships here today, defeating Yugoslavia, the runnerup, by 6 points.

title: Pompidou: Money Man
description: PARISThe latest dollar crisiswhich may or may not be tranquilized by the past week's measurescertainly must be settled if the world is to avert an abrupt and unsupportable financial collapse. And such a collapse, while differing in nature from the 1929 crash, could conceivably have repercussions quite as dangerous.

title: Heart Patient Sits Up
description: RICHMOND, July 13 (AP)George Cavich, 41 years old, who received a heart transplant Tuesday night at the Medical College of Virginia, sat up in a chair in his hospital room today.

title: MURRY S. HERMAN
description: Murry S. Herman, vice president of the Fifth Avenue Jewelers Exchange and president of Murry S. Herman & Son, Inc., of New York and Antwerp, Belgium, diamond jewelry, died Thursday on a visit to Tel Aviv. He lived at 900 Fifth Avenue.

title: France Asks Witteveen To Seek Post at I.M.F.
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 (Reuters) A former Dutch Finance Minister, Dr. Hendrikus Johannes Witteveen, has been formally asked by France to be the European candidate for the post of managing director of the International Monetary Fund, monetary sources said today.

title: Getty Youth Sought in Italy; Ransom Demand Reported
description: ROME, July 13The Italian police began a nationwide search today for J. Paul Getty 3d, 16yearold grandson of the oil billionaire, whose disappearance a few days ago was followed by a request for ransom to his mother in Rome.

title: Sweden's Gold Medal Twins Swim to 2 More at Maccabiah
description: TEL AVIV, July 13 (AP)Anita Zarnowiecki of Sweden achieved her sixth gold medal in six events today as she and a twin brother, Bernt, dominated swimming competition at the ninth Maccabiah Games.

title: MAGAZINE CHARGES PLAN AGAINST M.I.T.
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., July 13 (AP)  The Nixon Administration considered cutting back research grants to Massachusetts Institute of Technology but did not act, according to a magazine article.

description: WASHINGTON, July 13They were all thereor almost all. From Wisconsin, from Colorado, from Utah, they came back.

title: Antiques: Amish Quilts Abound
description: The unraveling thus far of the complex and fascinating story of the quilting phenomenon in this country over the last century will not fully prepare viewers for the exhibition of Amish patchworks that opened here this week.

title: Thailand to Revalue Baht
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 (Reuters)  The International Monetary Fund said today it had agreed to a revaluation by Thailand to take effect on July 15. The currency change will make each Thai baht worth 0.0368331 gram of fine gold or 24.1270 baht per Special Drawing Right.

title: New Charges of Mass Executions in Mozambique Are Made in Rome
description: ROME, July 13New charges that Portuguese armed forces have carried out mass executions and resorted to torture and other violence in Mozambique have been made in a report by a large Roman Catholic missionary order.

description: BOSTON, July 13 (AP) Eleanor Manning O'Connor of Boston and New York, an architect, died yesterday in Mexico City. She was 89 years old.

description: The First National City Bank, the largest bank in New York and a pacesetter in the national banking market, bowed to Government pressure yesterday and kept its prime leading rate at 8 per cent for the week beginning Monday.

title: The winning New Jersey. daily lottery number yesterday was:
More Congressional Power? Some Doubts
description: PRINCETON, N. J.The President, It is often now said, should resign or be impeached. Yet were either of these extraordinary events to occur, Congress would have to exercise more power of its own. And the burden of proving that Congress is up to the task lies with those who urge resignation or impeachmentand also with those who simply wish to see a redress in the balance of government toward the Congress.

title: L. I. Train and Truck Collide; 5 Hurt, Line Out 90 Minutes
description: A Long Island Rail Road train collided with a United States mail tractortrailer truck near the New Hyde Park, L.I., station last night, injuring five persons and shutting down rushhour service on the railroad's main line for 90 minutes.

title: A Country Boy Learns Saigon's Ways
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 13The boy crouched beside the motorbike, his greasy hands skillfully threading wires, tightening bolts, picking just the right wrench from the toolbox, assembling tiny parts with the dexterity of a surgeon. He worked with such concentration that nothing else seemed to exist for him on the busy Saigon streetcorner.

description: MIAMI, July 12 (AP)Dale S. Renault, for 16 years real estate, financial and business editor of The Miami Sun and later SunReporter, died Tuesday of a heart attack. He was 79 years old.

Fusion Power
description: Scientists at Princeton University have announced what appears to be a significant advance toward obtaining useful energy from the thermonuclear, or fusion, reaction that is the basis of the hydrogen bomb. This latest step, which involves using beams of the form heavy hydrogen known as deuterium, has enabled experimenters to come closer to attaining the high pressures and temperatures required. It encourages the conviction that commercially feasible electricity will be generated in the foreseeable future by the fusion of hydrogen ions under controlled, safe and relatively nonpolluting conditions.

title: Planning for the City
description: The Board of Estimate's rejection of Mayor Lindsay's proposed test of the Madison Avenue Mall is a setback to the idea of progressive city planning for the longrange public good. The Lindsay administration has brought many innovative advances in zoning, preservation and urban design to New York City in recent years. The visible result is that new theaters have been built, neighborhood character and quality have been protected, and essential services and amenities provided in areas of speculative construction.

He was referring to his engagement in A Very Rich Woman in 1965, but first class all the way described Ernie.

title: The generation gap was bridged by a bullet
description: On the night of Feb. 27, 1972, Richie Diener was shot to death by his father in the basement of their small house in East Meadow, L. I. Richie was 17 years old. title: Recordings
description: SOME years ago, in study ing employes of a dairy company, psychologists happened on what they called the Hawthorne effect,! for the firm where the phenomenon was isolated. They found that workers responded immediately to change  any change at all, whether perceived by them as good or badwith a spurt in the production. Without wishing to equate the cream of musical artists with dairy workers, one might recognize a similar response by composers to the stimulus of change at many moments in musical history.

title: Miss Blackford Wed To Roger Refshauge

Blackford Jr., and Roger Steven Refshauge, son of Mrs. Elmer Erickson Refshauge were married here at noon today in the Episcopal Church of the Advent by the Rev. Allen Berler Warren.

title: U.S.A to Name National Coaches
description: The United States Olympic Committee, in a series of major policy moves, decided yesterday to appoint national coaches, proposed an arbitration board to resolve the current amateur sports crisis and endorsed the continuation of national anthems and victorystand ceremonies.

title: Coordinator Of Psychology And Asbestos
description: Question: What's a moddressed, shaggyhaired Ph.D. who wears dark glasses doing In a staid, old mining company like the JohnsManville Corporation?

title: Cars Stalled in 900 Heat Jam L. 1. Expressway
description: The Suffolk County police reported massive traffic jams for several hours yesterday on the Long Island Expressway as scores of cars became stalled in 90degree heat.

title: Drag Strip Is for Merchants as Well as Racers
description: ENGLISHTOWN, N.J., July 14Money is the fuel that makes drag racing

title: DWIGHT STONES HIGH JUMPS 75
description: INNSBRUCK, Austria, July 14 (UPI)Dwight Stones, the 19yearold Californian who raised the world high jump record to 7 feet 61/2 inches in Munich, West Germany, this week, won the event in a meet here today with a leap of 75.

title: Mrs. Saltonstall to Be Remarried
description: ITHACA, N. Y., July 14.Mrs. Katharine Durland Saltonstall, an assistant professor of creative writing at Kirkland College in Clinton, and Brian Dewart, owner and operator of food and beverage enterprises here, plan to be married.

title: Rabbi William Maley Dies; Led Houston Congregation
description: HOUSTON, July 14 (UPI)Rabbi William S. Maley, spiritual leader of Congregation Beth Yeshurun, the largest Jewish congregation in the Southwest, died today, apparently of a heart attack, following minor surgery. He was 74 years old.

title: Jane Friedman Sets December Nuptials
description: NORTH WOODMERE, L.I., July 14  Miss Jane Susan Friedman, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Meyer Friedman, plans to be married in December to Joel Heymsfeld, whose mother, Mrs. Earl Marvin of Woodmere, is national president of the National Council of Jewish Women.

title: TOP UNION LEADER ENDORSES PERON
description: BUENOS AIRES, July 14 The most important Argentine labor leader today pledged tradeunion support for the political leadership of the country by former President Juan D. Peron.

title: King Harvest Triumphs
description: PAWTUCKET, R. I., July 14 (AP)King Harvest, ridden by Vince Tartaglia, won the featured $3,700 Exeter race by 3 lengths at Narragansett Park today. King Harvest ran 6 furlongs in 1:12 and paid $6 to win.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: The Metropolitan Life Insurance Company has, because of insufficient tenant response, withdrawn its plan to convert Riverton Houses to a cooperative.

title: What's New in Art
description: In the Galleries

title: Banker Weds Miss Baker
description: BASKING RIDGE, N.J., July 14Miss Katharine Myers Baker, an equestrian, who teaches riding in Lynchburg, Va., was married here this afternoon to Ashby Kandall Sydnor Jr., a vice president and branch manager with the Fidelity Bank of Lynchburg.

title: Couple in Hawaii Hotel After 118 Days in Raft
description: HONOLULU, July 14 (AP) A British couple who spent 118 days in the Pacific on a tiny rubber life raft spent last night on land in an oceanfronting suite at a luxurious Waikiki hotel.

title: John B. Stearns, 79, Dies, Dartmouth Latin Professor
description: HANOVER, N. FL, July 14 Dr. John B. Stearns who retired in 1961 as Daniel Webster Professor of Latin Language and Literature at Dartmouth College died today at his home here. His age was 79.

title: Voice of the Real Fan Is Heard in Bleacherland
description: From row 33, the back row in the centerfield bleachers at Yankee Stadium, you can't see center field. A strip of canvas protects batters from sun glare and blocks the view from 5,000 seats.

title: The Study Of Humor Is No Joke
description: With ingenious experiments, learned analysis and jargon fit for the rarest spheres of learning, academic man is now investigating humor to a faretheewell.

title: Controls as a Way of Life
description: LONDONIn a little less than two years Mr. Nixon's Administration has lurched from a total freeze on prices and incomes (as Phase 1 ended in November, 1971); to what came to be interpreted as a return to complete freedom (as phase 3 began in January, 1973) and back again to the temporary restoration last month of a freeze on prices.

title: Parkway Widening A Test of Patience
description: WOODBRIDGE  Philip May, chief engineer of the Garden State Parkway, is receiving quite a few nasty letters these days, all because a 21mile stretch of the toll road is being widened from three to five lanes in each direction.

title: Polish Gypsies Hold Court as Celebrities
description: Reunited and out of custody less than a day, four young gypsies from Poland found themselves suddenly transformed yesterday from a stateless family rejected by three Countries in three days to instant celebrities, courted by the press and warmly welcomed into the protective extended family that is New York City's gypsy community.

title: Allen Stays on Disabled List
description: CHICAGO, July 14 (AP)Dick Allen, who was eligible to get off the disabled list and rejoin the Chicago White Sox today, might not return to action until after the AllStar break.

title: Along the Straw Hat Trail
description: NEW YORK CITY

title: Nome Improvement
description: CONTEMPORARY styled and ranch type homes with natural finish exterior siding or shingles are quite popular in many areas, but maintaining the outside of these houses has proven a headache for some homeowners  either because the wrong kind of finish has been applied, or because they wait so long between applications that in some cases the only way to restore the original beauty of the natural wood is to strip everything off and then start all over again.

title: Yacht Owned by Sinatra Hit by Fire Off Catalina
description: AVALON, Calif., July 14 (AP) An 85foot yacht owned by Frank Sinatra suffered a fire off the coast of Catalina Island today. The six persons aboard were uninjured, and the singer was not aboard, the authorities said.

title: Smog, $12.60 W ins $100,000 Cane Pace
description: YONKERS july 14 While Stanley Dancer listened on special telephone hookup to his home at New Egypt, N. J., his brother, Vernon Dancer, won the $100,000 Cane Pace tonight with Smog at Yonkers Race. way.

title: SPRINGER SPANIEL TAKES BEST IN SHOW
Mary Storer Fishier Married To HarveyFisk in Bay State
description: DENNIS, Mass., July 14Miss Mary Storer Fishier, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bennett Hill Fishier Jr. of Ridgewood, N. J., was married here at noon today in the garden of the Fishler's summer home to Harvey Rawlinson Fisk of West Haven, Conn. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Pliny Fisk Jr. of CrotononHudson, N. Y.

title: Dance: In Limon's Steps
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., July 14After Jose Lim6n died last September, his shaken company faced an uncertain future, but chose to survive rather than disband. At first it functioned as a collective, but this weekend at Connecticut College's American Dance Festival it was announced that Ruth Currier, his longtime dance associate, had been appointed the new artistic director. It is an exceedingly good choice, and logical that it should be announced festival time.

title: State Police Artist: Man of 800 Faces
description: TRENTON (AP)  In George Homa's hands, the pencil has proved a useful weapon in the capture of criminal suspects.

title: Prime Minister of Sri Lanka Takes on 2 More Positions
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka, July 14 (Reuters)  Mrs. Sirimavo Bandaranaike Prime Minister of Sri Lanka, who is also Minister of Defense and External Affairs, has taken full responsibility for the country's economic affairs when she assumed charge of two new portfolios.

title: 2 TeenAgers Kill Bronx Man As He Sits With Wife in Park
description: Two teenagers shot and killed a 28yearold man while he was sitting with his wife on a bench in Claremont Park in the.Bronx Friday night, the police reported.

title: COSMOS TIE ATOMS ON FINK'S GOAL, 11
description: HEMPSTEAD, LI., July 14The New York Cosmos outshot the firstplace Philadelphia Atoms, 3220, tonight at Hofstra Stadium before 6,100 fans, but salvaged only a 11 tie in North American Soccer League action.

title: Homosexual London Guide
description: LONDON, July 14 (Reuters)A free tourist guide that caters for young homosexuals and gives advice on venereal disease and unwanted pregnancies has been backed by the London Tourist Board. The guide, which tells homosexuals where to get details about social events in the city, was compiled by a youth advice center for young people.

title: Iraqi Says He'd Welcome Better Reiations With U.S.
description: Iraq's leftwing Government said today that the security America's oil supplies from Middle East would be better served by developing BAGHDAD, Iraq, July 13 The leading political figure in ]relations with Arab producers than by arming Israel and Iran.

title: First They Fly, Then They Play Polo on Burros
description: CABO SAN LUCAS, Mexico  It is 5:15 P.M., and at the tip of Baja California, on the beach at Cabo San Luca, a bunch of what the natives might well call Crazy Americans are playing burro polo.

title: the traveler's world
description: Confounding the West Virginia Cliches

title: City Says a Fare Rise Could Ruin Its Economy
description: Richard Lewisohn, the city's Finance Administrator, said yesterday that the city's economic posture had improved in the last year, but that New York could shrivel up economically if the 35cent transit fare was not retained.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: GOLD CLOSED IN LONDON at $121 an ounce Friday after a week of fluctuating prices. The high for the week was $126 on Monday. The Federal Reserve Board has increased its swap credit lines with other central banks, under which it can borrow foreign currencies to defend the dollar, to $18billion, an increase of more than 50 per cent.

title: Black Pragmatism
description: ATLANTAThe National Association for the Advancement of Colored People, in the past, has beaten back with relative ease internal challenges to its authority and principles simply by isolating the rebellious leaders.

title: The Oil Majors
description: WASHINGTONThe oil industry, under attack in recent weeks because of the nation's fuel shortage, was set upon from several directions last week. At the heart of the developments were these questions: Have the big oil companies been competing or cooperating? Have their business practices contributed to the fuel shortage? These were the developments:

title: West Coast Scout Takes $114,300 Haskell Again
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., July 14 Ralph C. Wilson Jr., who owns the Buffalo Bills of the National Football League, also owns West Coast Scout, a 5yearold dark brown horse who obviously enjoys running at Monmouth Park.

title: New Jersey Calendar of Events
description: THEATER

title: Imported Capital
description: LOS ANGELESMore and more foreign corporations are Implementing longterm strategies designed to turn toeholds in the United States into solid American  based operations.

title: Dog Show Calendar
description: TodayTwin Brooks K.C. allbreed, The Mall, Route 24 and John F. Kennedy Parkway, Short Hills, N.J. 1,227 dogs; 9 A.M.

title: AFTER THE PARTY, BEDFORD IS LOSER
description: LONDON, July 14 (AP) Dave Bedford, looking tired and harassed after smashing the world 10,000meter record last night, lost his British 5,000meter title today. Brendan Foster, a 1,500meter man, won the 5,000 meters in 13 minutes 23.6 seconds at the British Amateur Athletic Association championships at Crystal Palace.

title: When Lawyers Strike
description: New York City's Legal Aid Society lawyers have ended their unique strike an4 gone back to work, pending completion of a detailed new contract. The net result is that needy people ought to get somewhat better legal services, which both sides in the strike conceded that they needed.

title: Verdant Venture
description: TACOMA, Wash.  Money doesn't grow on trees, usually. But it does for the Weyerhaeuser Company, the nation's largest private owner of timberlands. This corporation's growth in 1973 is so explosive that it's passing everyone else in the field.

title: Shark Scare Keeps Italians Ashore,Worsening Beach Crowding
description: ROME, July 14With the main vacation seaon getting under way, Italians are being told, hardly to their surprise, that theirs are among the world's most crowded beaches.

title: Penderecki Catches Conducting Bug
description: WHY on earth would one of the most remarkably successful young composers in the world  offered more commissions than he can accept, sought after by conservatories and universities, weighted with honors at home and abroad, and married to the world's most beautiful nuclear physicist  decide he wants to be a conductor?

title: Child Born to Mrs. Doft
description: A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Alan Doft on July 4 in Mount Sinai Hospital. Mrs. Doft is the former Miss Elisabeth Hoffman of Fairfield, Conn. The child has been named Rachel Alison. Mr. Doft is founder and president or Doft & Co., Inc., investment bankers and members of the New York Stock Exchange.

title: That is the land of lost content, I see it shining plain
description: All city people carry idyllic visions of the country in their heads: thick woods, clean air, sweet birds, cool streams; we babble of green fields in our dreams. It is strange to wake up in the real countryside, whose fields are being broken up, engrossed or subdivided from day dayfor shopping malls or strip mines, for tract housing or I.B.M. campuses, for country clubsand to find that while we are sad to see our lovely refuge ravaged, the natives of the place are grimly glad, for this ugly development is their only alternative to picturesque starvation. Not quitethere is one other choice, and their children are taking it to leave the land, and head for the cities, crossing paths with those of us who flee.

title: Pompidou: Statesman
description: PARISUnder both Presidents de Gaulle and Pompidou, the Fifth Republic's foreign policy has been directed from the Elyse Palace and, on all important issues, personally supervised by the President. Pompidou even went so far as to install his Kissinger, Michel Jobert, as Foreign Minister.

title: Stamps
description: HIS is the time of year when full bloom is over the land, and the time of year when stamps seem in full bloom. The Netherlands, where flowers mean not only beau

title: Midsummer
description: In one sense, midJuly is midsummer. Now the orange flowers come to bloom, the hot colors of the tropics, the blackeyed Susans, the orange hawkweed, the day lilies. Now the chicory shows its skyblue flowers on gray stems in waste places. Milkweed comes to bloom and the white froth of Queen Anne's lace appears.

title: A Lawyer Urges Computerized Court Scheduling
description: TRENTON  Theodore S. Meth, head of a new organization promoting judicial reform, believes that the New Jersey court system should be run more like an airline.

title: Weatherly Takes Lead In ChicagoMackinac Sail
description: CHICAGO, July 14 (AP)A fleet of 207 got off to a slow start today in the 66th ChicagotoMackinac Island yacht race.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The article Welfare Housing Plan Falls Short of Goal [July 1] quotes city officials, especially Real Estate Commissioner Ira Duchan, to the effect that small neighborhood (read black and Spanishspeaking) contractors are to blame for the delays in implementing the program. I take exception to that position.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: In 1966, Robert Lekachman published The Age of Keynes. The economist announced the triumph of Lord Keynes's ideaa generation after his deaththat government economic policy had finally tamed the sad cycle of boom and bust.

title: Smith and Oran tes Advance to Final of $75 000 Swedish Tennis Tournament
description: BAASTAD, Sweden, July 14 (AP) Stan Smith, the topseeded player, and Manuel Orantes of Spain, the defending champion, ousted local favorites today to move into the final of the $75,000 Swedish international tennis championship.

title: MISS HAYNIE SETS PACE BY A STROKE
description: HORSHAM, Pa., July 14 (AP) Sandra Haynie carded a oneunderpar 72 today that enabled her to maintain a onestroke lead over Debbie Austin with a 142 total in the $30,000 George Washington Golf Classic.

title: Met Games This Week
description: TodayAt Cincinnati.

title: Walker Gets Kansas Post
description: LAWRENCE, Kan., July 14 (AP)Clyde L. Walker, 43 years old, assistant athletic director at North Carolina, has been named athletic director at the University of Kansas. He succeeds Wade Stinson, who resigned last year.

title: Yale Teacher Who Returned to China For Visit Finds Avid Interest in U.S.
description: A Yale University teacher of Chinese origin who recently returned from a 50day visit tO his homeland, reports that people there, from high Government and party officials to lowly villagers, are showing lively curiosity about all aspects of life in the United States.

title: Stein gut Ridicules State Plan for Consumer Unit
description: ALBANY, July 14Governor Rockefeller's proposal to create a new consumer agency was described today as a cosmetic attempt to pacify the housewife by Stanley Steingut, the Assembly minority; leader.

title: Odes to Snowy Peaks Irk a Soviet Official
description: MOSCOW, July 14The Soviet Union's Communist rulers have discovered a new contender for the political loyalty of the peoplethe towering, snowcapped peaks of Central Asia.

title: Who Makes Music And Where
description: NEW YORK PHILHARMONIC CONCERTS IN THE PARKS

title: A Bureaucratic Welcome to Afghanistan
description: THIS place isn't disorganized, said a young American recently, as he waited to cross into Afghanistan. I'll bet these people actually sat down and tried to figure out the most irrational possible way of doing this. I mean it; they must have planned it all out.

title: Sunday Observer
description: This is in defense of zeal, Madison Avenue, short hair and Southern California. It is not a spirited defense. How could it be? It is no pleasure defending Madison Avenue. One rises in court depressingly aware that it is Madison Avenue that has committed commercial television in the first degree.

title: Numismatics
description: WESTERN RESIDENT collectors interested in Canadiam get their innings this year; the annual convention of the Canadian Numismatic Association is being held in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. It opens its fourday run this Thursday in the Sheraton Cavalier Motor Inn.

title: Boynton S. Voorhees, 87, Dies; ExOfficer of New York Central
description: YONKERS, July 14Boynton S. Voorhees, a former vice president of the New York Central System, died today in St. John's Riverside Hospital. He was 87 years old and lived here.

title: A Cup of Rice Is Enough, Filipinos Are Instructed
description: MANILA, July 14Rice is in short supply here in the Philippines, as in many other places in the world, and the Government has begun an imaginative and forceful campaign to conserve supplies and to distribute them properly.

title: Television
description: IT'S the season of the doldrums. Tedium, a clear and present danger at any moment the television year, creeps freely across glazed eyeballs. Confronted with reruns of programs he couldn't tolerate the first time around, the critic stumbles off to screenings of the pitifully few new series being given summer tryouts, only to find that most of them are indeed pitiful. Except for the Senate Watergate hearings, which are almost insidiously mesmerizing, the TV screen might profitably, at least in terms of the viewer, be left dark.

title: Miss Ender, 14, Sets Another Swim Mark
description: BERLIN, July 14 (AP)Kornelia Ender, 14yearold East German, set a world swimming record in the 100meter butterfly today, the East German news agency ADN reported. Her time, at the East German championships in East Berlin, was 1 minute 2.31 seconds. She held the previous record of 1:03.05, set last April.

title: Where Family Trees Grow
description: MORRISTOWN  If your family tree has deep roots, you might find them here.

title: WALL STREET
description: Despite the recent decline in the stock market, bank stocks have managed to turn in a relatively good performance.

title: DIETZ AGAIN WINS U.S. SCULLS TITLE
Headliners
description: Refuge in the Church

title: A Chicken Dinner Cost 3c Less to Make in May
description: The cost of preparing chicken dinner  appetizer, salad, vegetables, bread and butter, dessert and beverage for a family of four in the New Yorknortheastern New Jersey area declined by cents in May to $5.16 after setting record highs for four consecutive months.

title: The Slugger in Front of Aaron Is Evans
description: Overshadowed by Hank Aaron's determined pursuit of Babe Ruth's career home run record is the emergence of Darrell Evans as one of the most promising young sluggers in major league baseball.

title: Chess: Experimenter Finds Lightning Strikes (at Least Him) Twice
description: After his undistinguished seventheighth place tie with Ricardo Calvo in the Las Palmas International Tournament, Lubomir Kavalek, the American grandmaster, got back on his game to capture a convincing first prize in a second event the Grand Canaries organizers held in Arrecite. Perhaps Kavalek, who has lately not been following as hectic a toupey schedule as is customiry for him, needed the first competition as a tuneup for his success In the second.

title: The tripping of the Presidency, 1972
description: As the National Correspondent for Rolling Stone magazine, Hunter Thompsonauthor of the celebrated sixties drug  scene book Fear and Loathing in Las Vegascovered the entire 1972 Presidential campaign. He has now enlarged his articles into a book that is the best account yet published of what it feels like to be out there in the middle of the American political process. Fear and Loathing runs month by month from December, 1971, when Thompson began campaign coverage in Washington, through the Democratic primaries, both conventions and on past the election. His book is mixture of personal narrative.

title: Chinese Place Restrictions on a Regional Language
description: PEKING, July 14There are more Chuang people in the world than there are Danes Swiss, but their language is not taught in schools and is seen writing mainly on public signs and banknotes.

title: The New Judges
description: Whatever else can be said about Nelson Rockefeller, no one can accuse him of thinking small. Such grand designs as the Albany Mall and the World Trade Center have transcended the criticism of opponents who saw disaster in their imperial dimensions. So there was a certain consistency of performance that when Governor Rockefeller finally soured on his soft approach to the drug problem, he devised the most ambitious narcotics law on the books of any state in the Union.

description: ART

title: Dave Anderson
description: He's deaf. But once that's understood, It doesn't seem to make much difference. More important, Bonnie Sloan is 6 feet 5 inches, 262 pounds and quick. He's a 25yearold rookie defensive tackle from Austin Peay who was chosen by the St. Louis Cardinals in the 10th round of the National Football League draft. Tuesday morning he will drive his new camper from his home in Nashville to the Cardinals training camp at Normal, Ill., a 400mile trip. The son of a truck driver, he skis, he hunts, he fishes, he dates. He's

title: Patriots Nursing a Talent So Raw He Can't Get Started
description: AMHERST, Mass., July 14 He grew up in what he calls The City, Hollandale, Miss., population 5,000 and near Greenville. His college was Alcorn Agricultural and Mechanical, an allblack institution down at Lorman, Miss. His prior exposure to whites was limited, and to the economic and technological aspects of a society directed by whites that is next to nothing.

title: Weiskopf's 276 Wins Open by Three Shots
Child Psychiatrist Arrested 2d Time On Morals Charge
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., July 14A Suffolk County child psychiatrist who was arrested and charged with child abuse last month was arrested on a similar charge yesterday.

title: Heroin Addiction Seen Leveling Off in Jersey
description: The head of New Jersey's drugcontrol programs said yesterday that the use of heroin in that state seemed to be leveling off, although the use of other narcotics seemed to be on the rise.

title: A Day of Small Smiles, and Tears
description: PTH WOODMERE, L. I. We're women's libbers or male chauvinists, depending on which way you look at it, said Thomas Duffy, director of North Woodmere Park, when asked why his staff decided to hold a bathing beauty contest for 3to7yearold girls.

title: SilkScreen Show Opening in Orange
description: ORANGE.  Asi exhibition devoted to the silk screen, a distlectively 20th century graphic arts form, goes on view tomorrow at the Orange Public Library.

title: Nation Dependent on Cars Is Resentful Of Curbs Planned as Pollution Check
description: LEXINGTON, Mass., July 14High up on the flagpole down on Lexington Green, 1.4 miles from the old grayshingle house where Toni and Dolores Tansey live with their four children and a huge cat named Mrs. O'Malley, there is a sign commemorating the shot heard round the world. Birthplace of American Liberty, it reads.

title: Mets Records
description: BATTING

title: Geographical Society Names New Director
description: Dr. Robert B. McNee has been named director of the American Geographical Society.

title: Nixon and Ervin Will Quote Each Other As Precedents on Constitutional Law
description: WASHINGTON, July 14President Nixon and Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr. are planning to use each other's past statements as legal weapons at their forthcoming confrontation over the issue of the President's cooperation with the Watergate inquiry.

title: Pope Receives Pakistani
description: ROME, July 14 (UPI)Pope Paul VI received President Zulfikar Ali Bhutto of Pakistan today in a private audience, the Vatican said. Later. the Pope left the Vatican for his summer holiday at Castelgandolfo, southeast of Rome.

title: MOVE ON TO SAVE SITES IN EUROPE
description: ZURICH, Switzerland, July 8 A rescue operation to save the face of Europe has been launched here, with representatives of 30 countries meeting to awaken the interest and pride of citizens in a common architectural heritage that transcends all national frontiers..

title: Aged to Give It College Try
description: MADISONWhen the fall semester begins at Fairleigh Dickinson University, 75yearold Arend Drost and nearly 80 other elderly students will be enrolled in a tuitionfree program that allows them to take seats in classes not filled by younger students.

title: ABORTION CLINICS WIN LEGAL POINT
description: The state's highest court has found unconstitutional a provt sion of the Public Health Law that the state had used to close down a number of abortion clinics in the three years since abortion became legal here.

title: Tenants in Newark Battle the Pushers
description: NEWARK  Residents of the huge Stella Wright public housing project, contending that the police have done little to combat a growing drug problem there, have mounted a concerted attack of their own on narcotics pushers.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2.

title: Environmental Plan Questioned on L.I.
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I.  The proposed New York State Environmental Plan  a guideline for air, land and water use that if implemented would affect the quality of life of state residents for the next generation  was received with guarded approval this week at hearings in Nassau and Suffolk.

title: Mail.Truck Driver Seized In CommuterTrain Crash
description: NEW HYDE PARK, L. I., July 14 (AP)The driver of a United States mail truck struck at grade crossing by a commuter train has been arrested on charge of driving while intoxicated, the Nassau County police said today.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Major Events of the DaySection

title: SYNOD DEFROCKS 3 CYPRUS BISHOPS
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, July 14 (AP)The Major Synod of the Orthodox Church today defrocked three dissident Cyprus bishops who had pronounced the defrocking of Archbishop Makarios, the President of Cyprus.

title: Child Born to the Ends
description: A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Malcolm End of CrotononHudson, N. Y., on July 6 at the Phelps Memorial Hospital in Tarrytown, N. Y. The child, the couple's second daughter, has been named Susanne Rachel. Mrs. End is the former Miss Andrea Moss, daughter of the actor Arnold Moss and Mrs. Moss of New York. Mr. End is art director at Ogilvy & Mather, Inc.

title: Strike by Liquor Store Clerks Makes Pennsylvania Dry State
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 14 Pennsylvania was a dry state this weekend, with all 750 state liquor stores closed by a strike of 3,000 clerks that spread from the Philadelphia area to the western part of the state during the week.

title: Nancy Ranney And David Levi Wed in Illinois
description: LAKE FOREST, III., July 14  Miss Nancy Ryerson Ranney and David F. Levi, son of Dr. Edward H. Levi, president of the University of Chicago, and Mrs. Levi of Chicago, were married here this afternoon.

title: Women Jaycees Opposed
description: TULSA, Okla., July 14 (AP)Richard W. Clayton Jr. of Abilene, Tex., the new president of the U.S. Jaycees, said Tuesday he was strongly opposed to the admission of women to the organization. The Rochester Jaycee chapter has filed a suit against the national group for suspending the chapter because it admitted women. The suit was dismissed two weeks ago, but an appeal is planned.

title: 66 Nursing Homes Denied Medicaid
description: Sixtysix upstate nursing homes have been removed from the Medicaid program for noncompliance with Federal safety and health standards as a result of State Department of Social Services actions so far this year.

title: DODGERS WIN, 73; LEAD BY 7 GAMES
Ensemble Dares Europe to Love Them
description: ACCORDING to Arthur Weisberg, conductor of the Contemporary Chamber Ensemble, the modern American composers best known in Europe are the three C'sCopland, Carter and Cage. Continental audiences hear isolated examples of what is being composed in our country today, performed by the smaller touring American ensembles and soloists as part of largely standard programs. Weisberg has played frequently throughout Europe as bassoonist with such enis talking about. Now, in his more famous role as founderconductor of the Contemporary Chamber Ensemble, he will take it on its first tour of Europe for five weeks beginning Aug. 21, hoping to add to that continent's knowledge of today's American music.

title: RACE WEEK BEGINS WITH 262 YACHTS
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., July 14 Larchmont Yacht Club's Race Week got off to one of the finest starts in its 75year history today. The wind, a solid 1015 knots from the westsouthwest, enabled Donald B. King, the regatta chairman, to set substantial courses on Long Island Sound for the fleet of 252.

title: Lisa Forman Engaged
description: Mr, and Mrs. Frederick Forman have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Lisa Forman, to Ira Stern, son of Mr. and Mrs, Maurice Stern, Both families are of New York. The couple are seniors at C. W. Post College of Long Island University.

title: BUILDING CHANGES PEKING'S SKYLINE
description: PEKING, July 14Teams of hundreds of men and women are pressing ahead all over Peking with building projects that are rapidly changing the face of the ancient capital. Some projects also appear to be threatening the charm of older sections.

title: Cooking Ecosysternatically
description: YAPHANK, L. I.  Mrs. Rdger Moreland has the pioneer spirit and her 1862 frmhouse surrounded by fields in the middle of Suffolk county offers the appropriate setting.

title: Big (Wheat) Deal; It Looked Good, but Went Bad; The Nation
description: WASHINGTONThe picture drawn by the General Accounting Office, an investigative arm of Congress, was hardly one to enhance the country's reputation for shrewd Yankee trading.

title: The second inventor of sociology
description: The science of sociology was invented at least twice, once in the middle of the 19th century by Auguste Comte, who gave it its name by combining the Latin term societas with the Greek logos, and once, half a century later, by Emile Durkheim. It is to Durkheim that modern sociology likes to trace its roots, and with good reason, for it was Durkheim who, in 1893 produced the first major sociological work employing a rigorously scientific methodology; it was Durkheim who two years later wrote the definitive defense of the status of sociology as a science; and it was Durkheim who, almost singlehandedly, first established sociology as an independent academic discipline.

Looking back, it is hard to figure out why we had to wait until now for biographies of accomplished women that are not patronizing, or stories one could offer a child without the sense of being implicated in a sexist plot.

It appears to be a worrisome throwback to 1966 and 1969, when the nation last endured similar economic conditions. Both periods were traumatic ones in the nation's history, but the economy, fortunately, managed to escape without any grave consequences each time.

title: In Cold Print: The Case of the Rosenberg Case
description: Louis Nizer, celebrated attorney and author of the bestseller, The Implosion Conspiracy, is under legal attack. First, there are the Rosenberg children (now in their 20's), who charge that among other things his book quotes without permission from copyrighted letters written by their parents, Julius and Ethel Rosenberg, executed as atom spies. The children, who claim to hold copyright to the letters, are asking $3 million in damages from Nizer and Doubleday & Co., the book's publishers.

title: The Decisive Stage
description: The Senate investigation into the Watergate scandals, and particularly into the degree of participation of President Nixon and his senior aides, is moving nearer to the decisive stage. President Nixon's attack of viral pneumonia may retard the evolution of events slightly, but his illness has fortunately responded to treatment and rest for which the nation is grateful. Political friends and foes alike will wish him a speedy recovery.

title: One of the Most Impotant Archeological Digs in America

What brings travelers to this remote cornfield 45 miles north of St. Louis and 270 miles southwest of Chicago is not just the promise of few gulps of fresh country air but much more fundamental urge that might best be described as man's craving to understand his stillmysterious origins.

Pancake performed the Presbyterian ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Philip Vincent Cianci. The bridegroom is the son of Mrs. Cleopatra Finch of Walden, N. Y., and the late Charles Finch of Fort Lauderdale, Fla.

title: Progress Brings Ramsey Inevitable Problems

For this borough of 5.6 square miles has tried to retain its rural character despite a rapid rise in housing, shopping centers and professional buildings.

title: Milan's Homer Caps 3Run 9th Against Reds
L.I. Gets Big Slice Of Judgeship Pie
description: A huge array of new judgeships is about to be unveiled in the state, and the Long Island suburbs will come off as perhaps the most generously robed of all areas.

title: A Record 1,534 in Putnam Show
description: Devoted to Man's Best Friend is the motto on the Putnam Kennel Club's emblem. That's what we are striving to do, said Mrs. Lowell Odaniell, the organization's president. So this year we are trying to get the bench and field trial people together. In almost all of the sporting breeds and in beagles, bassets and dachshunds, among the hounds, we are having special classes for field trial dogs and bitches. We feel too few of the breeds have dual performers. Perhaps some other clubs will follow our lead and that field trialers will have their dogs compete against the bench variety. Then we may get some of the bench dogs to News of Dogs

title: 111S. TRACK SQUAD BEATS GERMANS
description: HEIDENHEIM, West Germany, July 14 (AP)The United States junior track and field team, sparked by a world recordtying performance by its men's 400meter relay team, scored an impressive victory today over West Germany on the first stop during the first trip abroad by an American junior squad.

title: New Camera, Enlarging Accessory and Photo Tour
description: KONICA, Camera Corporation, 2520 BrooklynQueens Expressway West, Woodside, N.Y. 11377, who pioneered the concept of professional quality automatic exposure single lens reflex cameras when it introduced the first Autoreflex 35mm SLR in 1966, has just introduced the fourth generation of that camera with a new model called the T3. Offering, as did their previous models, a choice of automatic aperture control (after the shutter speed is selected), matchneedle control or manual control, this new model also contains several interesting new features. In the eyes of many advocates of automatic SLR's, one of the most significant improvements is in the newly designed shutter release mechanism which requires much less finger pressure, and a much shorter stroke, than cording to the manufacturer, its 300 gram pressure and 2mm of total travel Is less than all other automatics and most nonautomatics on the market.

title: Phase 4
description: WASHINGTON  Consumers received some advance notice from the Government last week: while the forthcoming Phase 4 will include a system of price controls, there will be significant price increases as soon as Phase 4 begins and the current period of freeze ends.

title: The Latin Generals
description: As recently as 1960, Uruguay was a showcase of democracy, with a vigorous twoparty system modeled partly on that of the United States and military as uninvolved in government as the armies of Denmark or Switzerland. Now Uruguay's elected President has closed down Congress, put an end to constitutional rule and inaugurated a militarycontrolled regime.

title: From Portugal via Rhode Island
description: Freshly caught fish is a bonus for weekenders and vacationers at the shore, especially if yearround residents can be persuaded to share their recipes. In several coastal areas of New England, especially at the eastern end of Cape Cod, in eastern Connecticut and Rhode Island, cooks with Portuguese and Italian ancestry use Old World ways to prepare the local catch. Mrs. Emma Amaral of Providence, R. I., buys white fish caught off Block Island to make a typical Portuguese dish of fried fish in a saffronvinegar sauce, but city dwellers can buy cod, haddock or flounder fillets  whichever is readily available at their neighborhood fish market.

title: BENGALIS Di CAMPS HOPE TO GO HOME
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan, July 14 (UPI)Anwar Hussein Khan was once a top civil service officer for Pakistan. Now he and his family are in a detention camp.

description: ROSLYN, LI., July 14Miss Lesley Louise Murphy, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William G. Murphy of East Hills, was married here today to James Jay Lee, son of Mr. and Mrs. William O'Donnell Lee of Moberly, Mo. The ceremony was performed in St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Joseph Keane of the Immaculate Conception Seminary in Douglaston, Queens, and the Rev. Arthur Landolt, pastor of the First Christian Church in Moberly.

title: TRANSIT PLEA LOST BY CITY AND STATE

title: Indian Schools; Is Ego Boosting Enough?; Education

Unlike nearly all other Indians in America, the people of Ramah manage and control their own high school, through a sevenperson, allNavajo school board and a staff threefourths of whom are Navajos.

title: Kicki ng the sanctity of baseball
description: The image sticks in the mind as if it had been slammed into place by a jackhammer. The chartered airliner is bringing the champions of baseball's tight little universe home from their final World Series victory in Cincinnati. A jazz ensemble made up of union musicians with tired eyes and parched lips is tootling up and down the aisle, making false enthusiasm at the insistence of Charles 0. Finley, insurance broker, gentleman farmer and practicing autocrat. He marches down the aisle and across the midnight sky at the head of retinue like a grand duke. He is the owner and sole operator of the Oakland Athletics and he will not stop celebrating what he considers to be personal victory. His fellow celebrators long ago caved in. But they are largely unimportant. Charles O. Finley gathered them together and Charles 0. Finley can disperse them. Here and there wives of the players nestle in seats, victims of too much

title: EXTRADITION AS STIRS BERLINE1
description: BERLIN, July 14  A fur has been touched off in tl press and among the We Berlin public: over the fate a refugee who faces being turned to East German to stand trial there for a crime committed in the East. If the extradition is carried out will be the first such instanc since the Berlin wall went u 12 years ago.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT

title: Inquiries Into Nixon's Reelection Funds Turning Up a Pattern of High Pressure

title: Suppose the Colonies had not revolted. Would slavery have lasted? Would Elizabeth 2d have stood for Watergate?
description: While making elaborate plans to celebrate the bicentennial of the birth of this Republic it might not be amiss to wonder what might have been, had our glorious Revolution never taken place. What if the colonies had not revolted? What if Washington, Franklin, Adams, Hamilton and the rest had remained faithful subjects of the King, grumbling about taxes over their tea perhaps but loyally drinking the King's health with their wine? What then? Our American heritage would be quite different, of course, but would it be worse?

title: He Sings the Joy He Has in Living
description: Welcome to my morning.

title: The Small Spender's (And Late Starter's) Paris Hotel Guide
description: pARISIf you can spend $75 a day without wincing, you shouldn't have much trouble finding a hotel room here this summer. But if you happen to be traveling on a tight budget, made even more modest than you may have anticipated by inflation in France and devaluation of the dollar, you've got problems. You'll find Paris one of the most expensive cities in the world. And, to make matter's worse, by now the majority of the reasonably priced hotels in this city listed in the Guide Michelin are booked solid for the summer. That's often the case come July, but adding to the squeeze this year is the fact that Paris has been descended upon by hordes of Japanese tourists. You see them everywherebuying up paintings, perfumes and Persian rugsand of course dominating a great many

description: MONTAUK, L. I.The sharks sighted around here this season have been pretty smallaveraging only about 175 pounds. But on June 15, Capt. Frank Mundus and his fishing client, Harry Hoffman of Huntington, made a run aboard the Cricket II

title: West Side Poll
description: Have you been a victim of a robbery in the past year? Yes, answered 34.4 per cent of the women who responded to a questionnaire Representative Bella S. Abzug, Democrat from New York, sent to her constituents. The results were made public last week. Most respondents listed better educational and economic opportunities as the solution to the crime problem. But some of the women in Mrs. Abzug's predominantly liberal Congressional District, which stretches from Greenwich Village up the West Side of Manhattan and into Riverdale in the Bronx, favor direct action. When a mugger followed Mrs. Beatrice McCormack and her girl friend and tried to steal the two women's purses at Broadway and 104th Street late one night last week, Mrs. McCormack felled him with two punches. Then she sat on him until the police arrived. While Mrs. McCormack was waiting, a second mugger came by and snatched her purse. I figured it was better to have one in hand than to go chasing after the other, said Mrs. McCormack, a native of Wales who now manages a bar on Amsterdam Avenue and 98th Street

title: Linda Bowles Wed to W. M. Killea
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C., July 14 Miss Linda Lathem Bowles, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Andrew Bowles, was married here this morning to William Mendes Killea, son of Mr. and Mrs. John J. Killea of Scarsdale, N.Y.

title: Medford's Residents Remodel Town Themselves
description: MEDFORD  The architect's renderings for the Township Garage were beautiful, but, after one look at the cost!

title: Infant Smuggled Into U.S. In Handbag Allowed to Stay
description: MIAMI, July 14 (AP)  No words can express my feelings, Xiomara Aguilera said after learning that a baby she smuggled out of Spain will be allowed to stay in the United States.

title: What Ever Happened to Manifest Destiny Anyway?
description: THE Whitney Museum's new exhibition, The American Frontier: Images and Myths, is not vehement enough to knock any remaining props out from under a pseudoidealmanifest destiny, the winning of the west, and all thatheld dear by several generations of Americans, unless indeed those props are shaky enough by now to succumb to a gentle tap. The SO paintings by 50 19thcentury Americans show us Indians, wagon trains, and pioneer scouts like Daniel Boone in painted enactments of the stories we wanted to hear, as Patricia Hills, the Whitney's curator of 18th. and 19thcentury art, puts it in the catalogue Of her show. These stories are no longer acceptable, but, Mrs. Hills concludes, by probing their deeper meanings, we can learn more about ourselves and the development of our consciousness throughout the 19th century.

title: 200 in Lincoln Park Question Regional Sewer Plan
description: LINCOLN PARK  About 200 persons jammed the small Borough Hall here last week to censure or to express their fears about a $30million proposal that would provide sewer systems in three Morris County ccrnimunities and end their dumping of polluted material into the Passaic and Pompton Rivers.

title: Laurie Rosner a Bride
description: Miss Laurie Rosner, daughter of Mrs. Ruth Frances Rosner of New York and the late Lester Jerome Rosner, was married here last night. to Alan Stuart Dennis, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold Dennis of Springfield, N. J. Rabbi Reuben Levine of Springfield performed the ceremony at the Top of the One dub. The bride's father was administrative assistant commissioner of the city's Health Department. Mr. Dennis's father is a member of the Springfield Planning Board.

title: John Purcell Marries Miss Susan M. Caulo
description: HILLSDALE, N. J., July 14 Miss Susan Marie Caulo, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James Edward Caulo of Franklin Lakes, was married here this morning to John Joseph Purcell, son of Mrs. William Purcell of Summit and the late Mr. Purcell. The Rev. Christopher Whatley performed the ceremony in St. John the Baptist Roman Catholic Church.

title: Heidi Dolan to Be Wed to Lawyer
description: WILTON, Conn., July 14 Miss Heidi Dolan, assistant publicity director at Bergdorf Goodman in New York, plans to be married here in September to Bernard Coleman Baldwin 3d, an assistant district attorney for New York County.

title: Photos of Indonesia Shown in Princeton
description: PRINCETON  An exhibition of color photographs on Indonesia opens Wednesday at the Squibb Gallery. It will continue through Aug. 1.

title: Chapman Jones Marries Miss Preston
description: GREENWICH, Conn., July 14 Miss Dorothy Marilyn Preston, a magna CUM laude graduate of Williams College, and Chapman Michael Jones, a summa cum laude graduate of Williams, were married here today at noon in the First Presbyterian Church by the Rev. George A. Pera. A reception was given at the Indian Harbor Yacht Club, of which the bride's father is vice commodore.

title: 5 VEGETABLES RISE IN PRICE Ill WEEK

title: Being a Funny Girl Wasn't Enough
description: IT is just before the dress rehearsal of the American Shakespeare Theater's production of Macbeth. Backstage, the play's director, Michael Kahn, mournfully improvises some music on an old upright piano. On stage, the crew is struggling to fit the mammoth steel sets into place, and downstairs in the dressing rooms some of the actors talk worriedly among themselves because Macbeth is to open in 24 hours and so far there has never been a complete runthrough due to technical difficulties.

title: World News Briefs
description: CAIRO, July 14 (UPI)Hafez Ismail, an adviser to President Anwar elSadat, returned from a threeday visit to Moscow today and said the Soviet Union and Egypt were in total accord on their future relationchip and their views on the I'vriddle East crisis.

title: Russians Say They Took Photos of Reaction on Sun
description: MOSCOW, July 14 (UPI)Soviet scientists, using an eightton stratospheric observatory over central Asia, have photographed a powerful outburstapparently a nuclear reaction on the sun, the Tass press agency said today.

title: Lutheran Synod's Conservatives Win New Power
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 14 Conservative factions led by the Rev. Dr. Jacob A. O. Preus took firm control of the Lu1 theran ChurchMissouri Synod this week after more than four years of fierce struggle with church moderates.

title: Only the words intact
description: Right after World War II all good American novelists knew they were meant to write war novelsgenerally big onesand they did just that. But when even the best of these books are reread today, there is simplistic, almost primitive quality to them: Heroesgood, bad or absurdare off in foreign lands doing battle; war is seen as a heroic test. When Kurt Vonnegut recently tried for much more in Slaughterhouse Five, he ended up with a somewhat arch fantasy that still defined war as an experience separate from daily life. Of contemporary American writers, only Thomas Pynchon and John Hawkesin The Lime Twighave a complexity of vision that defines 20th  century war as an experience more profound than a merely per

title: Delaware Canal Now Historic Site
description: TRENTON The Delaware and Raritan Canal, built by man 140 years ago, has achieved the status of a National Historic Site.

description: WASHINGTON, July 14 (AP) The Senate confirmed today the nominations of John L. McLucas as Secretary of the Air Force and Gen. George S. Brown as Air Force chief of staff.

description: The New York Police Department has conducted an investigation to determine whether former Detectives John J. Caulfield and Anthony T. Ulasewicz improperly used the department's extensive intelligence files while working as political operatives for the Nixon Administration.

title: Patricia Curry Married
description: SYOSSET, L. I., July 14Miss Patricia M. Curry, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ora John Curry of Laurel Hollow, was married here this morning in the Roman Catholic Church of St. Edward Confessor to Peter Lawrence Eyl. He is a son of Mrs. Martin Feingold of Centerport and Henri Eyl of Cold Spring Harbor. The Rev. Henry Palmer performed the ceremony.

description: MIDDLEBURY, Conn., July 14Miss Laura Jane Davie and Gerald C. Tobin were married here this afternoon in the Congregational Church by the Rev. Michael Sheehan.

J., who founded the Music Circus in Lambertville, N. J., in 1949 to bring Broadway musicals to summer audiences gathered under tent in resort areas.

description: NEWBURGH, N. Y., July 14Six persons were killed and two others were injured here this aftermon when the car in which they were riding struck a truck, which tipped over onto a second car that in turn hit third, the police reported.

description: LAKE PLACID, N.Y., July 14 Billy's Pebble, ridden by Jim Kohn, for Mrs. Alpha May Beamer, of Westlake Village, Calif., won the Grand Prix at the Lake Placid horse show today over some of the most talented jumpers in the country.

Newell, son of Mrs. Frances Wendt of Modjeska Canyon, Calif., and the late Robert F. Newell. The Rev. Charles Granstrand performed the ceremony at nuptial mass.

Lyon, became the bride of David Charles Maurer, son of Mr. and Mrs. John D. Maurer of Horseheads, N. Y. The Rev. Ronald Miller performed the ceremony.

description: TRENTONFor more than three centuries, New Jersey communities have been shaping their destinies with a minimum of state interference.

A two; foot piece of pipe was also recovered from the shallow grave which was found by a stroller just off Ft George Hill The police termed the death an apparent homicide, pending an antopsy.

description: TRENTON  Recent court decisions that have made the state shut down its program of aid to private and parochial schools are forcing education officials to find a way to use $2.5million in school equipment.

title: To the loser belong (much of) the spoils; Indispensable Enemies; The Politics of Misrule in America. By Walter Karp. 308 pp. New York: Saturday Review Press. $8.95.
description: I feel it our duty to be cynical toward politicians. But Walter Karp goes so far beyond this duty's call that his cynicism takes on a heroic note. I know what he is getting at, and mainly agree with him, when he calls Woodrow Wilson a racist warmonger. But I'm afraid I would hem and haw that judgment out through many qualifiers. He just speaks it plain, with headlong candor. Many detected something false in George McGovern's Presidential moralizings, but few would brush them aside as the words of a poltroon, a hypocrite, a sheep in plastic wolf's clothing. Karp is knowledgeable and complex; but he writes a barroom brawl of

title: Three Men Take $10,000 From Aged Queens Couple
description: An elderly Queens couple were held up and robbed of $10,000 in their Ozone Park home early yesterday by three men, two of them armed, the police reported.

title: Peron; A Takeover In Name As Well?; The World
description: BUENOS AIRESWhen the Peronists resumed control of the Argentine Government on May 25 after 18 years of exile, there was never any doubt that the man who had absolute authority was former dictator Juan Domingo Per6n.

title: T.F.UpsonFiance Of Barbara Secor
description: CHILMARK, Mass., July 14 Mr. and Mrs. William J. Secor Jr. of Middlebury, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Barbara Wynne Secor, to Thomas Fisher Upson, son of Mr. and Mrs. J. Warren Upson of Woodbury, Conn. Both families have summer homes in this community on Martha's Vineyard.

title: Commuter Fare Rise?; Mr. Ronan Goes to the Brink Again; The Region
description: William J. Ronan is not John Foster Dulles but it is still worth examining he neatness with which the art of brinkmanship is being practiced these days by Mr. Ronan. As chairman of New York's Metropolitan Transportazion Authority, he is acquiring a reputation as the complete commuter cold warrior.

title: U.S. Agencies Investigate Texas Electricity Shortage
description: HOUSTON, July 14Two Federal agencies are investigating whether a major electricity shortage this summer in Texas was caused by corporate scheming or the energy crisis.

title: Mary McNamara Bride
description: UXBRIDGE, Mass., July 14 The marriage of Miss Mary M. McNamara, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John J. McNamara, to Bruce A. Willey of Cos Cob, Conn., son of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert C. Willey of North Conway, N. H., took place here this afternoon in St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church. The Rev. John R. McCall performed the ceremony. The bridegroom is director of marketing with Western Union International in New York.

description: Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Frydenzohn of Forest Hills, Queens, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Lee Gail Frydenzohn, to Joseph Weisbord, son of Mr. and Mrs. Tobia Weisbord of Bayside, Queens.

title: String Musicians Plan Conference
description: NEW BRUNSWICKSome 300 students, teachers and professional musicians are expected to attend the ninth annual New Jersey Summer Conference of the American String Teachers Association. The conference will Ile held July 28 to Aug. 4 on the Douglass College campus of Rutgers.

title: Jury Deadlock Causes a Mistrial In Trust Suit on CastIron Pipes
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., July 14 An antitrust case brought by 700 municipal water boards against six major American manufacturers of castiron pipe has ended in a mistrial and will be retried, possibly in January, 1974.
