description: WASHINGTON, July 30The Pentagon acknowledged today that the Army had always had active intelligence and counter inteligence programs in West Germany, but denied a report that Army intelligence was con dulcting a campaign of surveil lance against German civilians without the knowledge of Ger man authorities.

title: Fundamentalist Section in Dallas Drops $1Million Slander Suit
description: DALLAS, July 30The Dal las Colony of the Children of God has dropped a $1.1million libel and slander suit that was filed 22 months ago against a group of parents who had picketed in protest against the Fundamentalist sect.

title: Weary Watergate Committee to Continue Inquiry During Congressional Recess
description: WASHINGTON, July 30The Senate Select Committee on Presidential Campaign Activi ties, despite weariness, decided today to lengthen the hours of its hearings and to press ahead until it had completed the Watergate phase of its inquiry.

title: Dow Slides 2.94 Points In a LowVolume Session
description: The stock market continued to drift sluggishly yesterday under the weight of profittak ing following two weeks of ris ing prices.

title: HALDEMAN SAYS HE AND NIXON HAD NO WATERGATE KNOWLEDGE; HEARD TAPES PLAYED RECENTLY
description: WASHINGTON, July 30H. R. Haldeman declared today that lie and President Nixon were innocent of any involve ment in the Watergate breakin or coverup, but that they had been badly misled by John W. Dean 3d and others.

title: Bonn Investigation On
description: BONN, July 30A West Ger man Government spokesman said today that Bonn was con fidentially investigating a report, printed in The New York Times on Saturday, of telephone tapping and intelligence surveil alnce of West German civilian organizations and individuals by American military agents  activities that some of the agents believe are illegal.

title: White House Said to Bar Compromise Over Tapes
description: WASHINGTON, July 30The White House all but rejected to day proposals for a compromise in the constitutional struggle over access to Presidential tape recordings dealing with the Watergate case.

title: Hunt Goes Into Fifth Day For Connecticut Child, 7
description: TOLLAND, Conn., July 30 (AP)We have to keep searching because we don't have anything else to go on, a state trooper said as plans were mapped for the fifth day of the hunt for 7yearold Jan ice Pockett.

title: Roundup: Carlton Beats Pirates in His '72 Style
description: It takes a very cool in dividual to withstand sudden fame and fortune. It is even more difficult for a profes sional athlete. Take last year's Cy Young Award winners, Steve Carlton of Philadelphia and Gaylord Perry of Cleve land, for example.

title: Assisting Youthful Inmates Puts Strain on Ombudsmen
description: HUDSON, N. Y.  An ex perimental ombudsman pro gram, begun a year ago, has brought significant gains in the human and legal rights of the troubled teenagers who live in institutions run by the Stale Division for Youth.

title: New York Watergate Viewing 30% Below Nation's
description: An analysis of viewer re sponse to the televised Water gate hearings shows that New Yorkers have been surprisingly

title: TWO HELD IN MURDER IN UNDERWORLD FEUD
description: Two alleged underworld fig ures were arrested at their homes in Brooklyn and Queens early yesterday and charged with the murder of a man in a Staten Island bar two months ago in what the police described as a dispute among criminal elements.

title: Panel Seeks U.S. Envoy's Views
description: WASHINGTON, July 30The House Foreign Affairs Commit tee announced today that it I had asked the Ambassador to Greece, Henry J. Tasca, to re turn to Washington to testify on political conditions under the militarybacked Govern ment in Athens.

title: Butcher Still Gets Beef
description: In Brooklyn, the owner of a meat market where much as 30,000 pounds of meat is sold weekly, described the practices he said he and other independent butchers had to follow to assure themselves a supply of beef despite shortages attributed to the price ceiling.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: New Hampshire natives will have a twoday deer hunting season of their own this year.

title: CONVICTS REFUSE TO REENTER CELLS
description: McALESTER, Okia., July 30 (UPI)More than 600 prisoners camped in a fencedoff portion of the Oklahoma state prison today and retused to enter the cellblocks out of fear of re prisals from other inmates. They charged that there were lots of dead inmates whose bodies had not been found in the charred ruins of the prison after a weekend of rioting.

title: Puppy Rescued From Well
description: NASHVILLE, July 30 (UPI) A cave explorer today plucked an eightweekold mongrel pup py from a 90foot well where it became trapped yesterday. The dog was brought to the surface by Mike Monynihan, 19 years old, who was lowered into the hole with a harness around hi waist. The puppy, trapped for 24 hours and 15 minutes, appeared unharmed.

title: 76ers Open at Home Oct.10
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 30 (UPI)The Philadelphia 76ers Will open the National Basket ball Association season under their new head coach, Gene Shue, Oct. 10, against the Hous ton Rockets at the Spectrum. The club will play 37 games at the Spectrum and four at the Hershey (Pa.) Arena. They will not play any games in Pitts burgh as they did last season.

title: Guy Middleton, an Actor On the Stage and Screen
description: LONDON, July 30 (AP)Guy Middleton, an actor who spe cialized in portraying English cads, died at his country home today after a long illness. He was 65 years old.

title: Advertising: Shining P.R. Image
description: Madison Avenue and the publicrelations business have at least one thing in common an image problem.

title: Farm Union Posts Picket Lines After Contract Talks Break Off
description: DELANO, Calif., July 30 (AF)Cesar Chavez called his United Farm Workers out on strike today after negotiations with 29 table grape growers were broken off hours before a contract expiration at mid night.

title: AN EASING OF LAWS ON MARIJUANA URGED
description: HYANNIS, Mass., July 30 (AP)Legalization of the priv use of marijuana was proposed today by a 2to1 vote of a national conference of lawyers, judges, law professors and state officials who met here to plan model legislation.

title: RECYCLE PLAN SET FOR CONNECTICUT
description: HARTFORD, July 30  The General Electic Company pro posed today to build 10 re sourcerecovery plants in Connecticut to make fuel and recover other usable materials from the 10,000 tons of trash collected in the state each day.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: PARIS, July 30The dollar and the pound strengthened today upon a futher easing of interestrate tensions that threatened last week to preci pitate a new monetary crisis.

title: Chinese Yuan Revalued
description: HONG KONG, July 30 (Reu ters)The Bank of China said today it had revalued the yuan against the Hong Kong dollar by 1 per cent. The new rate for the yuan was 37.19 yuans per 100 Hong Kong dollars com pared to 37.57 yuans.

title: CARGILL IS OFFERING DEFERRED DELIVERY
description: Cargill, Inc., announced last night that it had offered a deferred delivery privilege to its foreign buyers of soybeans and soybean meal who were caught in the Government's control program.

title: Mysore's Given New Name
description: NEW DELHI, July 30 (Reu ters)The Indian Parliament today approved a bill to change the name of the south Indian state of Mysore to Karnataka a name given to the area in ancient literature. Renaming the state, once ruled from the city of Mysore by maharajas, is seen as a move to wipe out the last vestiges of the prince ly days.

title: Main TanakaNixon Items
description: Fulfilling a pledge made last September to President Nixon the Japanese Government has sharply reduced the huge $4.2billion imbalance in trade with the United States, so that by the end of this year the Japanese surplus is ex pected to be about $2billionor half last year's total. But although this will ease a major point of friction, trade re lations have been marked by continual problems, most recently the export curbs suddenly instituted by Wash ington on soybeans, lumber and scrap metal, which are major Japanese imports.

title: Glover, Man in Middle, Out to Prove He's Giant
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, N.J., July 30Rich Glover, college football's most hon ored lineman last year, be gan his professional career with the New York Giants today with praise from his new coach but with the words of skeptics and cynics still nagging at his pride.

title: Building Contracts Rose 19% in June And 14% for Half
description: New building contract awards during June rose 19 per cent to $9.9billion, from the level of June, 1972, the F. W. Dodge division of the McGrawHill In formation Systems Company reported yesterday.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Golf Scholarship Set Up for Black

title: Notes on People Stennis Discharged by Hospital
description: This is a happy day for me, said Senator John C. Stennis in a statement re leased by his office as he was discharged by the Walter Reed Army Medical Center yesterday after a stay of six months, while recovering from gunshot wounds suf fered in a holdup in January.

title: 800 Soviet Jews in Rome To Get Speedy Entry to U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, July 30 (Reu ters)Attorney General Elliot L. Richardson said today that he would use his special au thority to relax immigration regulations to allow 800 Soviet Jews now in Rome to quickly enter the United States.

title: Table for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New York
description: Hours are given in Eastern Daylight Time.

title: Credit Crunch?
description: Is the American economy headed into another credit crunch that could cause a serious slump in housing and business generally?

title: On Assessing Nixon Estate
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., July 30The California Board of Equalization refused today to order an investigation of the property tax assessment on President Nixon's estate at San Clemente.

title: Fire Damages  BrooklynStore
description: A twoalarm fire heavily damaged a food store in Brook lyn's Bath Beach neighborhood yesterday. Three firemen were injured slightly. The fire broke out about 2:18 A.M. at JO JO's Supermarket, 108 Avenue U. It was brought under control at 3:10 A.M., Fire officials said that, a slight explosion caused by oxygen evaporation had blown out the windows in the one story structure.

title: Magruder and His Family Are in London for Vacation
description: LONDON, July 30 (UPI)  Jeb Stuart Magruder, the for mer deputy director of the Committee for the ReElection of the President, refused to comment on the Watergate case today when he arrived here with his wife and four children for a vacation.

title: Jersey Upheld on FishKill Fines
description: TOMS RIVER, July 30  New Jersey today won the right to collect damages from polluters in a precedentsetting decision that is expected to in spire new rounds of litigation against those found guilty of damaging the state's waterways and marshlands.

title: Police Check Led Zeppelin Party for Clue in Theft
description: A predawn party by the Led Zeppelin rock quartet in the Drake Hotel drew the attention yesterday of detectives inves tigating the disappearance on Sunday of $180,000 in cash concert receipts from a double locked hotel safedeposit box.

title: Youth Slain on Street
description: The police are investigating the knifing death of 18year old Kenneth Lee of 201 West 84th Street, shortly before midnight last night. The youth was found lying on the side walk outside of 320 West 84th Street, unconscious from stab wounds of the cheat. Taken to Roosevelt Hospital, he was pronounced dead on arrival.

title: Iranian Official Urges Oil Compromise
description: The Iranian Ambassador Jahangir Annizegar, said yes terday that producing nations, consuming nations and the in ternational oil companies must compromise on their respective goals if a mutually beneficial and stable world oil trade is to be maintained.

title: House Members of Both Parties Attack Ehrlichman's Testimony
description: WASHINGTON, July 30 (AP) Republican and Democratic House members took the floor today to criticize the Presi ident's former chief adviser for domestic affairs, John D. Ehr lichman, in light of his testi mony before the Senate Water gate committee.

title: MISS BROCK DANCES ROLE IN HOFFMANN
description: Tales of Hoffmann, a pro duction new to American Ballet Theater this season, received a very hesitant performance Sun day evening at the State Thea ter. Part of it was because of ill chance, but only part of it.

title: 281 Shot First in Jersey
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., July 30 (UPI)Sally M. Gibson's Sadairs Starlet, at 281 the longest shot in the field of eight, captured the $12,000 allowance feature today at Monmouth Park by 1 lengths.
